story:
The CulDeSack Kids is a throwback to a time when social networking meant going outside to play and bullies had to look you in the eye...with some pretty sweet music as well by Suburbia's famous hometown band... Bron Don. 

The project was put in motion on June 26th of this past year at exactly 9:44 PM when Director Rich Akullian heard Jalen Rose call Jay Bilas & Bill Simmons "Cul-de-sac kids" during the NBA draft.  As if he was struck by lightning he immediately thought of creating a 90's clique called "The CulDeSack Kids" with main characters featuring last names Culver, Decrescente & protagonist (Steven Owen) Sackley.  

Within 15 minutes Akullian had already been on the phone with his fellow Producers (Thomas Murray & Eric Shovah) and the journey was officially underway.  Exactly one month later Akullian left his job to focus on this project full time. 

49 days later we found the best cast ever at a crowded audition.  We quickly developed team chemistry and started shooting less than a month later.   With initial intentions of shooting a self-financed full chapterized film the project ran into complications.  Akullian's Father had gone into the hospital with a diabetes complication and eventually lost a long hard battle to save his leg.  

Big Richard was a major character in the overall script and when his health declined the project was an afterthought.   However, he wouldn't "stand" for any cease in the project and we re-wrote the script from the hospital cafeteria.  Upon the first day he was strong enough we shot an adjusted scene and completed a 30 minute pilot of our story.  

We have so many more stories to tell and our journey is just beginning.  


To continue this project we need to be connected to the right network (Netflix, Hulu, FXX, Comedy Central, etc.)  or raise additional finances to stay completely independent.  

With any finances that we raise, we will be donating 10% to be split by Make-A-Wish & The American Diabetes Association.  Without these two organizations our project wouldn't have ever happened.  

Once you have contributed we will reach out to get sizes and any other details to fulfill your perks!

T-Shirts Available: 

-White/Black CulDeSack Kids

-Black/Yellow CulDeSack Kids

-White/Black "Big Foot" Dick 


Sweatshirts Available:

-Gray/Black #CDSK Front & CulDeSack Kids Logo Back


Posters Available: Poster 1, Poster 2, Poster 3. 

Finances raised would be utilized in the following way: 

$0 - $5,000 Invested in the extension of our project

-Finances will be committed to maintaining CulDeSackKids.com and used for social marketing ad buys of current 30 minute pilot and story.  

-Further establishing The CulDeSack Kids business entity 

$5,000 - $10,000 Shoot another 30 minutes

-  We will set up to shoot another 30 minute piece.  Depending on budget available there is the potential to use some of this towards outsourcing high production value pieces (website, video, etc.)

$10,000 - $25,000 Shoot another 60 minutes

-  We will set up to shoot a 60 minute extension piece to our current pilot.  Depending on budget available there is the potential to use some of this towards outsourcing high production value pieces (website, video, etc.)

-  Potential for daily rates for primary cast

$25,000 +  Shoot the full season/film as originally designed.

-  We will set up to execute the whole film project as originally intended 90-120 minutes.

-  Depending on budget available there is the potential to use some of this towards outsourcing high production value pieces (website, video, etc.)

-  Potential for daily rates for primary cast

-  Potential for daily rates for production & assistants.

story:
As seen in Turkish Publication, Cover Magazine: 



My name is Julia Maryanska, and I've been making Documentaries for 11 yrs. I've worked alongside Academy-Award nominated and Emmy Award winning filmmakers, telling world stories about war, injustice, human rights abuses, violence and fear. While I felt these were important stories for the world to know, a few years ago, I woke up and realized that if I wanted to make a positive impact in this world, it would be by creating imagery of beauty and LOVE – not fear.



What's it about?

UNION is a feature length film that, through my insider's perspective, shows the intricate worlds of 6 truly unconventional love relationships. These men and women are living examples of the pioneers of new paradigms of relationships – from redefining "til death do us part" to raising kids in community to skillfully navigating open relationships. They make art out of the the ways they love while leading successful and impact-driven businesses, building communities, raising children, and more. This film is my personal exploration of my own experience in navigating the most taboo topics in love, sex and relationships and unearths the answers we're all hungry for.


With your support, THE FUNDS RAISED WILL TAKE US TO THE NEXT STEP of production and allow us to present more material to producers and investors to secure more traditional forms of film funding. We'll then start to move into post-production, and secure a very highly skilled editor who can get us started on cutting together the feature-length film! 



What We Need & What You Get

Curious to know more? Here's what the $50,000 will go towards. It's only a portion of our larger budget, and will take us a long way!
  • PRODUCTION: $10,000 will go towards completing production in the Bay Area and NYC. This includes interviews like the ones you see above, and having a crew to capture using the fly on the wall, cinema verité approach, which means getting behind the scenes to bring you an intimate look into the real-time unfolding of these worlds
  • $20,000 will go towards hiring a top-notch storytelling editor. Documentaries get made in the Editing room! We need to begin cuting so we can see what other footage is necessary to complete our story. This will also enable us to have a more comprehensive story to present to producers and film investors who can help us to raise the rest of the film's budget.
  • $10,000 will go to our Producing team (these are veterans of film marketing, composition, sound design, copywriting, storytelling, and distribution) who will help move this film to the next stage of production, and get it before the eyes of new film investors, network and theatre programmers who will want to buy, fund and distribute the film!


THE PERKS!!! The Perks are the best part!!! 
The perks offered on this campaign are some of the most cutting edge tools and products from the people featured in this film. The point of this film is to share the insights, knowledge and wisdom from the featured couples. These men and women are the pioneers and thought leaders of cutting edge doctrines having to do with sex, relationships, family, community and money.

YOU CAN EXPECT:
  • Relationship coaching
  • Audio Books
  • Most cutting edge marketing tools 
  • Limited edition Movie Poster
  • Credit in the film
  • Your own Photoshoot with the director & supermodel Kim Iglinsky
  • VIP Immersion on any topic you want with members of the cast
  • and much more...
Learn from the communicators/relationships experts while supporting this project. I've harvested the best pieces of gold from them! Take a peak and see what piece of knowledge you're craving to get. There are tons of options!

5 Reasons Why This Film Will Be a Major Success:

  • TEAM: We have a team of Award-winning filmmakers, producers, sound designers, artists and cinematographers on board!
  • DISTRIBUTION: Our film has guaranteed distribution and a very unique marketing plan that ensures theatrical release.
  • ANGLE: We have a unique blend of art, animation and live action that pushes the genre of documentary into a compelling new arena.
  • SUBJECT: We are exploring the most provocative questions about the most universally relatable subject – LOVE!  
  • AUDIENCE: Between all the subject in the film, we have millions combined in mailing lists of fans and followers who are itching to buy tickets to the finished film.


The Impact: WHY MAKE A FILM ABOUT PROVOCATIVE WAYS TO LOVE?
  • NEED NEW MODELS: Our world needs more positive models for relating, and better examples for how to navigate challenges. Building Relationships is a basic human skill! Yet it's one we're quite poor and at and it's not taught well.
  • THERE IS AN AUDIENCE: There are millions out there, just like YOU, who are just as curious about how to have more epic love, and better relationships! Let's talk about these subjects in the mainstream!
  • WE HAVE THE EXPERIENCE: I've raised $25,000 for Academy Award nominated filmmaker Judith Ehrlich (Most Dangerous Man in America: Daniel Ellsberg and the Pentagon Papers). My collaborators and producers have worked on 100s of Hollywoods film and Network Television shows, and they know what they are doing when it comes to creating high-end media!


HOW YOU CAN HELP SUPPORT, WITH FUNDS AND OTHERWISE:
  • FACEBOOK: Share the trailer and Indiegogo Page on Facebook, sharing what you find most inspiring about this project. (https://www.facebook.com/uniondocumentary)
  • TWITTER: Tweet your most provocative question about love and hashtag #artoflove and #uniondocumentary (Follow: https://twitter.com/JulesMarsky)
  • EMAIL: Email this link to 5 friends encouraging them to match your donation!

GRATITUDE!!!
We're so grateful for your contributions! 
It's makes a huge difference to have your support!  This film is in part about the power of coming together in community, and you are now a part of that tapestry! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Zachary and Malcolm have known each other for years, and converse regularly about many aspects of popular culture, from fan-casting movies, to what they're watching on TV, even to pitching each other story ideas. This podcast will be an outlet to share what they discuss, an opportunity to look inside the minds of these two creative types and how they process the world of pop culture around them.

What We Need & What You Get

Now, in order to make this podcast happen, the Hatchers (as in "Down The," not "Teri") need a few things. First and foremost, a recorder to get all the good conversations. Secondly, editing software and good headphones, so everyone can enjoy the podcast at its maximum potential, without ridiculous background noises or pauses. Finally, some things to make the recording process a little more comfortable, such as chairs, a table, and a mic stand for the recorder.
Now, we realize we are asking for a lot from all of you possible donators. That's why we've developed a few cool incentives for donation levels. Here's the breakdown:

For any amount:
You will get "name-dropped" in our debut episode, so everyone will know who made this possible!

For $15-$39:
You will receive digital copies of the first few episodes. Enjoy them in a different format! More details to come.

For $40-$79:
You will receive some "Down the Hatch" mystery swag, as soon as we get the particulars worked out. Could be a shirt, could be some comics, could be a movie or two, could be anything! MYSTERIOUS!

For $80-$149:
You will receive one of the greatest gifts of all: naming rights to one of our segments. We'll tell you what the segment will be about, and YOU get to title it. Leave your stamp on our podcast forever! (Only three of these. Better do it fast!)

For $150-$199:
You will get to guest star on a future episode! Come sit in with the Hatchers. As they discuss some cool stuff, and be an active participant in the show's first game! (Only two of these. Jump on it!)

For $200 and up:
The greatest prize of all: A Bromantic (or for those ladies out there, Romantic) Date Night with the host of your choosing! Feel the love and appreciation as we take you for some food, check out a movie, and more. A little one-on-one time with one of our eligible podcasters? Feel like you're on one of ABC's hit shows, "The Bachelor" or "The Bachelorette!"

The Impact

This show will be fun for everyone involved including viewers and the hosts.

We will have guests on to show support for local talent to help spread the word on the awesome stuff they create.

We are currently still in early development of this idea but we hope to launch during April or May. 

We are still assembling a small team to work on this with us. We are also looking for the perfect place to shoot this so we can record it and put it on Youtube since we believe a visual element helps add to the fun.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't throw in a few bucks don't fret! Even if you just share our Indiegogo campaign it helps us quite a bit. Tell your family, friends and colleagues about us to help spread the word!

story:
Please Take a minute to watch the video and get a taste of what PTSD is like from both the person suffering but, the family as well.

Meet Curtis who has been diagnosed with Severe PTSD. He is a 35 year old US Army veteran, a stepfather and expectant father to a son due April 2015. He was managing until taking a job with a state law enforcement agency. A year into that job and after several incidents, his mind reached it's "breaking point" for lack of better terms. He finally through the urging of friends and the handful of family members that he has left sought the help that he so desperately needed. Early on, he had attempted suicide on a few occasions. He has since pledged to no longer be a statistic and live to be a father and husband his family needs. With urging from his therapists and his doctor he is currently in search of a service dog only to discover that he and his family cannot afford one. Help impact not only his life but, all those he comes in contact with.

What We Need & What You Get

  • 100% of the funds will be paid directly to cover the cost of his service dog. 
  • Make the sacrifice to make a positive impact on someone who has been so willing to do that themselves.
  • Any additional funds would go to ensure the safe delivery of his service dog then be donated to "The Battle Buddy Foundation". www.TBBF.org

The Impact

Curtis has already had two TIA's (Transient ischemic attack / "mini-stroke") and most recently a heart attack all linked to stress.

  • Help improve Curtis' and his family's quality of life.
  • His clinicians have stated how this can reduce the need for as many medications and could possibly be able to no longer need any more medications.
  • Help him overcome the wounds that you cannot see.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you do not have the funds, doesn't mean that you can't help! 

  • Spread the word ad share with those who may be able to!
  • Contribute to other organizations to help others who are in need regardless of the cause.

story:
Wow, we have finally made it...

To our very first crowd-funding campaign. And we are shooting for the stars in the hopes that family, friends, their families and friends, and YOU can help us get there!

Our hope is that you are here because you want to know more about Will2Win and how you can help. My mother and I are both visual people, and so throughout the campaign we will be providing all forms of media as updates. They wont be Spielbergs' but you will get the idea.

**Possible Blooper Reel Release... hmmmm**

Campaign Updates:

Week 2 -

Yes, it is true... Our momentum has slowed down a bit but we are about to pull out some of our campaign surprises!! My mom and I have been busy working with local businesses to secure more perks for our charitable donators. We are also in the beginning stages of planning a satellite location for Will2Win, allowing some of our Georgia supporters the chance to see us in person and ask any questions they may have about the campaign.

And our first orders of perks should be arriving soon!!

Week 1 -

Again we would like to thank EVERYONE for donating to Will2Win in the first week of our campaign!! We are so humbled by the support that we have received and would like to personally thank our first 20 contributors!

-Ben, Jamie, Robert, Patricia (Patty), cousin Corky, Tony, Lissette (Brisa Suave), Briceli, Briana (Bri), Malcolm (AKA Dearest), Pamela (Miss Pam), Vitoria, Karishma (Izzy), JJ, Dorian, PursueDestiny1, Angelo, Justin (JAC), and Corrina!!

Thank you 20 for starting our campaign with faith and love! Your confidence is invaluable…

Though we are only at 1% we have made strides in accomplishing our goals. Here are some things that happened this week, Will2Win has:

  • Began Community Outreach Initiatives for physical Will2Win fundraisers; more updates to come!

  • Started working with a professional videographer/editor in relation to promotional materials.

  • Designed and ordered our Will2Win postcards, shirt buttons, and pens!! We are hoping to get these materials ASAP so we can start sending out Will2Win perks for our donors.

We are off to a steady start, please continue to support Will2Win by sharing our page or liking our posts. Let’s keep moving forward!

I want to give you all some background information about the women behind this campaign.

Founder/CEO, Monica Williams (my mom) served for over 5 years in the US Army Europe. Serving in the military allowed her to attain her BA in Arts and Entertainment Management from Colombia College Chicago and more recently her MBA from Keller Graduate School of Management. My mom's passions can be described easily: love and service. She loves service so much that she has decided to dedicate her life in to helping women that are in a position she was once in. Having been a homeless lady veteran with two children, she has real life experience in these situations and recognizes the need for support; and so Will2Win was born.

My name is Kai'Triana, though everyone calls me Kay. I am a Florida State University graduate, with a BA in Literature and a BA in Humanities, and a member of Hermandad de Sigma Iota Alpha, Inc. I am currently enrolled at Keller Graduate School of Management in the hopes of following in my mom's footsteps and attaining my MBA.

So why do we want to help?

As a single mother raising two girls, my sister and I, we had ups and downs. But with a lot help and support we made it. Everyone, but especially women only families, needs help sometimes.

It is sadly ironic that in some states, veterans make up upwards of 50% of the homeless population. How is this possible when these people served our country so that we could all have homes and all the freedoms we are afforded. Shouldn't we care for them when they come home?

Give you numbers, you say?

In most states, homeless veterans were typically found in shelters. However, in five states, the majority of homeless veterans were living in unsheltered locations: MT (63%), CA (63%), NV (60%), HI (58%), and GA (55%).

In Georgia 60.2% of homeless individuals are unsheltered 12,403 homeless 7,471 unsheltered

Homeless veteran count by state 2014 GA - 1443

55.2% of homeless veterans were unsheltered 1,443 homeless  796 unsheltered 

Cite: The U.S Department of Housing and Urban Development Office of Community Planning and Development, 2014 AHAR: Part1 – PIT Estimate

The U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) estimates that 49,933 veterans are homeless on any given night.  The U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) states that the nation’s homeless veterans are predominantly male, with roughly 8% being female. 

Also in 2010 article an entitled “Risk Factors for Homeless Women Veterans,” in the Journal of Health Care for the Poor and Underserved, provided research that proved that homeless lady veterans were significantly less likely to be college educated, married, have health insurance and much more. And these are events in life that are standard in America. It also stated that "women who served are 3 to 4 times more likely to become homeless, than non veterans."

So how will Will2Win address these issues?

Veteran women have the ability to maintain, push forward, get it done; believe me, I have seen it in action. But sometimes when one has multiple traumatic experiences…births, graduations, marriages, addictions, death, abuse, homelessness, setbacks, repossessions, evictions, joblessness, relocations etc, a support team is critical to forward progress. Personally, I don’t know where we would be right now, after all that has happened if it were not for friends and family that hung in there thru the highs and the lows. 

Will2Win is just that support, 360 degree support 24/7. We know that having more than just the essentials (food, shelter, clothing) are necessary to turn your life around. Some people need more support than others. 

The Bone Structure of Will2Win:

Goal:    To empower veteran women with the support needed to become self-sufficient.
Mission:   To empower women veterans to strive for excellence in all aspects of their lives; psychologically, physically, emotionally, educationally, and financially.
Vision:    To become the most successful service provider of women veterans.
The five components of the program address all of those needs:

  • Will2Win back my mental health will provide the connection with mental health professionals who can aid in helping addressing triggers to nonproductive behaviors that destroy or negate being a successful person.

  • Will2Win back my physical health will re instill the ideal that exercise and a healthy diet is consistent with good health practices.  This also includes instruction, information, and presentation of a healthy diet.

  • Will2Win back my educational health will encompass setting a goal to achieve a desired educational goal whether that be a certification, Associates, Bachelors or Masters degree. The main goal is to get the veteran to a point where she can support herself thru gainful employment.

  • Will2Win back my emotional health will utilize the in house community support system as well as daily and weekly activities to stimulate desire to be responsibly sociable.

  • Will2Win back my financial health will instill the values of maintaining a bank/savings account, responsible spending, credit repair, and home purchase.

Put simply, our goal is to buy a house that our clients and their families can use to get back on their feet and catch up to the world around them. The families will live side by side with other families, similar to their own, helping to create stable relationships and extend each families’ support system. While living in the home, clients are helped to find jobs and childcare, taken to health and/or counseling appointments; but most of all given the security of a stable, healthy, clean environment with all their necessities.

All services will be tailored to the individual receiving services based on an assessment and intake questionnaire. 

So, why did we choose to crowd fund?

In order for Will2Win to become eligible for government, corporate grants or other large funding opportunities we need to show we are capable of successful business operations for 1 to 2 years. As a startup organization you must be able to prove your ability to raise and manage funds. Thus one of many marketing and promotional endeavors for Will2Win is our first crowd funding campaign. Plus, this is an easy way for our friends and family to donate funds and share our mission through their social media.

What is needed to make Will2Win a viable option?

•  Cost of 501 c 3 now vs fiscal agent

•  Equipment/Supplies (Computers, HMIS (federal accountability), marketing)

•  Location costs (Lot price, Furniture, Zoning/Inspections, and much more)

•  Gala to create awareness/raise funds for late 2015/2016 operations

•  Staffing needs

What have we already done to work toward our objective?

(In progress) business plan/research/revision to make information covered pertinent to GA vs IL

- obtained my FEIN number

- obtained waiver for business license fees in GA (under disabled veteran status)

- Networking with local organizations/event attendance to acclimate ourselves to services currently being offered to homeless or at risk of being homeless women veterans in Georgia.

- obtained domain for website Will2WinAtlanta.com (going to also purchase .org)

- obtained dedicated business phone line

- completed home office set up

- plus countless hours spent researching, cataloguing, networking, and much more in the building Will2Win.

**For example – Just the writing, recording, and editing for this campaign took almost 20 hours!! Mind you, neither of us is extremely tech savvy, hence the blooper reel hint earlier.**

The funds raised here will go towards the ground work needed to establish a location for Will2Win. We are not just seeking large donations. We actually figured out that if thru each of you sharing with each of your friends and everyone gave a dollar, we’d need 75,000 contacts to be informed on the campaign. We are also seeking volunteers, sponsors, and donations to equip our facility with all of the tools necessary to operate. Bonus if you have a building, we could use that too.

As this comes to a close, I hope you feel that you know a little bit more about Will2Win and my family. I hope that you are so excited that you cannot wait to join the movement!! I cannot mention enough that we need all the help that we can get.

Contact me personally as Kai.Gully@Will2WinAtlanta.com, if none of the levels of contribution fit your specific donation.

Thank you for all the support that we have received thus far and please continue to spread the word.
**Keep checking back with us for updates, we have a few fun things planned.**

Veterans put their lives on the line in service to this country.  Be willing to commit to help end homelessness among veteran women.  We need your help!  Help us help them regain stability and rebuild themselves.  Help us help them by giving your support today.  Share our fb page with your network.  Share the link to our crowdfunding event.  Share the message we need to make a collaborative effort to end homeless.  Every dollar counts. Thank you! And Hoo’a
story_txt:
Wow, we have finally made it...
To our very first crowd-funding campaign. And we are shooting for the stars in the hopes that family, friends, their families and friends, and YOU can help us get there!
Our hope is that you are here because you want to know more about Will2Win and how you can help. My mother and I are both visual people, and so throughout the campaign we will be providing all forms of media as updates. They wont be Spielbergs' but you will get the idea.
**Possible Blooper Reel Release... hmmmm**
Campaign Updates: Week 2 - Yes, it is true... Our momentum has slowed down a bit but we are about to pull out some of our campaign surprises!! My mom and I have been busy working with local businesses to secure more perks for our charitable donators. We are also in the beginning stages of planning a satellite location for Will2Win, allowing some of our Georgia supporters the chance to see us in person and ask any questions they may have about the campaign. And our first orders of perks should be arriving soon!!Week 1 - 

Again we would like to thank EVERYONE for donating to
Will2Win in the first week of our campaign!! We are so humbled by the support
that we have received and would like to personally thank our first 20
contributors! 
-Ben, Jamie, Robert, Patricia (Patty), cousin Corky, Tony,
Lissette (Brisa Suave), Briceli, Briana (Bri), Malcolm (AKA Dearest), Pamela
(Miss Pam), Vitoria, Karishma (Izzy), JJ, Dorian, PursueDestiny1, Angelo,
Justin (JAC), and Corrina!!
Thank you 20 for starting our campaign with faith and love!
Your confidence is invaluable…
Though we are only at 1% we have made strides in
accomplishing our goals. Here are some things that happened this week, Will2Win
has: 

Began Community Outreach Initiatives for physical
Will2Win fundraisers; more updates to come!
Started working with a professional
videographer/editor in relation to promotional materials. 
Designed and ordered our Will2Win postcards,
shirt buttons, and pens!! We are hoping to get these materials ASAP so we can
start sending out Will2Win perks for our donors. 

We are off to a steady start, please continue to support
Will2Win by sharing our page or liking our posts. Let’s keep moving forward!
I want to give you all some background information about the women behind this campaign.
Founder/CEO, Monica Williams (my mom) served for over 5 years in the US Army Europe. Serving in the military allowed her to attain her BA in Arts and Entertainment Management from Colombia College Chicago and more recently her MBA from Keller Graduate School of Management. My mom's passions can be described easily: love and service. She loves service so much that she has decided to dedicate her life in to helping women that are in a position she was once in. Having been a homeless lady veteran with two children, she has real life experience in these situations and recognizes the need for support; and so Will2Win was born.
My name is Kai'Triana, though everyone calls me Kay. I am a Florida State University graduate, with a BA in Literature and a BA in Humanities, and a member of Hermandad de Sigma Iota Alpha, Inc. I am currently enrolled at Keller Graduate School of Management in the hopes of following in my mom's footsteps and attaining my MBA.
So why do we want to help?
As a single mother raising two girls, my sister and I, we had ups and downs. But with a lot help and support we made it. Everyone, but especially women only families, needs help sometimes.
It is sadly ironic that in some states, veterans make up upwards of 50% of the homeless population. How is this possible when these people served our country so that we could all have homes and all the freedoms we are afforded. Shouldn't we care for them when they come home?

Give you numbers, you say?
In most states, homeless veterans were typically found in shelters.
However, in five states,
the majority of homeless veterans were living in unsheltered locations: MT
(63%), CA (63%), NV (60%), HI (58%), and GA (55%).
In
Georgia 60.2% of homeless individuals are unsheltered 12,403 homeless 7,471
unsheltered
Homeless
veteran count by state 2014 GA - 1443
55.2%
of homeless veterans were unsheltered 1,443 homeless  796 unsheltered

story:
Assassin Nine is a five-part spy-comedy web series about Agent J9, Janine, an offensive security specialist in the S.E.R.P.E.N.T. Corporation, a multinational conglomerate who happens to be planning global domination. She's the world's greatest assassin, but never lands the big assignments because she doesn't have the seduction skills necessary for the more delicate missions.

She has to get her act together or face termination. Literally.

To overcome her shaky relationships with the HR director, Gladys, and her eccentric, if somewhat sociopathic, CEO, the Komodo, she'll have to get help from her chief rival, an Eastern-European vixen with nothing but contempt for her, Bogdana. Or her next mission could be her last.

                                                       


Assassin Nine is part spy-comedy and part corporate-satire. But above that, it’s something that we all believe in. It's a project that we’re excited to share with the world, and we'd like to invite you to join our corporate family.

Sneak Peeks
We've put together a few clips as a preview of the series. 

Bogdana's Seduction Tip
Bogdana gives Agent J9 a last minute hint on seducing a target.


Serpent Survival
The Komodo gives his assassins a little reminder of their role in the organization. 


Janine's Resume
Agent J9 gives the reasons why she's the best of the best of S.E.R.P.E.N.T. 


Career Goals
HR challenges Janine on her future at S.E.R.P.E.N.T. 


Our primary goal is to raise enough funds to complete the post process. Our secondary goal is to cover all of our production costs, including equipment rental, location fees and principle talent. And finally, we want to make sure that everyone — from our volunteer PAs to our extras to our lighting assistants to our script supervisor — gets compensated for their contributions to the project. Short films are largely made with favors, but we want to break that trend.


World domination isn't easy, but we’ve assembled a killer team to make this project happen. 

An actor, director and producer, Carrie Jones is one of the creators of the interactive theater experience, My Big Fat Jewish Wedding, has starred as Ms. Blonde in an all female reimagining of Reservoir Dogs, a regular player in murder-mystery experiences, and now is our titular heroine (or villainess), Agent J9.  

Agent J9, ‘Janine,’ is smart, tough, and not someone you’d like to meet in a dark alley. But one thing she is not is subtle. Or seductive. Or living if she can’t prove to HR that she’s worth keeping alive. 


In addition to playing J9's rival and seduction coach, Bogdana, the multi-talented Jamie Dixon is an actress, make-up artist, musician, and costume/set designer. She has a diverse background from business to improv and also co-stars on a new upcoming Youtube review show titled Viewport.

Bogdana is as merciless as she is beautiful. A killer with a killer bod, she detests J9, but loves a challenge. Can she turn this sows ear into a silk purse? Probably not, but at least she can mock J9 along the way. 


Our executive producer and S.E.R.P.E.N.T.’s head of HR, Gladys, Leslie Engel has been integral in bringing our vision to life. Leslie is an actor and producer. She is the founder/CEO of BGE Creative and Kohala Dog Productions, which gets its namesake from Leslie's passion for Ironman Triathlons and her amazing Yellow Lab.


Gladys is someone who’s been at S.E.R.P.E.N.T. a long time. Long enough to move out of the assassin game and into middle management and find herself an HR director in the company. Does she regret the decision to leave the field? Yep. Is this why she has nothing but contempt for anyone who can’t live up to her standards as an agent for the company? Also, yep. Which is why she hates Janine. 

S.E.R.P.E.N.T.'s CEO and perfect corporate shark, Josh Drennen's most recent performances have included a turn on "The Last Ship" which will air this summer on TNT, the films "A Perfect Dark", "Hollywood Adventures", "The Last River", and "Customer Service" along with stage roles as William Reach in Down the Road and various comedies in the Cafe Plays at the Ruskin Group Theatre at which he is a member and guest teacher.

The Komodo is a man who knows what he wants. And what he wants is to rule the world. He has the tools to do it. He has the will, the means, and a genius-level intellect. He’s an executive apex-predator. The perfect capitalist sociopath. What he lacks in personal skills and patience he makes up for with ambition, confidence, material possessions, and megalomania. 

Filmmaker and actor with dreams of becoming a brilliant housewife, Ericson Just plays Otto, the unassuming assistant of S.E.R.P.E.N.T.'s CEO, Komodo. He also served as Assistant Director on the project while Directing his own feature film, 'The Burden of My Company', which is set to premiere later this year.  

Otto is a small island of normal in a world of crazy. To say he has no idea what’s going on is an exaggeration, but just barely. He’s starting to catch on that his new job just may not quite be what he thought it was, and he’s having trouble coping with the realization that he may now be evil for being part of S.E.R.P.E.N.T. His only mission is to keep his head down, for fear of getting it chopped off.

Our writer and director, Chad Jones has been an art director, a copywriter, a screenwriter, a comic book author, and a game designer. He’s worked on national ad campaigns, alternate reality games, theme park attractions, and now he’s using his skills to bring Assassin Nine to life.

James  Milner plays with cameras and lights to make pretty pictures. He’s our extremely talented director of photography, and generally an all around good guy.

Our line producer, David Kabbe started as a stunt man and stunt coordinator on feature films and live events before moving into stage managing and production coordinating in television. He now produces independent content, and production coordinates live events and premieres for studios and large film industry supported non-profits. Some of these clients are: the Motion Picture Television Fund, Dreamworks Animation, Sony Studios, Paramount, Relativity Media, SHOAH Foundation, Warner Bros. and Instyle Magazine.  

Clearance Level - 1 - $5
Welcome to S.E.R.P.E.N.T., new recruit! You will receive an official S.E.R.P.E.N.T. desktop pattern with the company motto, "Conquest At All Costs," and social media mention from the Powers-That-Be.

                               


Clearance Level - 2 - $15
Your Clearance Level has been upgraded based on your performance. Your new benefits include all the perks of Level 1, plus an exclusive Assassin Nine poster. (High resolution file suitable for printing and framing).

                                            

Clearance Level - 3 - $25
Human Resources will be contacting you to discuss your enhanced benefits package, which includes all of the perks of previous levels, plus your very own digital copy of the Wacks Records Assassin Nine soundtrack.

Clearance Level - 4 - $50
You’ve been promoted by S.E.R.P.E.N.T. Human Resources. As a Level 4 Corporate Drone, you’ll enjoy all of the perks of the lower levels, plus your very own digital copy of the entire Assassin Nine series.

Clearance Level - 5 - $100
You're moving up in the world. Congratulations, you are now a member of S.E.R.P.E.N.T.’s Middle-Management team. This level grants you all the benefits of previous levels, plus your very own exclusive Assassin Nine hat (in accordance with company dress code).

                                     

Clearance Level - 6 - $250
Your recent performance evaluation warrants a Clearance Level upgrade, along with all the benefits that accompany your new position. In addition to the perks of previous levels, you will receive a company dress code-compliant Assassin Nine T-shirt and your name will appear in the Assassin Nine series credits. 


Clearance Level - 7 - $500
You’ve been handpicked by The Powers-That-Be for a promotion to Offensive Security Specialist. Along with all the benefits of lower level operatives, you’ll also receive an early draft hard copy of the Assassin Nine script signed by the director and cast and a Sneak Peak viewing of the pilot episode.

Clearance Level - 8 - $1000
The C.E.O. (Chief Execution Officer) has his eye on you...for his elite Executive Staff. Your promotion includes all of the glorious benefits from previous levels plus an Associate Producer credit, personal phone call from one of the principle cast and an invitation to the cast and crew wrap party.

Clearance Level - 9 - $2500
The Chief Execution Officer has deemed you worthy of a seat on the S.E.R.P.E.N.T. Board of Directors. You’ll receive a Co-Producer credit on the series and a Sneak Peak viewing of the entire Assassin Nine series in addition to all of the other executive-level benefits.

We’ve broken down our budget and here’s how we’re going to spend our funding. 

Assassin Nine Premiere
When we reach $5000 above our goal, we’ll be able to hold a premiere for Assassin Nine in Los Angeles, where we can invite all of our cast, crew, and all of our supporters of Level 7 Clearance, and higher.


Additional Footage
When we reach $8000 over our goal, we’ll also be able to shoot some additional material to add to the overall vision of the series.



With any project there are risks, but with principle photography complete, we’ve mitigated the risks that we can. We’re all very excited about the footage we’ve seen, and we’re dedicated to using Assassin Nine to conquer the world.

And what he wants is to rule the world. He has the tools to do it. He has the will, the means, and a genius-level intellect. He’s an executive apex-predator. The perfect capitalist sociopath. What he lacks in personal skills and patience he makes up for with ambition, confidence, material possessions, and megalomania. Filmmaker and actor with dreams of becoming a brilliant housewife, Ericson Just plays Otto, the unassuming assistant of S.E.R.P.E.N.T.'s CEO, Komodo. He also served as Assistant Director on the project while Directing his own feature film, 'The Burden of My Company', which is set to premiere later this year.  
Otto is a small island of normal in a world of crazy. To say he has no idea what’s going on is an exaggeration, but just barely. He’s starting to catch on that his new job just may not quite be what he thought it was, and he’s having trouble coping with the realization that he may now be evil for being part of S.E.R.P.E.N.T. His only mission is to keep his head down, for fear of getting it chopped off.



Our writer and director, Chad Jones has been an art director, a copywriter, a screenwriter, a comic book author, and a game designer. He’s worked on national ad campaigns, alternate reality games, theme park attractions, and now he’s using his skills to bring Assassin Nine to life.

James  Milner plays with cameras and lights to make pretty pictures. He’s our extremely talented director of photography, and generally an all around good guy.

Our line producer, David Kabbe started as a stunt man and stunt coordinator on feature films and live events before moving into stage managing and production coordinating in television. He now produces independent content, and production coordinates live events and premieres for studios and large film industry supported non-profits. Some of these clients are: the Motion Picture Television Fund, Dreamworks Animation, Sony Studios, Paramount, Relativity Media, SHOAH Foundation, Warner Bros. and Instyle Magazine.  



Clearance Level - 1 - $5Welcome to S.E.R.P.E.N.T., new recruit! You will receive an official S.E.R.P.E.N.T. desktop pattern with the company motto, "Conquest At All Costs," and social media mention from the Powers-That-Be.

                               

Clearance Level - 2 - $15Your Clearance Level has been upgraded based on your performance. Your new benefits include all the perks of Level 1, plus an exclusive Assassin Nine poster. (High resolution file suitable for printing and framing).
                                            
Clearance Level - 3 - $25Human Resources will be contacting you to discuss your enhanced benefits package, which includes all of the perks of previous levels, plus your very own digital copy of the Wacks Records Assassin Nine soundtrack.
Clearance Level - 4 - $50You’ve been promoted by S.E.R.P.E.N.T. Human Resources. As a Level 4 Corporate Drone, you’ll enjoy all of the perks of the lower levels, plus your very own digital copy of the entire Assassin Nine series.
Clearance Level - 5 - $100You're moving up in the world. Congratulations, you are now a member of S.E.R.P.E.N.T.’s Middle-Management team. This level grants you all the benefits of previous levels, plus your very own exclusive Assassin Nine hat (in accordance with company dress code).


                                     


Clearance Level - 6 - $250Your recent performance evaluation warrants a Clearance Level upgrade, along with all the benefits that accompany your new position. In addition to the perks of previous levels, you will receive a company dress code-compliant Assassin Nine T-shirt and your name will appear in the Assassin Nine series credits. 


Clearance Level - 7 - $500You’ve been handpicked by The Powers-That-Be for a promotion to Offensive Security Specialist. Along with all the benefits of lower level operatives, you’ll also receive an early draft hard copy of the Assassin Nine script signed by the director and cast and a Sneak Peak viewing of the pilot episode.
Clearance Level - 8 - $1000The C.E.O. (Chief Execution Officer) has his eye on you...for his elite Executive Staff. Your promotion includes all of the glorious benefits from previous levels plus an Associate Producer credit, personal phone call from one of the principle cast and an invitation to the cast and crew wrap party.
Clearance Level - 9 - $2500The Chief Execution Officer has deemed you worthy of a seat on the S.E.R.P.E.N.T. Board of Directors. You’ll receive a Co-Producer credit on the series and a Sneak Peak viewing of the entire Assassin Nine series in addition to all of the other executive-level benefits.



We’ve broken down our budget and here’s how we’re going to spend our funding. 






Assassin Nine PremiereWhen we reach $5000 above our goal, we’ll be able to hold a premiere for Assassin Nine in Los Angeles, where we can invite all of our cast, crew, and all of our supporters of Level 7 Clearance, and higher.
Additional FootageWhen we reach $8000 over our goal, we’ll also be able to shoot some additional material to add to the overall vision of the series.


With any project there are risks, but with principle photography complete, we’ve mitigated the risks that we can. We’re all very excited about the footage we’ve seen, and we’re dedicated to using Assassin Nine to conquer the world.

story:
Joshua is a wonderful young man with a huge heart who just wants to be a kid like everyone else.

Two-and-a-half years ago Josh started getting migraines which became more frequent and severe over the next 6 months.  Then he started to have minor seizures which led us to an MRI and the discovery of three lesions in the left hemisphere of his brain and the diagnosis: intractable Epilepsy.

We have tried various combinations of anti-seizure medications with some success controlling his seizures, but with considerable side effects.  Some are manageable (appetite, behavioral, weight gain), but others have become debilitating.  Josh developed issues with his eyesight (convergence insufficiency and poor accommodation), his fine motor control (nearly illegible handwriting), and lost a lot of his physical coordination.  In addition, he developed dysnomia (the inability to recall words), memory issues, and has lost nearly all of his ability to read.  He also experienced a severe drug rash that sent him to the ER.

It has become extremely difficult for him to concentrate in class, preventing him from keeping up with daily instruction.  The end result is an extremely frustrated little boy who, at the end of each day is so exhausted that he typically just wants to sleep.  Between this, his medical appointments, and the ongoing severe migraines; Josh frequently misses 1-2 days of school a week.

In the past 2 years, Josh has had (3) MRIs, (6) EEGs, (4) trips to the ER, (4) EKGs, (2) extended hospital stays, full cognitive and behavioral analysis, and countless doctor appointments and blood draws.  He has been as brave and cooperative as can be expected throughout the entire process.  It truly breaks our heart every time we have to tell him it's time for another procedure.

To make school and life easier on Josh, we're attempting a variety of therapy and private tutoring sessions requiring us to travel hundreds of miles a month and take considerable time off work.  We've been working with his school to make accommodations, but concentrating is so hard for him and he is so far behind that at the current pace it is likely to take years to catch up with his classmates, if it all.  In addition to controlling his seizures, Josh needs intensive therapy and tutoring to get past these obstacles and get back to being a normal little boy who loves soccer, building forts, swimming, and building Legos.

As hard as this all has been on our family, it has been compounded by major medical issues with other family members.  Our daughter, Natalie, broke both bones in her lower leg and spent 12 weeks in a full leg cast and wheelchair.

Our oldest son, Jacob, sustained a massive concussion that required him to do therapy (3 times a week), an hour's drive from our home and miss almost 50 days of school.

Lastly, my wife Anna, just got home from a 10 day hospital stay receiving treatment for (4) herniated discs in her lower back.  The road to recovery will be very long.  She is looking at 1 to 2 weeks of bed rest before she can even begin in-home physical therapy.  She will then need extensive outpatient physical therapy to regain her full strength and function and could miss months of work.  I've been forced to take an unpaid leave of absence from work to provide the care she needs to recover.

During these trials, our family has been blessed by the thoughtful nature of our families, friends, church community, and coworkers as we've fought our way through these medical maladies and the repurcussions resulting from them.  Despite their help, we have reached a breaking point, both mentally and financially.  The stress has been nearly unbearable at times.  Although we are both gainfully employed, we've had to take on an exorbitant amount of debt to keep up with the medical bills, and all the indirect costs (thousands of miles of driving, unpaid weeks at work, anti-seizure medications, etc.) associated with his condition.  We feel very strongly that if Anna (Josh's mom) is able to leave her job, she can recover more quickly from her current condition, give Josh the dedicated time (intensive tutoring, therapy, dr. appts., etc.) he needs, and ultimately help the greater Epilepsy cause.

We're experiencing the devastating effects of Epilepsy firsthand and feel strongly for the millions of others living with seizure disorders every day.  We want to be able to do something about it, but don't currently have the means.

The path forward is simple enough. If we can pay off enough accrued medical care debt then we'll be able to accelerate his therapy/tutoring on my salary.  The much harder part is finding the courage to set up this campaign as I have never found it easy to say "I can't" or ask for help.  Also, finding enough kind-hearted individuals willing to help.  In addition to contributing to Indiegogo campaigns in the past, I'm continually astounded by the stories and generosity of this community to other's needs (ie. the $700K+ for the bullied bus monitor).  I'm hoping there is just a little more generosity left to help us out.  IndieGogo literally has made dreams come true, I'm honored just to be a part of it.

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/lets-give-karen-the-bus-monitor-h-klein-a-vacation--6/x/7829591

For phase 1, we are hoping to raise $132,000 to pay down some of the debt we've accrued for this medical care.  This will allow our family to get by on my salary and still maintain Josh's current therapy/tutoring.  The funds will directly pay off the 5 loans we took out to keep up with hospital bills, therapy sessions, and prescription costs.  For phase 2, if we are so very fortunate to raise more than our goal, we can start giving back to the community.  Any additional funds will be split between the Epilepsy Foundation of America (EFA) and the Wisconsin branch of the EFA.  We are hoping to start a Sheboygan chapter of the Wisconsin branch.  A local resource will help educate families dealing with this disorder on: seizures in general, the medications, side effects, as well as provide a directory of local resources.  It would also help educate schools and caregivers on how to accommodate care and educational practices for these children. 

Please consider contributing to our campaign as we hope to be able to return the favor some day and make life a little better for those living with this disorder.  If you can't contribute, spread the word, we really appreciate that too.

Words simply  cannot express our gratitude, but we'll try anyway.

A thousand thank yous.

This is the t-shirt with the custom Epilepsy awareness logo that my wife had designed.  The shirt is of very high quality and wears well.

"Everything that is done in the world is done by hope."  M.L.

story:
Short Summary

We are the first roller derby league in Greece. Every start is a difficult one, especially when your country's economy is in ruins and there is capital control enforced, meaning no money can exit or enter the country. Greece is in a economic and societal crisis, leaving 75% of our skaters unemployed. A lot of our skaters have quit because they cannot afford the 4.50 euros that it costs to hire a venue per practice. On top of that there are no derby shops in Greece.
The purpose of this campaign is to enable us to equip our skaters and to eventually hire an indoor venue. We are currently practicing outdoors and in tiny bowling alleys and hiring equipment that is inappropriate and unsafe (the skates we hire are literally plastic, we add our own padding to the tiny knee pads we can get our hands on - DIY to the bone! ) These have resulted in serious injuries that render some of our skaters out of action for up to 2 years! We understand that roller derby is an extreme sport, but we cannot even take the basic safety measures due to our finances. The bowling alley that we use is tiny, not even big enough 50% of a track and slippery, as it gets waxed, and rarely available. The outdoor venue can only be used when the weather is good.
By contributing to this campaign you will be helping us achieve our passion of playing roller derby in a country that offers nothing to its people and where it is a necessary outlet.


What We Need & What You Get

With your help we will:

  • £1,000 will go to postal costs of equipment that is donated from abroad.
  • £1,500 will be available for ordering equipment from abroad.
  • £500 will go to printing merchandise.
  • £2,000 will get us a venue for 3 months, hopefully enough time for us to start making profit from fees and merch sales.
We will send you a personal message of gratitude and will send you our love on our social media. We will also send you stickers, pins and tee shirts with our amazing logo.

The Impact

Your contribution is not just financial help, but also solidarity to what our sport stands for: building community and empowering women. Greece needs roller derby more than ever. Statistically women suffer the most in the current economy and the media representations are perpetuating inequality, especially in sport, which is monopolised by men. Roller derby has always been an outlet for female creativity, strength, confidence and sisterhood and Greek women need this desperately. By helping us, you are opening up a new chapter in the dialogue of Greek sport, where men, women, immigrants, queers and LGBTQI people are finally in the same conversation.
We have been part of the creation of the national team, which also required fundraising, sponsors and support and within a year managed to get all three and make its way to Dallas for the roller derby world cup.

Risks & Challenges

One of the challenges we may face is that we might not be able to afford printing merchandise and start making money out of it right away. Our league consists of a lot of talented individuals that are willing to maximise our profit. In the distant future we aim to open an online store to reach more buyers for our merch.
We might not manage to reach our goal and afford equipment and venue, but we are happy to have raised awareness about Greek roller derby, which strengthens the solidarity within our the international derby community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this campaign, it's ok. We love you nonetheless and no money can change that! We'd love for you to share this campaign and like our facebook page: www.facebook.com/athensrollerderby. We also accept used equipment you no longer need. For more information please message our page.

story:
In the beginning, there was a man, a man with a regular job, and a simple life. Then came... the hobby. This hobby led the man to weekly adventures that he never expected to enjoy, several new friendships that would lead to even more adventures and joy.
"What might this hobby be?"
I'm so very glad you asked. As fate would have it, this hobby was POD CASTING!

Hello every one, my name is Kristaan Barrick. Host of The Chimichichanga Superstar Podcast. A little over a year ago, I placed my cellphone in a large wooden bowl and recorded my first podcast. Fifty three episodes and over seven thousand followers later I am  running on my old PC and equipment I obtained from pawnshops, thrift stores and online. Also, there is a full devoted crew with the ultimate goal to provide the ultimate unfiltered information and news.

Now, it's time to get professional with this. Since I began my show, I have fallen in love with the entertainment world, having numerous guests ranging from rock bands, fellow pod casters,craft brew masters, sexologists, comic book enthusiasts and much more. As my followers and voice grew, I realised I had the ability to give a voice to others trying to get their projects off the ground, and that became my new goal. I want to be the show that does every thing and helps every one.

Sadly, with my personal equipment being set up for a home studio, I have had to beg and borrow for my mobile podcasts. Each time I have had to rely on the equipment of others, it has failed, and the quality has drastically dropped.  My simple hope is to take my "Shock jock" personality, which has been compared to a "Howard Stern meets Good Mythical Morning" around the internet to find as many people could provide maximum entertainment and gain equal benefit from being on my show.

I am looking for a simple list of tools to provide to myself and my crew to be properly equipped to take on and stand out on the internet with the millions of people flooding the internet with bizarre and strange content that a "shock jockey" like myself and my crew rely on.
I also plan to branch beyond podcasting as a writer/director for videos (after getting a taste as guest director for "Professor Ellliot's Adventure Club"), writing novels, producing public events, and even a fun cookbook.
As previously stated, my Chimi crew and myself rely on the information provided online, to provide weekly, and eventually daily commentary on. The difference is that the head of this particular serpent, is an open minded personality that can find a middle ground with his audience to entertain, and engage at the same time. Let's be honest in this day and age, is becoming more and more rare with each passing hour, and I would LOVE to provide an unfiltered influence on the internet week by week to give any and all a voice to rely on. 
WHY WE NEED YOU!
The over all goal of this project is to provide a portal to enhance the growth of any one who could benefit from the production of this company, if it be audio video or public. In more blunt honestly? We need you to provide the minimal funds to keep us going so we can provide an UNFILTERED aproach to broadcasting, and not rely on sponsored episodes, or posts. With your minimal support I/we have all that we need to keep the pace and energy going full steam.
If you can't afford to provide funds!
Honestly? Just tell your friends, share the link to your friends and coworkers to support the future of hundreds/thousands/(and I pray) millions) of people  that could benefit from the growth of this particular voice, minority, gay, handicapped straight or what ever else catigory you fit into.

story:
Synopsis
Come and See is a short post-apocalyptic film about a young woman named Blake. The narrative focuses on a snippet of her life as she wanders through an abandoned town, like so many before. She encounters traces of the people that used to live here and the lives they have led and left behind. Initially amused by her discoveries, these feelings quickly dissipate as loneliness consumes her and she finds herself aching for any kind of human interaction. The unfolding story and elements in the scenery let us know that Blake has been alone for quite some time and can't cope with the isolation anymore.  She is reaching her breaking point.  In a last struggle to carry on she ends up finding a most unlikely companion and together they continue the journey.



Connection
Many of the struggles that the protagonist undergoes are things that resonate with all of us. This film explores the themes of hope and solitude, something which everyone experiences now and then. While we all need time to be with ourselves, this film explores when that becomes too much, when we start craving for something more, because as people we intrinsically need someone to share our stories with.  It makes you wonder what it would feel like to be truly and completely alone.  Can we really be happy in such a state of mind?  Where do we go looking for comfort?  Is hope all we need to keep us going?  Is there a purpose to life without anyone or anything to share it with?

Influences
There is no spoon feeding, only hinting.  As such the film roughly takes on the context of the biblical apocalypse story in the Book of Revelations, but this is never explicitly stated and not essential for being able to connect with the themes.  While people that do have knowledge of these scriptures will be able to identify the symbols peppered throughout the journey and understand their significance.

Inspired by the visual storytelling of Andrei Tarchovsky’s “Stalker”, the elegance of Chan-wook Park’s “Stoker” and Nic Pizzolatto’s “True Detective” the film seeks to immerse the audience into the atmosphere of the lonely post-apocalyptic world.


We are a crew of 12 passionate individuals, who want to make a wonderfully thoughtful film with an actress and a horse in Spain.  Here's a couple of our key team members. 


Director

Urmas Salu is Estonian.  He's slightly daft, but he's also a genius.  Urmas has been making and directing films since he was about 10 years old, so he has a lot of experience under his belt.  While the majority of his work has been comedic, he is very interested in the human side of this project and how the little things can make us smile.

Writer

Agne Steponaityte is a very passionate writer whose work is deeply rooted in emotion. She draws a lot from influences in her personal life and translates these into dramatic scripts. Originally from Lithuania, she moved to England to expand her knowledge and skill in script writing.

Producer

Umi Gilbert has been working alongside Agne on this project from its conception and more than anything he wants to see it realised to the fullest potential. He has travelled the world and is always on the move, though he occasionally returns to his homeland in Belgium, he spends most of his time making films wherever he can.

Production Manager

Corrine Amos is a master at number crunching and sweet talking people into helping her out.  Her skills in marketing and promotion are a great asset to this project, and the fact that she's a people person is a great bonus.

Director of Photography

George Pearton is very focused and talented in the camera department.  He takes his time to ensure a shot is perfect, hence why he was drawn to the strong visual potential of this film. George is British through and through; loves his tea nice and hot, even though he doesn't have time to drink it on set.

Sound Designer

Riley Wong has the patience and dedication to sit in a small room and record all the little sounds we need in the film. Without him we'd have a silent film! Riley's a mean, keen, sound designing machine. He's also from Hull. Riley loves Hull.

Production Designer

Jools Turner is the go-to man for all our set dressing and costuming needs.  He's going to give that little town in Spain the "desolate wasteland" kinda look we're going for.

Editor

Oliver Mattinson. Where to start?  He'll work all day and all night to ensure that the film gets through its final stages and that's just what we need him to do. He's going to make sure the film flows and fits together for everyone's viewing pleasure.

One of the biggest challenges for this film was first and foremost the location. As it is set in a completely abandoned town, this creates a lot of issues and questions. Should we actually find a location that's naturally abandoned?  Should we try and mould a normal town into a desolate one?
In the end we decided to combine the two, having found the perfect little town which has the right balance of abandonment and life that we were looking for... In Spain. We're going to be working together with the local community to make their town look like it is experiencing the aftermath that would come with the sudden disappearance of all life.
While we've got our main location figured out, we still need to find a few more in order to complete the film.  These will need to feel the same as the town and will take up a significant amount of the budget to make them look similar and fit in.

Our film will be a very quiet and introspective experience, as we're relying a lot on visual storytelling through thoughtful use of composition and framing. Sound will therefore also play a very big part of the storytelling. Considering nothing in the world is alive except for the protagonist and the elements. This means there is a major focus on the performance and ability of the camera and sound department.

Along with this comes the challenge of getting our actress and crew over to this beautiful location, as well as the lighting, camera, and sound equipment we will be needing. We have to keep them happy with enough food and accommodation, and as if that weren't enough, we also have to find a horse!

All of these challenges are very manageable when one has the right funds to make them happen, which is why we need as much help as possible.

So far we have raised £4000, which has pretty much come entirely out of our own pockets at this point. Along with a fundraising event, this campaign is our biggest hope of reaching our total funding goal of around £7000.  This amount will allow us to realise the film to the standards which we now have in mind and will cover every kind of expense we can imagine. Here is a pie chart of where we've calculated the money will be going at this point, because everyone loves pie!



We would love for anyone that's in the Christmas/Holiday spirit to spare us a bit of change (or a lot, we don't mind). Anyone who contributes can receive one of our lovely rewards, or maybe you just have a big heart and aren't in it for the goodies. But if you really can't donate, we completely understand! You can help us out by sharing this with your friends and family and anyone you think might be able to help us out.  Liking and sharing our Facebook page also helps us out big time.
https://www.facebook.com/comeandsee2016
Thank you for checking out our campaign and happy Holidays!

story:
What we are doing

We are Shara Lange and Lee Bidgood, an independent documentary filmmaker and an ethnomusicologist.  We teamed up to produce "Banjo Romantika" (2015, 55 min), a film that documents the ways that Czech people have cultivated bluegrass music since first hearing it in the 1950s.   

Banjo Romantika tells the unique story of how an American music has become rooted in Czech culture.  We provide intimate stories that explain how bluegrass - a regionally-based acoustic form of US country music - has afforded Czechs ways of dealing with communist totalitarianism, the transition to capitalism, and the onset of globalism.  

News about Banjo Romantika is currently spreading , as it is broadcasting on PBS stations across the US during the winter of 2015-16 (see schedule at our website).   While we are working on DVD distribution to get the film itself on the market, we will create a soundtrack CD album that will feature music from the film, tracks by participating musicians, and exclusive unreleased material from the filmmaking process. 

The film has moved many audiences, opening new spaces for discussion, art, and movement.  Releasing this soundtrack album will provide new opportunities to spark conversations about where bluegrass music can belongs and how we can share a global discourse across cultural boundaries.


What can you do?

We are both junior faculty members at East Tennessee State University (Shara heads the Radio, TV, and Film program and Lee teaches in Bluegrass, Old Time, and Country Music Studies), and have undertaken this film project without prior funding.  We funded the filming ourselves and obtained grants from ETSU to cover post-production costs.  

We are asking for funding for the soundtrack album since we have no more personal funds to spend on this project.  

We are so thankful to our colleagues at ETSU and in the Czech Republic who have helped make this film happen, giving time, expertise, meals, couches to sleep on, etc.  Still, we estimate that it will cost around $6000 to produce a professional quality soundtrack album, including:

  •  cover and liner notes (art, layout, etc.)
  •  permissions, publishing/licensing and other legal fees
  •  the cost of mixing and mastering the album
  •  the cost of duplication

Any funds above the cost of producing the album will go towards defraying other costs related to the film project (non-sexy things like insurance, etc.)



The Impact

This album will release material that we couldn't fit into the short time-frame of Banjo Romantika, including full-length performances of songs from the film, some newly recorded material, field recordings from Lee's research work, etc.  If you liked what you heard in the film, you can hear the whole song and more of the background of Czech bluegrass!

Lee is a musician (a former member of the Steep Canyon Rangers, Big Fat Gap, etc.) so he is used to album projects.  Co-producing this film he realized that a movie isn't like a CD project as much as it is like a BAND--it is not just a single product, but a long-term process.  The timeline for a documentary film has many curves; we started filming in 2011, and are only now beginning to see the fruits of our work as the film reaches PBS audiences.  Shara, as a filmmaker, knows that distribution is a tough road for documentarians as there is a tiny market for this kind of subtitled, niche-market  production--releasing a soundtrack will engage more audiences with the story we tell in the film.  We anticipate many more turns in the life of this film, and ask for your help keep this  project going.  


Challenges

One of the central challenges of our project as a whole has been the fact that we have a VERY low budget, and that many of the materials and people that we are working with are on a different continent.  Thankfully, we already have most of the sound and visual media that will go into the soundtrack record.  To boot, we have the professional quality services of the Recording Lab at ETSU and other local resources.  There is still some communication, legal clearance, and licensing work to be done, but it will pale in comparison to the work we have done for the film already.  With more wisdom on how do do all these tasks, we are committed to having the soundtrack done and ready for release by July 2016.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the news about the broadcast of Banjo Romantika (see schedule at our website).  There are new markets signing up to show the film each week - if you don't see it listed at your local PBS affiliate, please tell them about the film and ask if they will carry it!

story:
We are a group of Guatemalan Students living in Boston and as part of the Guatemalan community we felt the URGE to call for your help... Remember that together we can help and save many lives. Help us spread the word.

Get informed: jucros@suffolk.edu / rcarrillo@clarku.edu / ucrosba_nico@bentley.edu

BBC NEWS:

"Rescue workers in Guatemala are digging through rubble from a mudslide that hit a village not far from the capital, in search of hundreds missing.

At least 26 bodies have so far been recovered from the village of El Cambray Dos, rescue services say. 

Heavy rains swept a torrent of boulders and mud onto houses on Thursday, 15km (nine miles) east of Guatemala City. 

Relatives have been receiving calls and texts from people trapped under the rubble, reporters at the scene say.

Survivors have been taken to makeshift shelters. Rescuers temporarily called off the search late on Friday because of heavy rains, AP news agency reports.

Julio Sanchez, a spokesman for Guatemala's volunteer firefighters, said 26 people had died, including a number of children, and another 36 people were taken to hospitals. 

One man was pulled alive from the rubble after more than 15 hours after the mudslide hit.

But Alejandro Maldonado, the head of the Guatemalan disaster agency, has warned that as many as 600 people could still be missing.

He said that number of people was believed to be asleep in their homes when the mudslide occurred, he added. 

El Cambray is surrounded by steep hills that tower over the houses which are mostly set in the valley bottom. 

Mr Maldonado said in a radio interview that the forested hills had been weakening for some time and had collapsed largely because of recent heavy rain."

http://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-34431285

story:
New!

Update: November 2:  $15,000 in donations of time, talent, and equipment lower our goal to just $25,000! 

Update: October 28: We've completed the first step thanks to your generosity and recorded the song in Munich with the Ganda Boys and refugees from Syria, Afghanistan, Iraq, Uganda, Nigeria, Somalia, and Senegal.  Check out the video above to see what happened!  Now we need the funds to complete the project!

The Need

With the number of displaced Syrians at 4 million and rising, the need for educational programs is growing by the day. From in-camp and mobile classrooms for refugees to job training and cultural assimilation, education must be brought to the refugee population to ensure their economic and social survival. If this were your family, what would you do?


The Solution

World Peace One, led by co-founder Claes Nobel, has joined with UCLA Extension, United Earth, and the International Association for Human Values to bring our deep educational resources into the field. To raise the funds required, we are creating a viral campaign that will capture immediate global attention. At its core is one incredible song: Forgotten People by Ugandan group the Ganda Boys.
Listen to the song now.

The funds raised through the film will be provided to World Peace One Education for community-based education to refugees in transit, and in the Jordanian refugee camps. Key aspects include:

  1. Gateways to learning: creating sustainable access to innovative learning and online training.
  2. Empowering women and girls: lifting up the dreams of woman who want to start a business.
  3. A new generation of health workers: training tomorrow's health care workers.
  4. Rebuilding dignity: creating jobs in training.
  5. Peace projects: Building refugee-led projects.

The Campaign

On October 13 and 14, the Ganda Boys joined with Syrian refugees who are fellow musicians, many of whom have been unable to perform since leaving their homeland. In one amazing jam session at a studio in Munich, these artists collaborated on an original version of Forgotten People that was recorded in a single day. Surrounding them were refugees from ten other nations. All had a voice in the film, and participated in the recording session.

Throughout, our cameras captured events with sincerity and intimacy: blending fly on the wall documentary with emotive interviews, personal stories and moments of inspiration. With the production and recording work now complete, we will create a 4-6 minute film for digital and PR release, plus a separate cut of the recording session as a music video. The new track of Forgotten People will also be available via iTunes, Google Play and other major sources, with all proceeds to benefit the World Peace One Education Fund.

The Request

Thanks to early donations, we received just enough funding to start our campaign plan, and film in Munich. Volunteers and partners throughout Europe and the U.S. worked with us to reach out to Syrian refugee musicians, obtain approvals, arrange travel, and much more. It was a beautiful humanitarian effort, and we are grateful.

We're turning to Indiegogo because we urgently need funds to complete the film, including editing, post production, sound mixing, color correction and delivery of cuts for digital, social, press, PR, presentations and events. We then need to fuel the campaign outreach itself, and ensure a successful global launch. 

In total, we're hoping to raise $25,000 for the film and launch campaign. All donations will go directly to the campaign, and 100% tax deductible. Any funds raised above our goal will go to the World Peace One Education Fund. In exchange for your generosity, we've got some great perks, and we'll keep you up to date our progress: including a chance to be the first to see the campaign.

Our Partners

The team assembled to create this campaign represent the height of talent and expertise in their respective fields. All are award-winning professionals with decades of experience in film, marketing, content development, music, education, human development and social change. The money donated to this effort will produce a remarkable result, and lead to educational opportunities for millions of Syrian refugees. Key partners include:

  • Lead Organization: World Peace One
  • Organization Director: Claes Nobel
  • Partner Organizations: UCLA Extension, United Earth, International Association for Human Values 
  • Music Director: Craig Pruess and the Ganda Boys
  • Campaign Creation and Direction: Tomato
  • Film Director: Len Dickter
  • Production Support: Twist Films
  • Music Production: Artist Studio Munich
  • Talent Organization: International Link.Me

Contact

If you have any questions, please reach out to us. Send an e-mail to our Directors of Education, Jeanne Holm or Joel Mills. Thank you.
