In total, we're hoping to raise $25,000 for the film and launch campaign. All donations will go directly to the campaign, and 100% tax deductible. Any funds raised above our goal will go to the World Peace One Education Fund. In exchange for your generosity, we've got some great perks, and we'll keep you up to date our progress: including a chance to be the first to see the campaign.   Our Partners The team assembled to create this campaign represent the height of talent and expertise in their respective fields. All are award-winning professionals with decades of experience in film, marketing, content development, music, education, human development and social change. The money donated to this effort will produce a remarkable result, and lead to educational opportunities for millions of Syrian refugees. Key partners include:
 


Lead Organization: World Peace One

Organization Director: Claes Nobel

Partner Organizations: UCLA Extension, United Earth, International Association for Human Values 
Music Director: Craig Pruess and the Ganda Boys

Campaign Creation and Direction: Tomato

Film Director: Len Dickter

Production Support: Twist Films
Music Production: Artist Studio Munich

Talent Organization: International Link.Me



   
Contact

 If you have any questions, please reach out to us. Send an e-mail to our Directors of Education, Jeanne Holm or Joel Mills. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
1 in 5 in American are disabled. Projected to 1 in 3 by 2020. World wide these numbers keep growing.

Autoimmune disease growing at rates projected between 7-10% yearly.

Drug companies shifting focus on disease based on commercial potential.

The Pink campaign now a marketing vehicle for companies having little to do with finding a cure. 

Doesn't sound like many of us are living our dreams or thriving.

The brand known as PaleoBOSS Lady (PBL) is built on thriving through conscious living! PBL offers the community tools to Up the Volume on life by questioning the status quo!  

For the last several years PBL has been working in the community offering: workshops, webinars, blogs, interviews & ebooks on how to change your narrative and define a life of higher purpose!

The brand of PBL reaches over 50K daily and 1 million weekly, informing the community how to question the status quo in an approachable & culturally relevant manner.  

This tongue and cheek approach coupled with the strong brand message produce a voice that engages everyone and is changing lives internationally. With a unique approach PBL informs the community through cooking, mindfulness and movement filled tools. Her famous "Bag of Tricks" filled with inspirational tools that put the BAM back in life and living.  This campaign creates a platform for engaging both children and families through food, video and maybe a friendly card game or two.

Projects:

South Philly Paleo Cookbook and Poker: Bringing the family back to the table for meal prep, eating and a friendly game of cards. Italian food being #1 in the world makes this a crowd pleaser.

Video: Sugar Sugar video based on the music parody informing children about hidden sugars.

Podcast: Showcasing the power of PBL mixed with guests that support the ideals of the lifestyle and brand.


Together we can put the BAM back in living!

This brand is based on accessible tools, sustainable thoughts and universal appeal that can create worldwide change. 

This brand is a public brand and needs your help to grow and create change. 

The PBL lifestyle brand has produced miracle results for the founder and are based on real life and living.  Using crowd funding Team PBL is looking to successfully grow market share by offering content that supports the message of thriving through consciousness. 
 

Over the last 12 months the brand of PBL has seen triple digit growth with no signs of slow down.  Professional video, podcast and accessible content production are the next steps in growing the brand towards revenue.  

The Team is Rock Solid:

Team PBL has years of building companies from ideas to empires for over a decade.   PBL and LL are fueled with energy, knowledge and a successful working relationship that has proven to be a powerful combo to lead the brand to a successful outcome.   

Please dig deep and see your way to support this campaign.  Even if you can only donate a few dollars, your contribution will make a huge impact!  Sharing this with others will make a difference too. We honor you.  

BAM,

Team PBL

story:
HELLO!

I'm Robin Cloud, a New York City based comedian, writer, and filmmaker and I'm making my first short film. 

Out Again, takes us on the journey through one family's strange and hysterical struggle with Alzheimer's. When Cat decides to visit her parents for the weekend, she is confronted by her mother's inability to remember one key detail...she's gay!

The story came to me after watching my grandmother struggle with Alzheimers. Initially, I approached the topic by creating a one act play that debuted at the Fresh Fruit Festival in New York.  However, after a successful run and several talk backs, I realized that this was a topic that so many people related to and that it would be important to bring the story to a larger platform. 

Your donation will help to bring this film to life and continue to foster the dialogue on coming out, aging and the human condition. 


WHAT WE NEED

 

We are assembling a highly professional cast & crew and we believe in paying artists for their work; production assistants, make-up artists, gaffers, camera operators, our fabulous DP and a super talented cast. 

In addition, your contribution will help us with our location fees, insurance, administrative expenses (scripts, office supplies, batteries, etc), food, marketing expenses (posters, t-shirts, photos), post production costs and helping Out Again get into as many festivals worldwide as possible!

Any money raised beyond our goal will go to further cover production expenses and to help with paying for editing. Filmmaking is expensive! There's plenty more to cover beyond the goal of the campaign.


TIMELINE


With your support, we will be able to properly capture the beauty of the story and begin filming in the spring of 2016 and by the end of the summer be ready to enter post-production. The final film is tentatively scheduled for completion by Spring 2017.


CORE TEAM

ROBIN CLOUD, WRITER/DIRECTOR

Robin is a New York City-based comedian, writer, and director. She is the former host of BK Live, a daily show that showcases Brooklyn’s art, culture, and political scenes. She has been featured in Diva Magazine, GO magazine’s “Top 100 Women We Love,” Time Out New York’s “Quote of the Week”, and the Washington Post. Her festival appearances include the Women in Comedy, Ohio Lesbian, Fresh Fruit, Emerging Artists, and Hot! Festivals. She is proud to have teamed up with organizations such as the Brooklyn Museum, Hetrick-Martin Institute, The Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual & Transgender Community Center, and NYC Pride. As a college speaker, Robin tours the country with her talk “Accept Yourself Before You Wreck Yourself” which aims to inspire audiences to transform their fears into acts of courage. In addition, she is in production for her feature length documentary Ebony Riders. 

JESSICA DEVANEY, PRODUCER

Jessica is a creative producer and communications strategist. She produced the feature documentary Speed Sisters (Hot Docs 2015), about Palestinian women racecar drivers. She co-produced the Peabody Award winning short film My Neighbourhood, exploring the human impact of settlements in East Jerusalem, and produced its companion web series Home Front. Jessica associate produced Budrus, which won thirteen international awards, including the Ridenhour Documentary Film Prize. She was a key driver behind the film’s engagement strategy, which received the PUMA Impact Award. Jessica founded the Queer Producers Collective and is a 2016 Women at Sundance Fellow.


PERKS


By supporting this film you join the global community of Out Again. Your contribution of any size will help to make this film possible. To express our thanks we have put together different packages of perks, detailed on the right side. Want to give more than our max level? Let's talk!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 


Please share this campaign and spread the word to your friends and family.

Join us on Facebook and Twitter to follow progress on the film and get behind-the-scenes looks into the making of the film AND leave us your coming out story! We would love to hear from you. 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/outagainthefilm

Twitter: @outagainthefilm

Email us outagainfilm@gmail.com

story:
Our Story

Who are we? 

Allen Hagan Walker II, stage named AcEtheGenius, is a Virginia born artist, currently residing in New Jersey. At only 19 years old, Walker has already set himself apart from his contemporaries, alongside the collective Stoopid Rich Kids. Joining fellow artists, and best friends, NATEtheKiDD, Youngg-Leo, AdamtheProducer, and manager Blaise. Walker has curated a special sound, mixing Pop heavy melodies with the likes of Trap, R&B, and Punk. His debut mixtape Boy Meets World released on his 18th birthday and contains songs like Rainbow Road, My Phone, and Heart & Emotions. His second, collaborative project with Youngg-Leo “Leo & AJ” released only months later on January 1st, 2019. The EP A Little Bit of Sunshine dropped in the month of June with the singles STAR, and Sky & Sun being the two breakout songs from the project.

Lorenzo Macias III, is an Ohio native, known as Youngg-Leo, from the Stoopid Rich Kids collective. Moving his melodies in more dark, moody and atmospheric tone, unlike his peers, Leo mainly focuses on R&B and has perfected the Trapsoul sound that has become so popular. His two released projects, Through My Eyes and LEO & AJ have gotten his music career off to a great start. He has also released a handful of successful singles, such as his feature on NATEtheKiDD’s I’m Weak Without You, as well as his own “The Realest, Trust Nobody, All Mine and more. He is currently finishing up his next project to be titled Where to Next, set to drop early this year.

Although being relatively unknown within Stoopid Rich Kids, Nathan Bartelle, professionally known as NATEtheKiDD, quickly made a name for himself in 2019. Fresh off of his hit single “I’m Weak Without You” featuring Youngg-Leo, Nathan looks to continue the hype throughout 2020. He has a very versatile sound ranging from lyrical verses to catchy hooks. In 2019 NATEtheKiDD released his mixtape “#DONTMISSTHEWAVE”. Along with “I’m Weak Without You”, the tape consists of songs such as “Dark vs. Light”, “Time Flows”, and “Kobe”. Near the end of 2019 Nathan released 2 tracks titled “Jet” featuring AcEtheGenius and “Back Of The Whip Freestyle”. Nathan looks to continue dominating 2020 with new sounds.

Hailing from New York, Adam Spencer recently began producing beats under the alias AdamtheProducer. Being friends with the Stoopid Rich Kids, he took an interest in making his own music. In the following time, he quickly started producing his own beats. In only a short time span, his progression became more and more evident to his peers. Recently, Adam has begun pushing out his content through platforms YouTube and Beatstars respectively, looking to gain a following and make a name for himself in a sea of aspiring producers.

Blaise Scioli II is the 17 year old manager and close friend of the Stoopid Rich Kids collective. When he isn’t in class or at his job at Panera Bread, he acts as the brains of the SRK operation. His focus is on marketing and promotion for the members and himself, being a driving force in many projects of the SRK collective. One thing immediately evident about Blaise is his out-of-the-box thinking, and dedicated attitude. He enjoys writing TV shows and anime, as well as stories and movies. He hopes to one day produce them and more large scale projects.

A sophomore at the prestigious art school Savannah College Of Art And Design, better known as SCAD, Carl Crisman is making a name for himself as a talented young animation artist. Specializing in many forms of the medium, from animated television to music video animation, his diversity and raw talent allows him to push the boundaries of what a young professional is capable of. With an eye for great design and the awareness of what the people want, Carl is an artist with mainstream appeal that doesn’t sacrifice his art style.

Shant Kazandjian has had a knack for the arts since a young age. Growing up in Mount Laurel, alongside current collaborator and close friend Zach Gold, Shant started his journey participating in stage crew in middle school. As his opportunities expanded, so did his range of talents. Throughout high school, he took an interest in photography and cinematography and joined the Film and TV club. Once the school day ended, he satisfied his hunger for the arts by creating a small business focused on video work and photography work. He then made the decision to join SCAD, one of the top art schools in the world. In his junior year, he narrowed his focus on producing and, using the experience he has in all other aspects of the industry, has made a big splash in his role. He has high expectations for himself, his teammates, and the projects he works on; and the quality of his work shines because of it.

Zach Gold and his journey in film started from a young age. His mother bought him his first camera, the original gopro, at age 8. He began editing videos of him skiing and surfing on his iPad, and his journey took off from there. When he hit middle school he joined stage crew, meeting close friend and future collaborator Shant Kazandjian. When he hit high school, his raw talent began to shine. His film teacher noticed his strengths, and brought him to the film club, where he quickly established himself in a key role alongside many older peers. He linked back up with Shant and many other friends, starting his own business and making many notable projects primarily as the editor and visionary of them. His junior year he took on leadership roles in the club, bringing home many film festival awards. The same success continued his senior year. During this time, he became close with the SRK collective, and began collaborating with them. He then left for SCAD, Savannahs premiere film and art school, where he has specialized as an editor and visionary director. He has not forgotten his friends and old collaborators however, linking back up with Shant and the SRK collective for many more projects, and many more to come.

story:
My name is Irving Towne. I am a theatrical producer from Amsterdam, New York. I have six years producing experience in radio drama and two in theatre drama. My dream is to live a life of full expression and dramatics and to share my dream with you.

My campaign is to fund “Verily,” an original screenplay, into a completed film. Verily is a personal story of loss and redemption and it took me almost a year to complete the screenplay, so my drive is to see it done.

Verily will be my first film. I am finding that moviemaking can be a complex endeavor with a complication around every turn, which inspires me to plan better and execute better. If you were to help me accomplish the completion of my dream, with your gift and your support, it would be monumental in terms of inspiring me to accomplish the thrilling moviemaking I plan to do in the future.

Budget

 In terms of our planning, our budget for completion of the project is $200,000, which would be $60,000 above-the-line, (Producers, director, DP, editors) + $140,000 for below-the-line (for positions like camera assistants, foley artists, gaffers, grips, catering, drivers, security).  If we don’t reach our goal, all the collected funds will go toward production costs, regardless of the amount.

Perks

We have some amazing perks! Check  them out!

 

  1.  $20.00   – Digital copy of movie
  2.  $25.00   – Digital copy of movie and limited edition Tee Shirt or Cap
  3. $50.00   – Name in Credits, limited edition Tee Shirt or Cap, Digital copy of movie
  4.  $100.00 – Name in Credits, limited edition Tee Shirt or Cap, Digital copy of movie, limited edition Poster and Limited edition Prop from the movie
  5.  $150.00 – Name in Credits, limited edition Tee Shirt or Cap, Limited edition Prop from the movie, Digital copy of movie, limited edition Poster and Photo taken with Star of movie
  6.  $200.00 - Name in Credits, limited edition Tee Shirt or Cap, Limited edition Prop from the movie, Digital copy of movie, limited edition Poster, Photo taken with Star of movie, and Invite to “Day On Set”.
  7.  $250.00 - Name in Credits, limited edition Tee Shirt or Cap, Limited edition Prop from the movie, Digital copy of movie, limited edition Poster, Photo taken with Star of movie Invite to Day On Set, Invite to Wrap Party
  8.  $500.00 - Name in Credits, limited edition Tee Shirt or Cap, Limited edition Prop from the movie, Digital copy of movie, limited edition Poster, Photo taken with Star of movie, Invite to “Day On Set,” Invite to Wrap Party and a “Walk On” part in the movie.
  9. $1000.00 - Name in Credits, limited edition Tee Shirt or Cap, Limited edition Prop from the movie, Digital copy of movie, limited edition Poster, Photo taken with Star of movie, Invite to “Day On Set,” Invite to Wrap Party and a “Walk On” part in the movie, Invite to Premiere Showing and After Party.
  10. Over $1000.00 – Executive Producer Credit, All of the above

 

Impact

 

There are a couple of subjects in Verily that stand out, that I believe are worthy of your interest. The first is child abuse and its long-lasting effect on the victim. Jason, the main character, was so severely traumatized by his abuse that he was still reacting into his 40’s, which led, partially, to his faith crisis in not forming efficient personal guidelines to belief and trust. The other most significant subject is in the film is the nature and role of God in the universe. So many people I know have had a tragedy in their lives and question whether he actually exists and wonder why he could let bad things happen to good people, and Verily examines that.

 

I will say that this project is not going to be easy. This is a significantly more difficult project than I’ve faced to date with many moving parts which will require complex planning strategies.I plan on approaching the situations arising during production with logic, reason, (and a little bit of panic!) and by surrounding myself with industry professionals to support me. In addition, I am committed to diversity in staffing both cast and crew.

 

With the challenges these times present, I considered launching at this time to be a risk, however, is anything worth doing, without risk? That being said, I feel this is a risk worth taking, and I hope you do too. In fact, the message in my film is so important and applicable to our society that I think you will agree so I would appreciate your support. I would also appreciate your support by raising awareness. I hope you will like, follow, and share my page and website on social media platforms, such as Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Getting the word out is the hardest thing for any creative project and you could make it easier by your efforts. Be sure to use the powerful Indiegogo Share tools!

 

Thank you.
story_txt:
My name is Irving Towne. I am a theatrical producer from Amsterdam, New York. I have six years producing experience in radio drama and two in theatre drama. My dream is to live a life of full expression and dramatics and to share my dream with you.
My campaign is to fund “Verily,” an original screenplay, into a completed film. Verily is a personal story of loss and redemption and it took me almost a year to complete the screenplay, so my drive is to see it done.
Verily will be my first film. I am finding that moviemaking can be a complex endeavor with a complication around every turn, which inspires me to plan better and execute better. If you were to help me accomplish the completion of my dream, with your gift and your support, it would be monumental in terms of inspiring me to accomplish the thrilling moviemaking I plan to do in the future.
Budget
 In terms of our planning, our budget for completion of the project is $200,000, which would be $60,000 above-the-line, (Producers, director, DP, editors) + $140,000 for below-the-line (for positions like camera assistants, foley artists, gaffers, grips, catering, drivers, security).  If we don’t reach our goal, all the collected funds will go toward production costs, regardless of the amount.
Perks
We have some amazing perks! Check  them out!

story:
OUR SYNOPSIS: 

Hikikomori is the Japanese word for people with Acute Society Withdrawal. They isolate and hide themselves in their rooms for months, sometimes even years, mainly due to society's pressure. With the lack of support from the people around them, including their own families, many of them spiral into giving up in life. Feeling lost and pressured to abandon their passions, these youths isolate themselves from the society that has betrayed their trust. 

K2 House is a rehabilitation facility where Hikikomoris live together in pursuit of reentering society, rediscover their passions, re-building their self-esteem and most importantly, regain faith and trust in society. 

We follow three of the members and discover what caused them to isolate themselves - from issues of body shaming to the lack of support to pursue their dreams. 

As we follow their road to recovery, we hear their stories and see how and if they will overcome their traumatic past to re-enter society.

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP:

All your contribution will go into helping us create a film that not only gives them the voice they deserve but also does them justice. 

It took a lot of bravery and trust from them to open up and share their extraordinary stories with us. We hope that we can convey their messages properly and to unveil the hidden beauty in these youths. 

With your help, we promise to dedicate our time to creating something beautiful for these misunderstood youths. 

As of now, all expenses have been from the directors’ pockets. We need some help to fully create a film that our subject deserves. We are asking for $15,000 to achieve this. 

All the funds raised will go directly into the documentary and the budget calculated does not include payment towards any of the crew.

It will go into, quality music composition/licensing, professional color grading, final film editing, animations, sound design & mixing and all other post-production costs. 

All extra donations will go into helping us apply to film festivals, marketing and will give 25% directly to the K2 House in Korea, to help them upgrade their facilities. 

 

WHY IS THIS ISSUE IMPORTANT:

Hikikomoris are those with Acute Society Withdrawal and isolate themselves, away from people, for months to years. 

This is a very underreported and misunderstood issue that is a world-wide phenomenon. Everyone and anyone can be affected by it, especially with the multiple present day pressures. 

A lot of people who hear about Hikikomoris prejudicially assume they are those who choose to isolate themselves in their room to play video games and to avoid responsibilities, however, this is a huge misconception. These youths are usually affected by the numerous rules and pressures of society. They feel completely betrayed when those closest to them doesn't trust their potential to pursue the goals. When even their closest friends or even their parents disregards and belittle their passion, they shut down. 

This documentary does not only shed light and give these people a voice, but it also resonates with millions more who may be looking to pursue a dream, even though he/she may feel there is no support or faith from those around them. 

In a time of the Coronavirus, where everyone is forced to be isolated and keep their social lives on a halt - viewers may get a sense of how difficult it was for Hikikomoris to be isolate themselves for months and years. 

Let’s work together to not only give them a voice, but to fix the problem we all have in society. Not conforming to society should not go punished, it should be celebrated and understood.

 

FINAL WORDS:

Our sole purpose here is to try and make a difference for these youths and to let them know they are being heard. 

On that note, even without any financial contributions, we hope that you will watch this (legally or illegally) and  learn from this documentary and share the importance of community and the support for one another, no matter how different their lifestyles might be. 

 

You can further support us by following our website/facebook/instagram.

www.breakingisolationfilm.com

https://www.facebook.com/BreakingIsolationFilm

https://www.instagram.com/breaking_isolation_film

 

Thank you so much for all the support! 

 

-------------------

 

시놉시스:

‘은둔형 외톨이’라고 알려져있는 히키코모리는 주로 사회의 압박으로 인해 몇 달, 혹은 몇 년동안 방에서 고립 상태로 지냅니다. 주변에 의존할 곳이 없는 상태에 이르며 삶의 많은 것을 포기한 채로 지내죠. 하고 싶은 일을 포기해야한다는 압박감과 상실감을 느낀 많은 젊은이들이 사회로부터 등을 돌리고 있습니다. 

K2하우스는 히키코모리들이 공동체 생활을 하는 곳입니다. K2 멤버들은 함께 지내며 자신감을 회복하고 꿈을 다시 찾아 사회로 나갈 준비를 하죠. 

저희는 세 명의 K2멤버의 삶을 들여다보고 무엇이 그들을 고립 상태에 이르게 만들었는지 들어봤습니다. 본인 몸에 대한 수치심부터 하고 싶은 일을 인정해주지 않았던 주변 사람들 이야기까지요. 그들의 회복 과정을 따라다니며 그들이 과거의 상처를 극복하는지, 그리고 어떻게 다시 사회로 돌아오려고 하는지를 조명합니다.

 

도움이 필요합니다:

여러분의 도움은 히키코모리들의 목소리를 세상에 전하는 이 다큐멘터리에 사용됩니다. 

영상의 주인공들은 큰 용기를 내어 저희에게 본인들의 엄청난 이야기를 들려줬습니다. 이들의 메시지가 제대로 전달되고 이 청년들 내면의 멋진 모습들을 세상에 공개할 수 있기를 바랍니다.

여러분의 도움으로 이 청년들을 위한 아름다운 영상을 만들 것을 약속드립니다.

지금까지 영상을 만드는 과정에서의 모든 비용은 저희 사비로 해결했지만, 이 다큐멘터리를 완성시키기 위해서는 15,000달러 (약 1600만원)라는 비용이 들며 여러분의 도움이 필요합니다.

모든 자금은 다큐멘터리 제작과 출품을 위해서만 사용됩니다. 음악 작곡과 저작권, 컬러 보정, 최종 편집, 애니메이션, 일러스트, 사운드 디자인과 믹싱을 포함한 모든 포스트 프로덕션 (post-production) 비용으로 사용됩니다.

추가 모금은 영화제에 출품하고 홍보 활동에 사용되며 추가 모금의 25%는 K2하우스의 시설을 업그레이드 할 수 있도록 기부금으로 전달됩니다.

 

중요한 이유:

히키코모리와 같은 청년 문제는 세계적으로 일어나고 있으며, 잘 알려지지 않았거나 잘 못 알려진 경우가 있습니다. 특히 사회적 압박으로 인해 누구나 고립될 수 있는 문제입니다.

많은 사람들은 히키코모리가 게임을 하고 책임감을 회피하고 싶어서 은둔 생활을 선택해서 한다고 생각합니다. 하지만 사실 그렇지 않죠. 주로 이 청년들은 사회의 규칙과 압력의 영향을 받았으며, 가장 가깝다고 느끼는 주변 사람들이 본인들의 꿈에 대한 신뢰와 지지를 해주지 않았을 때 상처를 받았습니다. 특히 가족과 친구들이 그들의 열정을 무시했을 때 이 청년들은 무너지고는 했죠. 

이 다큐멘터리는 히키코모리의 목소리를 전할 뿐만 아니라, 열정을 갖고 꿈을 쫓지만 지쳐가는 모든 사람들에게 메시지를 주고자 합니다. 또한 코로나로 인해 많은 활동들이 제한되며 저희는 몇 달, 혹은 몇 년동안 고립되어 있는게 얼마나 힘든 일인지 조금은 공감될거라 생각합니다.

이 청년들에게 목소리를 낼 수 있는 기회 뿐만 아니라 우리 사회의 문제를 돌아보고 고쳐나갈 수 있으면 좋겠습니다. 사회에 어울리지 않는다는 건 벌 받아야 하는게 아니라, 그 다름을 인정받고 이해되어야 하기 때문이죠. 

 

끝으로:

저희가 여기까지 온 유일한 이유는 이 청년들에게 영향을 주고 누군가는 그들의 이야기를 들어주고 있다는걸 알려주고 싶어서 입니다. 기부 여부를 떠나서 이 다큐멘터리를 통해 서로에 대한 지지와 공동체의 중요성, 그리고 우리 사회를 돌아보는 기회가 되었으면 좋겠습니다.

저희 웹사이트 / 페이스북 / 인스타그램을 통해 더 알아볼 수 있습니다.

www.breakingisolationfilm.com

https://www.facebook.com/BreakingIsolationFilm

https://www.instagram.com/breaking_isolation_film

감사합니다.

K2 멤버들은 함께 지내며 자신감을 회복하고 꿈을 다시 찾아 사회로 나갈 준비를 하죠. 저희는 세 명의 K2멤버의 삶을 들여다보고 무엇이 그들을 고립 상태에 이르게 만들었는지 들어봤습니다. 본인 몸에 대한 수치심부터 하고 싶은 일을 인정해주지 않았던 주변 사람들 이야기까지요. 그들의 회복 과정을 따라다니며 그들이 과거의 상처를 극복하는지, 그리고 어떻게 다시 사회로 돌아오려고 하는지를 조명합니다. 도움이 필요합니다:여러분의 도움은 히키코모리들의 목소리를 세상에 전하는 이 다큐멘터리에 사용됩니다. 영상의 주인공들은 큰 용기를 내어 저희에게 본인들의 엄청난 이야기를 들려줬습니다. 이들의 메시지가 제대로 전달되고 이 청년들 내면의 멋진 모습들을 세상에 공개할 수 있기를 바랍니다.여러분의 도움으로 이 청년들을 위한 아름다운 영상을 만들 것을 약속드립니다.지금까지 영상을 만드는 과정에서의 모든 비용은 저희 사비로 해결했지만, 이 다큐멘터리를 완성시키기 위해서는 15,000달러 (약 1600만원)라는 비용이 들며 여러분의 도움이 필요합니다.모든 자금은 다큐멘터리 제작과 출품을 위해서만 사용됩니다. 음악 작곡과 저작권, 컬러 보정, 최종 편집, 애니메이션, 일러스트, 사운드 디자인과 믹싱을 포함한 모든 포스트 프로덕션 (post-production) 비용으로 사용됩니다.추가 모금은 영화제에 출품하고 홍보 활동에 사용되며 추가 모금의 25%는 K2하우스의 시설을 업그레이드 할 수 있도록 기부금으로 전달됩니다. 중요한 이유:히키코모리와 같은 청년 문제는 세계적으로 일어나고 있으며, 잘 알려지지 않았거나 잘 못 알려진 경우가 있습니다. 특히 사회적 압박으로 인해 누구나 고립될 수 있는 문제입니다.많은 사람들은 히키코모리가 게임을 하고 책임감을 회피하고 싶어서 은둔 생활을 선택해서 한다고 생각합니다. 하지만 사실 그렇지 않죠. 주로 이 청년들은 사회의 규칙과 압력의 영향을 받았으며, 가장 가깝다고 느끼는 주변 사람들이 본인들의 꿈에 대한 신뢰와 지지를 해주지 않았을 때 상처를 받았습니다. 특히 가족과 친구들이 그들의 열정을 무시했을 때 이 청년들은 무너지고는 했죠. 이 다큐멘터리는 히키코모리의 목소리를 전할 뿐만 아니라, 열정을 갖고 꿈을 쫓지만 지쳐가는 모든 사람들에게 메시지를 주고자 합니다. 또한 코로나로 인해 많은 활동들이 제한되며 저희는 몇 달, 혹은 몇 년동안 고립되어 있는게 얼마나 힘든 일인지 조금은 공감될거라 생각합니다.이 청년들에게 목소리를 낼 수 있는 기회 뿐만 아니라 우리 사회의 문제를 돌아보고 고쳐나갈 수 있으면 좋겠습니다. 사회에 어울리지 않는다는 건 벌 받아야 하는게 아니라, 그 다름을 인정받고 이해되어야 하기 때문이죠.  끝으로:저희가 여기까지 온 유일한 이유는 이 청년들에게 영향을 주고 누군가는 그들의 이야기를 들어주고 있다는걸 알려주고 싶어서 입니다. 기부 여부를 떠나서 이 다큐멘터리를 통해 서로에 대한 지지와 공동체의 중요성, 그리고 우리 사회를 돌아보는 기회가 되었으면 좋겠습니다.저희 웹사이트 / 페이스북 / 인스타그램을 통해 더 알아볼 수 있습니다.www.breakingisolationfilm.comhttps://www.facebook.com/BreakingIsolationFilmhttps://www.instagram.com/breaking_isolation_film감사합니다.

story:
A young man awakes after miraculously surviving his own suicide. 

Injured and alone, he is rescued by a homeless drifter who nurses him back to health.

Whether fate, or chance or mystical. The only thing for sure is neither of their lives will never be the same again.

Sam and I started this film in September 2019 - almost one year ago.

After devasting bushfires, flooding and an ongoing global pandemic; we have finally finished the film. While we did not reach our initial goal from our first crowdfund - you can check it out here: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/not-today-a-short-film/x/22152735#/

The support and contributions we received for the film was incredible and the love was felt from all over the world.

We were able to support the most amazing crew and hire well-deserved talent that helped create our vision and tell our story.

We are almost at the finish line and we need everyone's help.

We are looking to enter into as many film festivals as possible and share our message.

Submissions to film festivals add up and become pricey. Whether you share, like, discuss or donate, every little bit counts.

Purchase our perks or donate to become a part of our vision.

Please help us spread our message, by liking and following our pages, re-posting and sharing our links!

facebook.com/nottodayshortfilmau

instagram/nottoday.shortfilm

twitter.com @NotToday_Film

www.nottodayshortfilm.com

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone, my name is Sam Eisenhower, and I am the writer, director, and cinematographer for Gemini. I have a background working in visual effects since I was twelve years old, and I have been directing and shooting films for the last five years - anything from narrative thrillers, dramas, and experimental films to music videos and commercials. With this project, I have decided I am ready to pursue my dream of creating something that is fully my own: Gemini.

Gemini is a sci-fi post apocalyptic action thriller film about a man suffering from amnesia trying to find his way back home through a landscape plagued with destruction brought on by androids. These androids are indistinguishable from humans and still roam the apocalyptic countryside. The script has received excellent reviews, scoring an 8.1/10 in the Shore Scripts Short Film Fund Competition. 

This film is ultimately about a journey each one of us must face: time. Time moves forward always, it does not move backwards or stand still. No matter how much we may want to go back to the way things were, we can never go back truly. This concept is relevant now more than ever in our society as things have changed rapidly over the last year, for better or worse. The setting of a post-apocalyptic world is the perfect place to explore this concept, and I hope to do so through this film.

I believe that film can be a form of escapism, a way to get away from the stress and pressures of our lives. I also feel that there is a gap between art/indie films and large-scale Hollywood productions; very few Hollywood directors are able to explore deep and intricate concepts, while keeping the audience entertained. In this film, I aim to create a story that is both entertaining and thought-provoking - something that will keep you on the edge of your seat from start to finish.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To complete this project to its full potential, we will need at least $15,000. We know that sounds like a lot of money, but this film is highly ambitious. We intend to create an entire world for the characters and audience of the film to inhabit: a shade of the world we live in, full of destruction and chaos. In order to do that, we will need to invest a great deal of money into props, set design, locations, permits, food and accommodations for actors and crew, camera gear, lighting equipment, stunts, and post production/visual effects. All these costs add up very quickly and even with sufficient funds, the scale and ambition of creating this story will be something the world of indie short film cinema has not yet seen.

 

To get you involved in this exciting process, we are offering a number of amazing perks unique to this film: low level contributors will have the opportunity to get their hands on Gemini merchandise such as tee shirts, posters and early access to watch the film before it is officially released. Mid-level contributors will gain access to signed copies of the original Gemini script, deleted scenes from the film, exclusive behind the scenes footage, and much more. And last but not least, high level contributors will be able to get their hands on real, hand-made props from the film, access to all pre-production materials to see what went into the creation of the film, a private video chat with cast and crew, and access to exclusive Gemini merchandise reserved for high-level contributors only!

If we are unable to reach our entire goal, the film will still be made, but it will likely take longer than planned. In addition, we may have to reduce some of the scale, rely more heavily on visual effects and remove some of the stunts, however your contribution will still go directly into the creation of an epic sci-fi story you will not want to miss!

 

The Impact

As a filmmaker, it is my goal to bring you into a world that will engage your imagination and give you an experience that will make you think and question the world around you. Our team has created numerous stunning, provocative films in the past, all on extremely minimalistic budgets. We know we can make this film incredible. But with your help, we can make it into something next-level. With your contribution, we can expand this idea into an entire world created by and for you, and create an experience that is immersive, thought-provoking, and entertaining. Your contribution will allow us to construct this world to its fullest potential. Together we can create something incredible.

 

Risks & Challenges

The process of creating a film does not come without its share of obstacles. I have never created a film or worked on a film that did not have at least one point at which it seemed all was lost. But I can honestly say that I have never given up on something I was passionate about.

I have put months into the research and writing of this film’s script, and I have worked tirelessly to assemble a team, find locations, begin production design, and create materials to promote this project. I believe this film is a perfect expression of a story that I have always wanted to tell, a story that is very personal to me and one I have put my heart and soul into constructing. I could not be more passionate about making this vision a reality with your help. Whatever challenges lie ahead - through a pandemic, social and political unrest, financial obstacles, logistical issues - I have total faith in my team, and we have total faith in each other. I am confident that we will overcome any challenges we may face.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be able to contribute financially, however there are plenty of other ways you can contribute! Sharing this page with your friends and asking others to share our page is a huge help. We hope to reach a wide audience with this project, and spreading the word about our page greatly helps us accomplish that goal.

story:
This project could not have been made without your support! Every contribution counts!

 

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Have you ever let yourself think about the effect of your subconscious mind?

Leon explores the tragic beauty of someone who lets his mental health take over, driving this through an array of dramatic, tense, though provoking scenes, all exploring the subconscious mind. Losing contact with people around him, escaping into a forest of torment and anguish, Leon has to face the issues that are brought to light in this film. Will he let his mental state possess him?

An experimental film on 16mm film, showcasing the work of cinematographer Eirik Gustavsen. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding required for this film is all going towards stocks of film rolls, location and production design. I’ll be working with an incredibly talented small crew, all dedicated to making this a visually tantalising experience. We wish to explore the power of light, scenery, making the most of the Cornish landscape and what it has to offer. 

As we’re filming Leon on 16mm film, the money will be going towards Kodak 16mm film rolls and production design to ensure we create a beautiful film.

Even if our entire goal is not quite reached, we hope to utilise every penny to create a full, captivating cinematic experience.

The Impact

The reason for this film being incredible important is that it explores mental health, something most of us have to deal with at some point in our lives. Through experimental film techniques and imagery, I want to explore a new way of communicating a story about mental health, shining light on the important topic. 

I hope by supporting this film, you will be helping us to create a visual experience, all working towards making mental health an important recognised issue. By shining a light on this subject, I hope to increase further support and recognition for mental health resources. 

Risks & Challenges

Risks and challenges may occur during filming, particularly due to the current Covid 19 Pandemic. The crew must remain small, we will be taking all the necessary precautions, only having 6 people on set, including the actors. The crew will also be social distancing with a 2 meter distance and ensuring all equipment is sanitised all times. 

Other challenges will involve the underwater scenes we plan on capturing, where an underwater 16mm camera rig will be built.  

Due to this being an experimental film, challenges will arise due to weather conditions along the way which we understand, but we hope to make the most of these uncertain elements and use them to our advantage! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t help out with funds for the project, no worries at all! Sharing our story, liking our progress on social media and passing the word on to friends and family will all help the cause! 

Thank you so much.

Losing contact with people around him, escaping into a forest of torment and anguish, Leon has to face the issues that are brought to light in this film. Will he let his mental state possess him?An experimental film on 16mm film, showcasing the work of cinematographer Eirik Gustavsen. What We Need & What You GetThe funding required for this film is all going towards stocks of film rolls, location and production design. story:
Short Summary

My name is Carson Bailey. I am a Writer and Director who is currently getting my Master of Fine Arts degree at the Savannah College of Art and Design. When I make films, what I want most of all is to simply entertain. If someone breaks a smile watching my movies, I've accomplished my goals! 

This campaign is the culmination of everything I have learned in my time making films, and its story is incredibly important to me personally. My biggest problem while coming of age was my aimlessness. I remember pursuing higher education not because I wanted to, but because it just seemed like what was expected of me. Meanwhile I'd had yet to have a real job, and showed almost no drive to improve myself. Slowly but surely the world was leaving me behind, and if I hadn't found my passion and wildly pursued it, it might have done so. This story is about Charlie, a boy trapped in a man's body due to his extended time in a coma, who wakes up from his perfect world, and must adapt to a world that has already left him behind. This story is important to me because it's my worst fears realized, and also a triumph over them.  

By donating to this project you will be helping us find the right actors to bring these characters to life, proper locations for them to act in, and the ability to transport our cast and crew from place to place. In short, this film cannot be fully realized without your help! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We aim to raise $5,000 for this project which will be used to fund our cast, locations, transportation, and general production value. This money will allow us to bring our vision to life in a believable and impressive way!

By donating, you will gain access to commemorative items, recognition, and exclusive behind the scenes content. Check out our perks for more info, and know that whatever perk you choose will come with every perk before it as well!

If we can't reach our final goal the fund will first and foremost go to getting top quality actors! This is a character driven story, and we need talent who can bring these characters to life! 

 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is filming during the COVID 19 pandemic. However, we are not new to this environment. Our team has already made several short films during the pandemic and have not yet once sacrificed anyone's health or well being. In order to stay safe, we:

  • Wear masks at all times.
  • Take temperatures before and after filming every day.
  • Enforce testing before we begin shooting. 
  • Keep food and water separate and individualized. 
  • Have a specialized crew member to monitor our set's well being. 
  • Keep track of where our cast and crew have been.

Other than that, this story is a very down to Earth story that requires no special stunts or action. It's a set that will be safe for our crew, and our actors! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's a difficult time for so many of us. If you can't contribute but have become interested in the story we are trying to tell, please share this project with your friends to spread the word and let people know we are here, and we are ready to film! You can use the tools on this page to make sharing more easy!

No matter what, thank you for your time!

story:
It’s June, 2012. The Afghanistan War is still raging. The Euros have just started and the nation is gripped by pre-Olympic fever. 

The recession is biting hard and Emily and Oliver have decided to downsize and shift their middle-class lifestyle to a small town in the north of England. They want to live, work and raise their children among what they term “real people”, away from the cold anonymity of London.

So these left-wing, well-educated people have invited over their two new (very real) neighbours in an attempt to break the ice. Tonight Alan and Dawn are to be offered olives and introduced to Karl Marx and abstract art.

As classes and outlooks collide, the scene is set for an evening which will have consequences as hilarious as they are tragic.

Hello, I am Samantha Seager and I am one of the producers of the film Invincible. 

I played Dawn in the original cast of Invincible, which premiered at the Orange Tree Theatre, Richmond in 2014 before transferring to the St. James Theatre in the West End shortly after.

I loved this piece so much and often thought it would make a brilliant film. Not only does the story resonate with me personally (what with me being a lassie from up North), this piece explores subjects which we can all relate to. Torben Betts, the award-winning playwright behind the project, puts cultural and class contradictions in a room together over one night and, inevitably, hilarious and excruciating sparks fly.

But Invincible is infinitely more subtle than pitting ‘rich’ and ‘poor’ against each other. The characters are exceptionally well-developed, believable souls that begin to emerge, demonstrating how government policy affects people from different socio-economic backgrounds. It is also a piece about neighbourliness, kindness, war, fighting for your country and the consequences of not being truthful with one’s self. 

Next year, 2022, will be ten years on since our story was set and it has unnervingly predicted many of the events that have happened since. The themes around isolation and loneliness are more poignant than ever, and now feels like the perfect time to look back at the 'halcyon' days of 2012 to see how far (or not) we have come. 

Having gathered together the original cast along with writer Torben Betts (making his acting debut as Oliver), and talented actor/director Emma Croft (on board as our Director/Co-Producer), we are in the process of building a first class production team to bring this touching story to the silver screen as a feature film.

Here are some reviews of the original play.

We already have the backing of comedy legend Paul Whitehouse, who is on board as an Executive Producer, but we need more help!  

 

FUNDING

We have so far developed this film with £5,000 of our own investment - 16% of the £30,000 we need. 

This is a passion project for us and we're hoping to convince you that this project and its team are worth supporting. Raising the remainder of the budget here on Indiegogo would mean everything to this us, enabling us to bring this multi-layered story to life in a way that is thought-provoking and wonderfully entertaining.

 

THE TEAM

Actor - Laura Howard 

Laura is probably best known for her time in the long-running British crime-mystery series Midsomer Murders, in which she played John Nettles' daughter, Cully Barnaby, for 12 years. 

Her first major role came in 1992, playing the teenage daughter, Tammy Rokeby, in the BBC comedy series So Haunt Me. She went on to star in the Jack Rosenthal film Eskimo Day, and its sequel, Cold Enough For Snow. 

Her other television credits include Call The Midwife, Cuffs, Young Dracula and The Delivery Man.

Actor - Daniel Copeland  

Daniel’s best known television work includes After Life for Ricky Gervais, King Gary, Worzel Gummidge, Walter, The Day Britain Stopped and, of course, Casualty.

Other roles include Bilbo Baggins in The Hobbit in the West End, Bottom in A Midsummer Night’s Dream for Northampton Theatre, Baloo in The Jungle Book for West Yorkshire Playhouse (now Leeds Playhouse), and most recently Ryan in Pilot Theatre’s award winning production of Noughts and Crosses.

Actor/Writer - Torben Betts

Torben is an award-winning playwright and screenwriter. 

Having read English Language and Literature at the University of Liverpool, Torben trained as a professional actor at Drama Studio London. After several years on the London Fringe, he transitioned to full-time playwright and has now penned more than 20 titles. Apart from a cameo appearance in his own 2014 film (Downhill), this is his first professional acting role in almost thirty years.

Actor/Executive Producer/Producer - Samantha Seager 

Samantha is known for roles in Coronation Street, The Hello Girls, The Lakes, Johnny and The Bomb and Me Too!. She has also appeared in The Bill, Strange, Waterloo Road, Holby City, Casualty, Silent Witness, Doctors, Boy Meets Girl and Little Britain.

Film credits include Neanderthal, Releevo, Doll Factory and the award winning short This is Vanity and it's up coming sequel, Iniquity.

She will be returning to play Marlene in the West End production of Only Fools and Horses: the Musical later this year.

Director/Producer - Emma Croft  

Emma directed the short film Honest Lies, shot over 2 days following a successful Kickstarter campaign, which was shown as part of the London Short Film Festival 2015 at the Hackney Picturehouse. In 2017, she directed herself in the 5 minute short Left Hand Side for the Sci Fi 48hr Film Challenge.

An actor by trade, Emma graduated as ‘Most Outstanding Drama Student’ from the London Studio Centre. Her extensive acting credits in Shakespeare productions, like Christine Edzard’s As You Like It, as well as Smilla’s Sense of Snow and The Winter’s Tale lends her directing style to this dialogue-centric, character driven story. Having raised her son Emma has returned to film and the creative industries in recent years, and is committed to working with like-minded people and collaborating on inspiring, unusual and important projects.  She is passionate about the stories of unheard voices, women’s stories, and difficult subjects being brought to the screen. 

Other recent collaborations include acting in Gabrielle Russell’s short film Falling, and involvement in the Other People’s Kisses segment of the first ever crowd-sourced feature film, 50 Kisses. She has a short experimental film in post-production. 

Executive Producer - Paul Whitehouse

Paul is a multi award winning national treasure! An actor, writer and comedian, Paul has starred in The Fast Show, Harry Enfield and Chums, Harry and Paul, as well as many other films and TV shows over the years. In recent times he has been delighting us all with Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing. 

Assistant Producer - Michelle Thérézien

Having worked with our Director, Emma Croft, as a Producer’s Assistant on several of Emma’s short films, Michelle has joined the Invincible team as Assistant Producer.

With a background in investment finance before changing paths to pursue a career in production management, she is our resident numbers whiz, in charge of the budget. Michelle is passionate about sustainability and is responsible for our journey to secure albert Sustainable Certification for this production.

 

BUDGET

Now, time for the numbers. 14 days’ shooting, 1 location, 1 director, 4 cast, 8 crew, and £30,000. That is what is required to create this film.

The money raised through this campaign will go towards a wonderful set design, creating a realistic living room set integral to the story’s development; paying our cast and crew; and hiring of camera, sound, and lighting equipment.

Given this is a passion project, many of us are working for free to make our crowdfunding goal as attainable as possible. We hope you will support us to raise the finances so we can make this vision a reality. 

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

This is a highly ambitious project and we wouldn't have it any other way. We all have considerable experience in the industry and many of us were involved in the original creation of the piece and have an inherent love and affection for it. 

The main challenge is adapting a play for screen and we have already put in a huge amount of time developing the script and setting up the film to date. The film takes place in one location which is why we need the most perfect production design to create a living room set that can facilitate the story telling and make it cinematic. 

We are confident that we can overcome these obstacles. It's part of what makes filmmaking so exhilarating.

It whittles down to the fact that one of the biggest challenges is actually raising the money in the first place. This is why we need your help. With your contribution, we'll be able to realise this project through our dedication, tenacity, and fervour to face these risks and challenges.

 

BACKING AND REWARDS 

Indiegogo is a great opportunity for up-and-coming filmmakers and creative entrepreneurs to come together, back projects and set ourselves free from the traditional gatekeepers. We have put together an array of rewards that we hope will excite and entertain you.

We only want people donating what they can live without - the price of a coffee, a beer, a yoga class or dinner out, whether that's £10, £25 or £50 - crowdfunding films is about the many giving a little - rather than anyone giving a lot.

 

GOAL

We already have amassed 16% of the budget and we're confident we'll be able to raise the remainder of the budget here. It’s worth acknowledging that, in the circumstance we are unsuccessful in reaching our goal, don't worry, we'll still be making this film. It just means we’ll be pushing our creativity to the limit, reimagining some of our scenes, to ensure we produce the brilliant film that we have planned.

 

SUSTAINABLE CERTIFICATION

albert is the film and television industry’s authority on environmental sustainability. Founded in 2011 by BAFTA and governed by an industry consortium, albert supports everyone working in film and TV to understand their opportunities to create positive environmental change.

With some of our crew having undertaken albert’s Sustainable Production Training course, we have completed our Carbon Action Plan with the view to achieve Sustainable Certification for this production. This will mean we have considered sustainable practices like hiring rather than buying; offering meat-free meals; appropriate waste disposal and more – all with the aim of ensuring our film has the smallest possible environmental impact.

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We totally understand times are tough right now. If contributing just isn't possible but you like the project and want to help, then we still need you!

Please tell others or spread the project online with Indiegogo's sharing tools - the more people who hear about it, the better. As the saying goes, the more the merrier!

 

THANKS + TEASER

We really appreciate you taking the time to consider our project. We hope that you are as excited about this project as we are. We can’t wait to get into production and be able to share the end product with you all.

story:
A young vampire kidnaps a woman to receive motherly advice and parental guidance under the guise of hospitalisation.

She wakes in a hospital bed, the space around her seems a crude construction of what a hospital should be, and the only ‘doctor’ is a young boy who becomes defensive whenever she raises her confusion. What’s more, he seems less concerned about her alleged health problems and more interested in her personal life? – does she have a family, how many kids does she have, what’s the dynamic like at home, how does she tackle conflicts and money problems? When the place becomes silent with the boy nowhere in sight she sneaks out and looks behind the curtains; roadkill, rust, the building is abandoned and falling apart, needles, dried blood, she peers between the dusty floorboards. Children thin, smoking, poor; a few of them notice her they hiss, jaws agape snarling at her like feral dogs.

Growing up near Blacktown, I saw graffiti littered everywhere, young children dealing in pubs, with the pub owners turning the other cheek as long as they got their cut...allegedly...

Teen poverty is a lot more common than you would expect and it is lethal.      

But how is this relevant? 

Vampires were traditionally used to portray the sinister and animalistic side of high society but have faded into the background favouring more marketable mainstream stories. I want to revitalise its roots by inverting them.

Instead, showing how poverty and the lower class often have to forego the norms of polite society to survive but are still punished for not meeting those norms.

Now imagine a vampire unable to re-join society due to what they are, hiding from the persecution of society in abandoned buildings, living off rats and roadkill, and other people, older people taking advantage of what they have.

 

We are a team of young creatives making short films for the sheer hell of it, hoping to turn it into a viable career. Still studying film in university this year we are experimenting and exploring our own creative voices.

We want to tell stories that mean something hopefully not just to us but to others as well.

Director - Lucy Walling

From a strong writing background, winning multiple writing competitions in her youth Lucy discovered her talent for storytelling. It was only in the past decade did she discover a passion for film and migrated to a screenwriting format. Within the span of two years, Lucy wrote seven screenplays and created five short films, acting as Director, Producer, Cinematographer and in some cases the cast. To improve her skills Lucy took a short course at AFTRS and joined JMC Academy in early 2020. There her personable and decisive nature led her to become a talented director. 

Producer - Alicia Thornton

Alicia Thornton is a film student from Sydney Australia. Currently attending JMC Academy, she specialises (or with experience) in producing deep and meaningful dramas that aim to challenge the audience's perspective on a matter. Along with organising film projects, she has experience helping organising events such as showcases as well as being a stage manager for theatre productions. Alicia has a love for all things supernatural in origin and uses her passion for art projects of differing media.

Cinematographer - Andrew McCarthy

Andrew is an aspiring Cinematographer and Editor. He has spent many years producing various pieces of content, most prominently on his youtube channel Stigcrafter, where learned most of his camera and editing skills. He is also currently studying film and tv production at JMC academy. Previous career highlights include being the Co-Producer and Editor of the short film Gabe the Kung Fu Spy from Western Sydney, and being the first AC on short films Spoiled Milk and Genisis. Personally, his hobbies include collecting and building Lego, collecting Transformers figures, gaming, and building stuff in his garage. He also is interested in engineering and technology. Some of his favourite films are The Lego Movie, Parasite, Thunderbirds, and Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen. He promises he’ll watch some good films soon, right after he watches Godzilla vs Kong.

Production Designer - Lachlan Anderson

Lachlan Anderson is an emerging filmmaker based in South-West Sydney, New South Wales. A self-taught sketch artist and painter, Lachlan is currently attending JMC Academy for film and television production, set to graduate by late 2021. With a love for all things crafty, Lachlan has created a range of props, costumes and special effects; from swords and armour to guns and monsters. As an aspiring production designer, Lachlan has worked in the art department; building, painting and dressing sets for short films. One of his favourite projects was helping to recreate an entire 19th-century mineshaft out of a warehouse in suburban Sydney. With a nerdy passion at the ready, Lachlan's dream is to put his talent into action by designing and creating sets and props for major film productions.

 

We have a variety of rewards for those generous enough to donate, providing perks from personalized letters from the characters all the way to personalized Easter eggs throughout the film. To create the set, props, wardrobe, lighting, and catering, we need $3000 to keep our cast and crew comfortable and the film top-notch.

Any additional funds leftover will be donated to savethechilren.com an organization that provides support for children in need both in Australia and overseas.
Break it down for folks in more detail:

We want to create a film with banter and the good old Australian wit to make you giggle like a little girl. However, beneath the jovial tone, we want to explore more serious issues regarding the impact poverty has on child abuse. Throughout the film, there will be allusions to the struggles many children of poverty face from abuse, exploitation and addiction.

We hope to inform audiences that these kinds of issues are much closer to home than originally thought.

Making any short film comes with a hundred and one different risks that can and probably will happen. We've taken some time to evaluate what shit will hit the fan when production starts.

Location

We have multiple locations on our radar at the moment, all of which come with their own advantages and disadvantages. We need that rundown graffiti back-street look, without endangering any cast and crew.

Going on multiple location scouts and contacting councils responsible for the property is vital to ensure cast and crew safety and make sure we are not trespassing. 

Social Implications & Portrayal

The subtext of our film deals with heavy issues such as child abuse, poverty, and classism. We must keep these considerations at the forefront of our mind when producing the film. The last thing we want to do is misrepresent these issues and offend those who these issues affect.

The screenplay has been re-written and reviewed multiple times, fine-tuning it to portray exactly what we want. 

Too many Macca's runs? No worries.

You can help us by spreading the word, sharing on social media and interacting with us. It means the world to our team. Whether you express your excitement, have a suggestion or just want some jovial banter we're here:

story:
Story

Bert and Amanda navigate through their on and off-again relationship as they battle their insecurities which manifest in ways only the modern world could conceive.

Our main goal with this film is to show a lived-in relationship that feels intensely real but is tinged with contamination from modern technologies that reveal themselves in surreal experiences. Bert & Amanda is a dramatic comedy with our own personal twist.

We believe in this film and the team so much that we will be using this short film as a concept for a future feature film.

What do we need?

Your donation will be used to bring this story to the screen. By far, the largest portion of our budget is payment for our amazing cast and crew. Choose one of our perks to ensure you get to see what this group can do. 

 

Who are We?

Holly de Jong - Writer/Casting Director

Holly has written many short stories and Bert & Amanda is her first for the screen. Apart from writing, her storytelling experience on stage and in front of the camera is extensive. She has worked at the National Theatre and with the Almeida theatre company in New York and London and recently at the Ustinov Studio, Bath, and at the Crucible Theatre, Sheffield in the stage adaptation of Arthur Miller's screenplay about the female orchestra in Auschwitz, 'Playing for Time'. Numerous TV appearances include Black Adder II, Poirot, and the screen adaptation of The Weather in the Streets. She was Newt's mother, Ann Jorden in Aliens and Sara in Electric Dreams. 

 

Joe Olmstead - Director

Joe is a narrative and short-form filmmaker who graduated from the University for the Creative Arts, UK with an MA in Filmmaking. His MA graduation film, Development of June, screened at festivals in the UK and US, including the Academy Award qualifying Indy Shorts International Film Festival and the Blow-Up International Arthouse Film Fest. The film won best drama short at the RAGFF in New York City. While writing and directing narrative films is his main passion, Joe composes music for film, edits, mixes, and engineers audio, and works as a cinematographer. When not making films, he can be found reading, hiking, fishing, and taking photographs on film.

 

Judyta Potocka - Director of Photography

Judyta moved from Poland to Wales in 2014 to study Film Theory w/ Fine Arts at Aberystwyth University, ultimately transferring to the University of Chichester in West Sussex. At Chichester, she focused on writing and directing where she gained her Bachelors in Film Production and Screenwriting. 
Judyta continued her postgraduate studies in Filmmaking at the University for the Creative Arts in Farnham, Surrey gaining a Distinction in Cinematography. Judyta's recent works focus on topics of identity, surveillance, and voyeurism. She currently lives in London.

 

Kate Miller (Floating Pictures) - Producer

An internationally established, award-winning producer, and production company. Offering over 15 years of experience in the media industry, producing and delivering many high-end and varied projects, including film, documentary and broadcast, commercials, VR, and online media. Despite some very challenging environments and timescales, Kate has never failed to deliver on time, and on budget, always helping to realise the overall creative vision and intended audience. 

 

Alessio Marzilli - Production Designer

Alessio is an Italian writer and director, based in Rome. He studied Media Art at the Academy of Fine Arts in Frosinone (BA) and Filmmaking at the University for the Creative Arts Farnham (MA).
His works are mostly short films, documentaries and music videos. He's currently working on his first feature film while he's collaborating with the TV show Propaganda Live on LA7 network.

 

Marion Rivaux - Production Coordinator

Marion is a producer working in London. Her experience lies in creating innovative, eye-catching content for various clients. She loves combining her organisational skills from events and digital production, with tech skills and her creativity. She has recently finished the National Film & Television School, to enter the Production and AD Teams in the film industry. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Making a film always comes with risks. Many moving parts, weather, equipment issues, health and safety, etc... There are always unforeseen hiccups in production, but with the experience of our cast and crew, and your generosity, we know this project will come out on the other side. 

Thank you so much for your support of the arts and Bert & Amanda. This film cannot happen without you. If you are unable to donate at this time, please spread the word!

 

Visit our website: bertandamanda.com

story:
Film Summary

After returning from a long night shift at the Virginia State Prison in 1968, prison guard, Stan Ailor comes home to the gruesome scene of the murders of his wife and son. Three years later, Officer Ailor is still seen working his job at the prison. The prison warden, Dawson approaches Stan and gives him the news of a strange request. An inmate on death row requests to eat his final meal with Stan, in which he accepts the invitation. In the observation room we see Kenneth Ailor, the man who killed Stan’s wife and son patiently waiting for his brother to sit and dine with him. Dawson and a few guards watch through a two way mirror. Stan sits and stares at his cold blooded killer of a brother. The prison chef brings in their food, a southern-style meal. They begin to dine. The two converse back and forth, bringing up the past and events of the future. Kenneth talks about his time in his cell, disturbingly observing his brother while on the clock. Tension rises in the room as the two start discussing what exactly happened the night of the murders. Stan starts to lose it. As Kenneth says his final smart remark, Stan finally gets the revenge he's been longing for.

Genre: Thriller, Drama, Student

What We Need

Your contribution will be used in the following ways:

  • Costume & Prop Purchases
  • Craft Services
  • Transportation
  • Booking Locations
  • Practical & Visual Effects in Production & Post-Production
  • Original Music Composition
  • Film Festival Fees

    The Impact

    What happens when A Little Glass of Rum is completed? Here are a few benefits this film has for us as filmmakers after Post-Production:

    • Helps us build our resumes, portfolios and reels for upcoming career opportunities after graduation
    • Helps us get recognized as filmmakers in film festivals
    • Allows us to collaborate and network with new actors & crew members
    • Allows us to gain more experience in the film industry

    Risks & Challenges

    A Little Glass of Rum  has come with a few challenges that we as a crew must work together to tackle:

    • The film is a 1960s/70s period piece, which means we have to transform our 2021 locations/sets back 50 years
    • A portion of the film takes place in a jail cell block, which can be difficult to lock as a location
    • The film contains visual effects, which can be very costly & time consuming

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to donate to our project, there are alternative ways to help:

    • Share this campaign on your social medias!
    • Keep up to date on our social medias and share updated content we post!
    • Instagram/Facebook: @alittleglassofrum

    Thank you for your time, energy and support of our project! Every ounce of support is very much appreciated!

story:
WALPURGIS NIGHT, A disturbing fresh take on the classic werewolf story.

 

Synopsis:

A wealthy couple, Imre and Justine, are visiting the deep forests of Romania and find themselves at the mercy of Waldemar Daninsky, THE WEREWOLF. The wolf terrorizes the countryside, killing anyone in its path. But Waldemar desperately seeks a cure to his lycanthropy. After a horrific tragedy strikes, Waldemar and Justine travel to London to seek the help from of Dr. Jekyll's grandson. But when the full moon rises... The werewolf becomes loose in London!  Justine and Jekyll must quickly find a way to end this horrible curse.

 

ON JUNE 11TH 2021 WE COMPLETED PRINCIPAL PHOTOGRAPHY BUT WE ARE SEEKING ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO FINISH THE FILM'S POST-PRODUCTION.

We have some great perks available for YOU, the backer!  Have a CUSTOM WEREWOLF MASK JUST FOR YOU, COSTUMES, T-SHIRTS, IMDB CREDITS, and MUCH MORE!

ALSO GET THE SOUNDTRACK BY CHRISTOPHER YOUNG AND EDWIN WENDLER!

(Christopher Young- Hellraiser, Drag Me to Hell, Pet Sematary)

(Edwin Wendler- Dead Ant, I Spit on Your Grave III, X-Men Apocalypse)

Thank you so much for taking the time to look at the campaign. If you cannot contribute...

PLEASE SHARE!

Once again, THANK YOU SO MUCH for checking out the page and being interested in our campaign. We hope you join us on this journey to bring a truly horrifying story to the screen!

story:
WELCOME to our page! We would like to invite you to help support our vision for our Short Film - "You & Me." A Gangster, Drama, Romance about a man named Daniel who joins a notorious mob in order to find belonging and self-worth but his loyalty is tested when his Mob Boss orders him to murder an ex-gang member.  

My name is Alejandro Pelayo and I am an actor based in Los Angeles. Our plan is to eventually make this short film into a Feature Film! Writer Isaac Pelayo and I are in the pursuit of creating content packed with emotion and impact. How many times have we seen a flashy movie or a repetitive show for us to watch, only to push into a dark corner of our mind, never to be thought of again. We want our audience to not just be entertained, but to feel connected to our film and to share a greater message. 

 

For this project, we want to spread a message of self-worth and inspiration, a topic that we hold near and dear for ourselves. It's very easy to slip into a mind-set in life that you are not ENOUGH. That your insecurities and flaws make you insignificant. However we want to share that you are ENOUGH and that your true friends and family will love you for who you are. 

We have assembled a passionate team of actors and creators to make this project a reality, but we are missing the last piece of the puzzle, YOU! Your assistance in funding our project is the final step in making it a reality. 

By donating you are helping pay for:

  • Crew
  • Camera equipment
  • Production expenses
  • Actor's pay
  • Post-production

This can only be possible with your help! We appreciate your donation more than you know and to show it we have laid out a lot of perks, so go snatch them up before they're all gone!

For those of you still reading and who are wondering why the writer and I share the same last name, its because we are in fact brothers! If you had asked us years ago if we thought we would join in the creative and thrilling pursuit of acting and writing I think we would have died of laughter. Life is funny like that I suppose, but now that we are here we can honestly say that we wouldn't have it any other way.

If you aren't able to donate you can still support us by sharing our campaign with your friends and family! Thank you! Instagram Page: @youandme_shortfilm
story_txt:
WELCOME to our page! We would like to invite you to help support our vision for our Short Film - "You & Me." A Gangster, Drama, Romance about a man named Daniel who joins a notorious mob in order to find belonging and self-worth but his loyalty is tested when his Mob Boss orders him to murder an ex-gang member.  
My name is Alejandro Pelayo and I am an actor based in Los Angeles. Our plan is to eventually make this short film into a Feature Film! Writer Isaac Pelayo and I are in the pursuit of creating content packed with emotion and impact. How many times have we seen a flashy movie or a repetitive show for us to watch, only to push into a dark corner of our mind, never to be thought of again. We want our audience to not just be entertained, but to feel connected to our film and to share a greater message. 

 
For this project, we want to spread a message of self-worth and inspiration, a topic that we hold near and dear for ourselves. It's very easy to slip into a mind-set in life that you are not ENOUGH. That your insecurities and flaws make you insignificant. However we want to share that you are ENOUGH and that your true friends and family will love you for who you are. 
We have assembled a passionate team of actors and creators to make this project a reality, but we are missing the last piece of the puzzle, YOU! Your assistance in funding our project is the final step in making it a reality. 
By donating you are helping pay for:

Crew
Camera equipment
Production expenses
Actor's pay
Post-production

This can only be possible with your help! We appreciate your donation more than you know and to show it we have laid out a lot of perks, so go snatch them up before they're all gone!
For those of you still reading and who are wondering why the writer and I share the same last name, its because we are in fact brothers! If you had asked us years ago if we thought we would join in the creative and thrilling pursuit of acting and writing I think we would have died of laughter. Life is funny like that I suppose, but now that we are here we can honestly say that we wouldn't have it any other way.
If you aren't able to donate you can still support us by sharing our campaign with your friends and family! Thank you! Instagram Page: @youandme_shortfilm

story:
Why support SEFF17?

SEFF16 was a success and we want it to continue as an annual event.

  • SEFF16 played 50 films from across the world. 15 of those 50 were from South Dakota filmmakers. 8 came from filmmakers within the region,
  • SEFF17 is focusing heavily on South Dakota filmmakers and South Dakota made films. We love Sioux Falls and we love South Dakota, and want more people to see the talented filmmakers from the area.
  • Support the arts! Filmmaking is an art and more people need to see that filmmaking is a vibrant growing community within Sioux Falls and South Dakota.

What We Need & What You Get

Here are some of what we need and what you get back in return for your support:

  • A majority of the funds raised will be used to pay the remaining amount due to the venue. From that we will use the remaining funds for print materials (programs, award letters, etc) and promo items (t-shirts, hats, buttons, etc.)
  • See your name and/or logo on the big screen throughout the festival! Special signage in the theater lobby will feature each and every contributor. The more you contribute the more visibility you and/or your business will get.
  • Even if the goal isn't reached, every little bit will help pay for SEFF17.

What helping SEFF17 means?

Your help means that the Sioux Empire Film Festival will continue on as an annual event and be a platform for local filmmakers to present their work on the big screen:

  • Supporting the arts is important. Sioux Falls needs an event like this to thrive to help out filmmakers and show continued support so they continue to make films and grow as artists.
  • SEFF16 was attended by over 1000 people. That's great for a first year event! Let's continue on and make it bigger.
  • The more funds we raise the more we can do. If this continues as an annual event, it can become bigger, we can add more days,  and we can start looking at bringing in special guests (Kevin Smith anyone?, South Dakota's own January Jones?)

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute here, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Even if you can't make a monetary contribution, SHARE our campaign. Let people know about SEFF. Share this campaign through all possible avenues (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter).
  • Have an in-kind donation? Something we can raffle off? Anything helps.
  • Make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And introducing the SEFF Filmmaker Grant

  • With additional funds we have left after the venue and print materials, along with a percentage of ticket sales and merchandise sales during the festival, we are creating the SEFF Filmmaker Grant.
  • The SEFF Filmmaker Grant will be given out to one South Dakota filmmaker.
  • The SEFF Board of Directors will take submissions and vote on who receives the grant. The grant will go towards the filmmakers' next film.
  • We not only set up SEFF to be a yearly festival, but we also want to help out local filmmakers to continue fine tuning their craft and continue to make films.

SEFF17 is going to be a blast and you can be a part of it!! We are currently looking at premiering many South Dakota made films during SEFF17!

We are a South Dakota non-profit, so any donation you make is tax deductible. We can provide you with a receipt for your donation.
