story:
In a fantastical, steam-punk world, creations were made; Creators adopted very young children from a month to three years old and enhanced them with special objects or mechanical attachments. But then, Society decreed an order for the creators to re-purpose their creations according to the signature of Society’s standard design plan, making extraordinary creations more original. If the creators refused, their titles would be revoked. One abandoned creation in particular named Zoe was never repurposed. So a sixteen-year-old Zoe leaves her orphanage to find her creator, the only person who can re-purpose her. Zoe has trouble accepting herself; she thinks she is a useless and broken creation. Though Zoe’s creator called The Button Maker is now bitter and old and her title revoked long ago, she re-discovers her own purpose and passion again. The Button Maker must show Zoe that she was created for a purpose, and the creator does not make useless things.

We are going to need a lot of help to bring this steam-punk inspired world to life. Donations will be going toward transportation, food, equipment, costume, location, and most importantly production design and make-up. 

If you can not donate at this time, do not worry about it! Another great way to help support the production is by sharing the link to our Indigogo page on your Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram. You can also help giving our Facebook page a like and spread the news of our project to your friends. Lets make an extraordinary creation!

story:
More to the ultra running story. 

On May 26th, Jesse and Crystal set out on another adventure — a 100 mile adventure — in Goshen, Vermont. But, the real adventure started months and even years before that and it continued on after 38 hours of moving [mostly, in the form of running]. You see, you don’t get to any start line without a lot of heart, sacrifice and a little grit. And, you definitely don’t get there alone - it takes a solid why, support from those closest to you, and a community that makes extraordinary seem ordinary.

This documentary provides real life and real talk on ultra running [that's distances further than 26.2 miles]. You are invited into the home, on to the trails, and through day to day real life of a few good humans [so-called, "ultra runners"]. While, Jesse and Crystal are highlighted as the self-proclaimed, “documentary stars,”  it is important to remember that their story is being shared and told for something more. They train hard, live life hard, work hard, race hard races [together] and they most importantly celebrate the steps and miles[tones] along the way. But, they are not the only ones who do this...

This documentary will tell a few stories of ultra runners - the community and people that make the endurance adventure what it is. As ultra runners, we have different reasons for running — a why — but, we run [shuffle, jog and barely move at times too]. We have vast goals, backgrounds, and life experience but, our connection is constant — it is grounded on intentional movement and thought.

The stories are as real as ultra running gets. The miles [and, miles and miles] change you. As you put one foot in front of the other [simple in theory] you are reminded just what you are made of. Running shows you limits and then asks you to promptly break them. It requires you to show up, not just on race day, but every day. But, don't take my word for it - hear it, see it and feel it via this documentary. 

We hope this film inspires you. Period. Maybe it inspires you to run [because we believe that anyone can do it] or maybe it inspires you to face something entirely different. When the documentary footage comes to an end, and the television turns off, we hope that you see this is much bigger than a glimpse into the life of two or three people . We hope that your heart is beating with [real] life and you are motivated to move forward, with a strong faith in self, unshakeable confidence and a renewed sense of passion.

The Details: 

This is the important part, this is why we need YOU. 

The documentary highlights [life] adventure and it started  in Vermont, at Infinitus, hosted by the Endurance Society. Jesse and Crystal ran 100 miles [together], Hannah provided all the mothering/crewing, Prem made the choice to run 100 in place of 88k because he believed it was important to take on something he didn't know if he could finish [he did!], and Kareem spent all the hours on his feet in those mountains to come in to the finish with a few hours to spare [that's grit]. Their stories are real, and they are all different. 

The story emphasizes that life continues on Monday after race day, every time. You run for ____ distance and ____ hours and then the day ends and life, as scheduled, resumes. It looks and feels a little bit different, but it resumes.

Reg [and team] followed Jesse & Crystal and a few other ultra runners through every day life pre-race, race day life [Infinitus 100 miles, Vermont], and are now continuing to watch the story unfold as all runners have been back in the real world for over a month. This is an ongoing project, it did not end with 100 miles. 

This documentary will share the adventure stories of good humans, real life and race day thoughts [don't forget, the real stuff comes before and after race day].

This documentary will highlight East Coast trail running - the Green Mountains are beautiful, rocky, muddy and push those who adventure out on the terrain to physical and mental limits [and, then some].

This documentary will inspire. PERIOD. Maybe it inspires you to run [because we believe that anyone can do it] or maybe it inspires you to face something entirely different.

​What we need. What you get. 

Remember when I said you never get to the start line alone? Well, we can't take on this adventure alone either. Your support, your story, your belief in us and the ultra running community - that's what will make this ongoing story of life, running and heart possible.

The second stage of production is underway, and the next stages are TBD. The life adventure is also TBD. Anything goes on race day. Remember, running changes you. The project hype is centered around the real life of these ultra running adventures -- the vulnerability, the full circle inspiration, and the intentional movement that makes life complete. 

Now, to make connection go full circle. We owe you a big thank you. This adventure is not possible without you - your support, your story, and your belief in us will never go unnoticed. Jesse and Crystal will be offering some amazing perks that include favorite workouts, webinars [on training  and fueling for daily performance], and health coaching to help you reach your goals.

*  100% of the funds will be used for production expenses.  
 

Impact. 

Your support and donation will help make this documentary come to life. The circle of inspiration will expand, and you will be part of it too. 

Like we said, human connection is powerful. We don't do the things we do alone. If this ultra running story inspires, intrigues, and/or excites you, help us spread the word and inspire others.

The impact is in the film and the hype, captured in words and motion, to share with the world. The power of impact --

When the documentary footage comes to an end, and the television turns off, we hope that you see this is much bigger than a glimpse into the life of Jesse and Crystal [and, a handful of other documentary stars to be announced at a later date]. ​We hope that your heart is beating with [real] life and you are motivated to move forward, with a strong faith in self, unshakeable confidence and a renewed sense of passion. 
 

Risks & Challenges.

Sometimes you have to jump when opportunity presents. Sometimes the timing is a little less than ideal. And, sometimes you take that and run with it, literally. Footage is still rolling, and the first big milestone is checked off the list. Funds are needed to support the production crew who  captured the best moments [highs and lows] in the Green Mountains from all perspectives. That was phase one. The story continues and there is more to capture, including real life and another race day. 

The production crew has and will put in their fair share of miles too. They will face the same trails, rocks, mud and bugs as the runners. They face real life today. 

Thank you for your support, your belief in the power of extraordinary, and helping spread the word and hype so that we have the opportunity to tell a story. 

It's amazing what happens when you decide to lace up your shoes, accept the challenge, and start to run -- here we are, living life, running all the miles and capturing it on film.

- Crystal & Jesse

story: The short film THE KNOCK AT THE DOOR will be shot in Washington, DC and used to pitch potential feature projects to future investors.
story_txt: The short film THE KNOCK AT THE DOOR will be shot in Washington, DC and used to pitch potential feature projects to future investors.

story:
Synopsis

It is 1953, North Korea: the Korean War is coming to its end as both sides become aware of the inevitable divide between the northern and southern territories. Two Korean sisters, Young-Hee and Jung-Sook, escape the captivity of North Korean Communist Soldiers and head towards the 38th Parallel to find freedom and their parents. During this journey, they struggle to overcome their fear of being captured, the uncertainty of being reunited with their family, and the endless sacrifices that must be made to survive.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will help us move forward into pick-ups to ensure we can make this film the best it can be. It will also help us complete this film through post-production and our distribution phase.

100% of your donations will be used for the following:

  • Camera Department (camera & lighting equipment, 16mm film, etc.)
  • Art Department (wardrobe, hair & make-up, production design, props, etc.)
  • Casting (principal and supporting talent)
  • Catering (to feed our hard-working cast & crew!)
  • Post Production (film development, editing, color correcting, etc.)
  • & more!

The Impact

Based on true events, DIVIDED is an opportunity to shed light on a historical moment that has tragically affected thousands of people in both North and South Korea, and the United States. Nicknamed as “The Forgotten War”, many of its heroes and victims have gone unnoticed from this event due to lack of acknowledgment. At least 100,000 recorded families have been separated from the result of the division of the Korean peninsula (a.k.a. The 38th Parallel) and at least 300,000 people have been abducted or gone missing during wartime. This film will serve as the voice of many forgotten victims who have sacrificed their lives for the pursuit of freedom south of the parallel.

We plan to submit this film to various festivals (domestic and international) and reach a wide audience to share the important message conveyed in this story.

Other Ways You Can Help

By sharing our video, link, and social media sites with your friends and family, you will help us reach a wider audience and help this story get the attention it deserves!

A huge THANK YOU from the DIVIDED Cast and Crew!!

story:
A Very Brief History of 'Ōahi

The 'Ōahi ceremony is a traditional Hawaiian fire-throwing ceremony dating back to ancient times, performed by a select few and shrouded in secrecy. In the darkness of night, the chosen fire throwers would perform this ritual from the mountain peaks overlooking the ocean on the Napali coast and the spectators in the heiau (temple) below. There are accounts of this ritual in old text.

'Ōahi was known to the other islands and is a proud tradition unique to Kauai. There are many legends including the tale of the great fire throwing boy which the Menehune has immortalized and continues to tell at Limahuli Gardens on one of their many tours.

Due to the outside influences, from religious missionaries to foreign governments, the art form was all but lost, however, a select few practitioners retained the knowledge and practiced in secrecy, until now.

 

Documentary Synopsis (30-60 min film)

On the North Shore of the island of Kauai in the Hawaiian Islands, Moku Chandler, a native in his mid-thirties, and his family seek to revitalize the all-but-lost ancient art form of fire throwing, and the 'ŌAHI ceremony. The ancestry of Moku and MokuBoi, his son, goes back to the Hawaiians deep within the Na Pali coast. It is there that 'Ōahi was born and it is there it will be brought back.

Makana Ridge is the gateway to the Na Pali Coast and one of the most sacred places in all of the world -- a true vortex. MokuBoi, a way-finder and crew member of Hokulea on several legs of the Malama Honua tour, will be there in Hanalei to greet our documentary crew and formally invite them to his ceremony. We follow Moku from the prep and through the ceremony all the way through the departure of Hokulea and Moku returning to his life on the land and sea of Kauai.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The ask is $12,000 dollars for for cameras, operators, sound, transportation, food and housing to help us follow Moku on his journey.

While we could use twice as much, we know we can pull it off for $12,000 if necessary and we wanted to set an attainable goal.

Traditionally, we would have needed helicopters and film to get this done, but we have drones and memory cards now so it's much more doable. What would have taken National Geographic $300,000 to do in the ‘80s, we can do for $12,000 now.

We are up against the clock and this budget, but with the favors and the aloha we are feeling, this shouldn't be a problem.

With Hokulea potentially involved, the exact dates become harder to pin down. However, with a little budget help we can ensure success by covering expenses for extra days, preparation and surrounding interviews.

What you will get out of this (besides your very own BluRay of this documentary to keep forever)? The satisfaction that you had a hand in documenting and preserving history at this pivotal point in time and it would not have happened without you. Mahalo Nui Loa!!!

 

The Impact

With so much secrecy and mystique around the ancient 'Ōahi ceremony, very little is known about it. Moku and his son are two of the only people left on Earth with this knowledge. We must make a record for all times. Until now the 'Ōahi has been waiting in the darkness to burn brightly again. The resurrection of the OAHI is one of Moku's life's missions.

We get to show the world one of the most unique stories ever told.

Local Hawaiians get to preserve their culture by telling their own authentic story.

We’re making positive programming with a positive impact.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

We are looking for places to house crew.

We need to transport lots of people, so rides are a big help.

Hungry starving artists alway appreciate an unexpected meal if you got extra food.

We are always happy to have help lugging gear and to keep the good times rolling. Let us know if you are local and would like to help pitch in. Any type of aloha is welcome.

Mahalo, mahalo, mahalo!!!
story_txt:
A Very Brief History of 'Ōahi
The 'Ōahi ceremony is a traditional Hawaiian fire-throwing ceremony dating back to ancient times, performed by a select few and shrouded in secrecy. In the darkness of night, the chosen fire throwers would perform this ritual from the mountain peaks overlooking the ocean on the Napali coast and the spectators in the heiau (temple) below. There are accounts of this ritual in old text.
'Ōahi was known to the other islands and is a proud tradition unique to Kauai. There are many legends including the tale of the great fire throwing boy which the Menehune has immortalized and continues to tell at Limahuli Gardens on one of their many tours.
Due to the outside influences, from religious missionaries to foreign governments, the art form was all but lost, however, a select few practitioners retained the knowledge and practiced in secrecy, until now.
 
Documentary Synopsis (30-60 min film)
On the North Shore of the island of Kauai in the Hawaiian Islands, Moku Chandler, a native in his mid-thirties, and his family seek to revitalize the all-but-lost ancient art form of fire throwing, and the 'ŌAHI ceremony. The ancestry of Moku and MokuBoi, his son, goes back to the Hawaiians deep within the Na Pali coast. It is there that 'Ōahi was born and it is there it will be brought back.
Makana Ridge is the gateway to the Na Pali Coast and one of the most sacred places in all of the world -- a true vortex. MokuBoi, a way-finder and crew member of Hokulea on several legs of the Malama Honua tour, will be there in Hanalei to greet our documentary crew and formally invite them to his ceremony. We follow Moku from the prep and through the ceremony all the way through the departure of Hokulea and Moku returning to his life on the land and sea of Kauai.
 
What We Need & What You Get
The ask is $12,000 dollars for for cameras, operators, sound, transportation, food and housing to help us follow Moku on his journey.
While we could use twice as much, we know we can pull it off for $12,000 if necessary and we wanted to set an attainable goal.
Traditionally, we would have needed helicopters and film to get this done, but we have drones and memory cards now so it's much more doable. What would have taken National Geographic $300,000 to do in the ‘80s, we can do for $12,000 now.
We are up against the clock and this budget, but with the favors and the aloha we are feeling, this shouldn't be a problem.
With Hokulea potentially involved, the exact dates become harder to pin down. However, with a little budget help we can ensure success by covering expenses for extra days, preparation and surrounding interviews.
What you will get out of this (besides your very own BluRay of this documentary to keep forever)? The satisfaction that you had a hand in documenting and preserving history at this pivotal point in time and it would not have happened without you. Mahalo Nui Loa!!!
 
The Impact
With so much secrecy and mystique around the ancient 'Ōahi ceremony, very little is known about it. Moku and his son are two of the only people left on Earth with this knowledge. We must make a record for all times. Until now the 'Ōahi has been waiting in the darkness to burn brightly again. The resurrection of the OAHI is one of Moku's life's missions.
We get to show the world one of the most unique stories ever told.
Local Hawaiians get to preserve their culture by telling their own authentic story.
We’re making positive programming with a positive impact.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
We are looking for places to house crew.
We need to transport lots of people, so rides are a big help.
Hungry starving artists alway appreciate an unexpected meal if you got extra food.
We are always happy to have help lugging gear and to keep the good times rolling. Let us know if you are local and would like to help pitch in. Any type of aloha is welcome.
Mahalo, mahalo, mahalo!!!

story:
Where we are today 

The story's all been staged and sung and shot, but now we need to turn it into a film.

This past summer a small group of talented filmmakers, actors and musicians combined their creative energy to bring Killian and the Comeback Kids to life. Many had never met, spent time in rural America, or worked so many long hot days! As Sondheim famously sang, “Art Isn’t Easy”. 

With the support of our generous investors, the local community, our fabulous actors and musicians (both famous and up and coming) our awesome crew -- and now you -- we can complete this film! 

We want to share this film with all the broke college students, music lovers, small town activists, worried parents and forgotten communities across the country -- but we’ll need your help to complete the film by Spring! 

How you can help 

Now that we have completed the film shoot we have a lot of post production work to do to make the film shine. We'll need to record the music in a studio, add some special effects, edit the film, mix the music and dialog, and correct the color.  We need your help!

Meet the team

Writer/Director: Taylor A. Purdee is the co-creator of the Yippie-Ki Ay! Do Cinema, interview series and has spent much of the last year overseeing the protection and re-release of screen legend Lee Grant’s documentary work. Purdee's debut filmThis is Honduras, is a documentary exploration of the relationship between humanitarian aid workers and the post-coup government of Honduras, the “murder capital” of the world. The film recently premiered with the most financially successful screening of the 2016 Chagrin Documentary Film Festival. His work is seen by someone, somewhere, every day, and has been awarded by the Young Arts organization, New York University, Fordham University, The Friars Club, and SAG. Taylor is a graduate of Fordham University with a BA in Theatre.

DP: Ian Mosley Duffy grew up in southern New Jersey, a son of two multilingual high school teachers. From a young age Ian traveled the world, living abroad for months at a time. He began skateboarding in his teens, making skateboard videos with his friends. This learning process gave him a foundation to pursue a career in film. He has worked in many facets of the film industry, understanding the importance of crew positions including grip, best boy, gaffer, clapper/loader, and 1st AC.  His commitment to film has brought him to work on projects across the United States, Mexico and Europe.  Ian works locally in the Philadelphia/NY area and is a proud member of the international camera guild.  

Producer: Roberta Morris Purdee began her career working with Academy Award winning Actress and Director Lee Grant. After producing many of Grant's films she opened Karmic Release, Ltd. with husband Nathan Purdee.  Since then Karmic Release and Feury/Grant have joined forces to make such ground breaking documentaries as the Emmy Award Winning Baghdad ER. Morris-Purdee has produced more than 18 films with Karmic Release Ltd. since it began in 1992. Her works have been honored with Emmy, Peabody, duPont-Columbia, and Cine Golden Eagle awards, as well as a place on the 1999 Academy Award Short List, for her personal favorite Wallowitch & Ross: THIS MOMENT.

Co-Producer: Suzanne Ordas Curry started in PR with her own firm publicizing actors, entertainers and musicians, and though she still does this, is also producing. She was co-producer of the award-winning theatrically-released film Equity (2016), starring Anna Gunn, Alysia Reiner and James Purefoy. She is an associate producer for two series on Amazon, The Other F Word with Steve Guttenberg, Judy Gold and Gilbert Gottfriend and the Emmy-Nominated Tainted Dreams starring Alicia Minshew,  RHONJ Dina Manzo, Mr. Pec-Tacular and many top soap stars. She is also an associate producer of the documentary Seeing is Believing, Women Direct by Cady McClain. Current projects include The Pages film with Jamie Lee Curtis and Tika Sumter and Egg starring Alysia Reiner, Anna Camp, Christina Hendricks and Gbenge Akinnagbe. She writes about her projects and other entertainment topics with a focus on females on www.SuzeeBehindtheScenes.com.

Music: Liam Higgins, Taylor A. Purdee Dubbed "The Cumberland Kids," the duo provided some of the inspiration and all of the music for the film. Having played around New York City for the last few years, their narrative folk-rock is currently being culled into a single debut "super-album".

Production Design: Liam Dague is a Production Designer from Nazareth, PA. A graduate of DeSales University with a Bachelor of the Arts in TV/Film, Liam has worked on many local films including the short film Control. With a passion for color and story, Liam connected with the film's writer/director Taylor Purdee to tell a story that could only be told in their hometown. Finding the views specific to the Lehigh Valley and dressing the band for hot summer days, Liam enjoyed working with the entire cast and crew.

CAST

"Mrs. Raison" Kassie DePaiva is currently starring as Eve Donovan on Days of Our Lives. Kassie grew up deep in Kentucky, one of four children in a Southern Baptist family, where she studied dance and sang at school and church and 4-H talent shows. "Music has always been my strength," says the three-time Emmy Nominee, who has portrayed the character Blair Cramer on ABC's One Life to Live and appeared previously on CBS's The Guiding Light as Chelsea Reardon during the late-'80s.  "It doesn't matter," she says, "what kind of camera you put in front of me, whether it's 35-millimeter or video or high-def: I'm going to try to present the most real and honest performance that I can."

"Mr. Raison" Nathan Purdee is one of the leading Daytime Television actors of his generation. A key player on some of America's most beloved serials, from his ground breaking role as Nathan "Kong" Hastings on CBS' The Young and the Restless, Santa Barbara's Jeb (in whose skin Purdee performed the first inter-racial kiss on Daytime Television) to straight shooting District Attorney Hank "The Cannon" Gannon on ABC's One Life to Live. He revived the classic 70’s character Superfly in the 1990 motion picture The Return of Superfly. Purdee has been honored with seven NAACP image award nominations, two AUDELCO Award nominations for his efforts in New York's historic "Black Theatres," as well as having played a starring role on The Young and the Restless and One Life to Live over the years of their combined five nominations and three wins of the Daytime Emmy's "Outstanding Drama Series" award. He has been seen most recently on the revolutionary, made for the web, Emmy nominated, series' House of Cards and Tainted Dreams. The latter of which was nominated for the first ever "Outstanding New Approaches in a Drama Series" Daytime Television Emmy in 2014 and Outstanding Digital Series in 2017."Tristan" Shane Andries born and raised in Houston, TX, hung up his baseball mitt and went on to attend The University of North Carolina School of the Arts receiving a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the School of Drama. Upon graduating, he was awarded the Kenan Fellowship at Lincoln Center in New York City and shortly thereafter landed a job with Blue Man Group where he performed with the show Off-Broadway (NYC), as well as shows in Boston, Orlando, and as a cast member of the National Tour.  As a proud member of both SAG and EQUITY, he's worked in film and television (NBC, CBS, SHOWTIME), regional theater and commercials. 

"Sam" John Donchak is a NYC actor with Chicago roots.  Since graduating Fordham's theatre program ('14), John enjoys incorporating his fluency in french, along with fight choreography, to his roles (when applicable, which didn't happen so much on this one).  From theater to film, John enjoys finding the earnestness in the characters he plays, and is thrilled to call this his first leading role in a feature film.  Recent leading experience in short films include The Many Adventures of the Jonathan's Higgin (Jonathan Higgin), Bedford Chase, Domestic, and Ice Cream. He Co-Hosts the Yippie Ki-Ay! Do Cinema interview podcast with Taylor Purdee and can also be seen on occasion walking with purpose in the background of various New York T.V.and Film productions.  

 "Therese" Yael Elishiva is a New York based actress, director and activist. She is a teaching artist for Drama Club NYC and teaches improv and drama to incarcerated youth in New York City. You can catch her in the multi award winning scifi web series Here We Wait, as Siv the leader of the waitstaff. Some independent short film credits include Naomi in Waking Up, and Layla in When the Lights Go Out. She plays Ava in the mocumentary series MIRL that comes out this summer.  Yael recently directed her first play as part of the New York Winterfest Theater Festival as well as a comedy short that will be released in the spring. Proud CAP21 Alum. 

"Rowan" Genesis Mccaulley. This film marks the 11 year-olds film debut, she's currently looking forward to both the "And Introducing" title before her name, and the 5th grade. 

"Melanie" Emily Mest is a Los Angeles based actress and singer-songwriter. She toured with the Broadway productions of Spring Awakening and Oliver and can be seen in  upcoming Paramount film The Malibu Tapes. She released two singles and music videos in 2017 under her music pseudonym Harlie and will be releasing more music in 2018. 

"Rose" Shannon O'Boyle is a Broadway actress and proud member of Actors Equity. Currently she can be seen on Broadway as Nicola in Kinky Boots. Most recently she has been seen on Broadway as Girl in Once the Musical, but she has enjoyed a wide range of roles from Shakespeare to axe-wielding rockstar. She has also worked regionally in such renowned companies as Playhouse Square, Berkeley Repertory Theatre, Great Lakes Theatre and Idaho Shakespeare Festival. Shannon received her BM in Music Theatre from The Baldwin-Wallace University Conservatory of Music under the direction of Victoria Bussert in May 2012.  "Josh" Andrew O'Shanick is a classically trained baritone from Midlothian, VA. He most recently appeared as the Soldier and Bartender in the Huntington Theatre Company's Sunday in the Park with George. Andrew was seen performing at the Huntington last year as well, playing Mr. Lindquist in the critically acclaimed production of A Little Night Music. An avid performer of operatic repertoire, Andrew has performed roles in Britten's A Midsummer Night's Dream, The Magic Flute, Iphigénie en Tauride, The Rake's Progress, Dove's Flight, La Traviata, and Adamo's Little Women, among others. In addition to his vocal studies, Andrew is also an accomplished violinist and has performed at the Kennedy Center, The Strathmore, and the Spoleto Festival. 

"Killian" Taylor A. Purdee's usually on the other side of lights, but as an actor has made his way around New York's theatres, stumbled into a number of short films, digital series, pilots and music videos. And voiced way more radio ads than he'd realized before writing this down. He co-hosts the Yippie-Ki Ay! Do Cinema interview podcast with John Donchak, and plays folk music anywhere in New York that doesn't require a permit.

Supporting Cast

Maryellen Conroy, Lisa Foley, Dave Fry, Tim Shuman, Dylan Ungaretta, Kyle Walton, John Weiss, and Chase Yenser.  

Behind the scenes

Crew:  Our fabulous crew -- this movie could not have been made without the creative, dedicated crew that joined us for the long hot summer in Easton, Pennsylvania.  Thanks to Gabe Boucher, Marina Christine, Maria Class, Beth Clausnitzer, Kelly Kanaley, Anna Langman, Josh Lederman, Isaac Leggett, Dave Ondusko, Sean Regan, Dylan Rex, Mariah Simone, Josh Synoracki, and the DeSales crew -- Ben Musser, Jacob Metzger, Joe Crognale, Myles Machin, and Rees Lobban!  

Campaign Marketing: Alex Nielsen is a graduate of Monmouth University. In May of 2017, he concluded his 5 year enrollment at Monmouth University and had earned both a Bachelor's and a Master's degree, which were both focused around marketing and business administration. 

New Projects Intern: Leah Cozart is from Huntington, New York and is a Sophomore at Pace University on the NYC Campus.  There she is pursuing a double major in Film & Screen Studies and Communications.  Currently, Leah is involved in the Pace Sketch Comedy group in which she has both directed and acted in several skits.  While at Walt Whitman High School, Leah was intensely involved in the theater department where she had roles in many of the school productions and behind the stage, she was part of the stage crew leadership.   Her interests moved from the stage and she decided to pursue a career in film instead due to the abundance of opportunities that the film industry offers.

Generous Community Support: Special thanks to Angelo "Doc" Velasquez and Future Fires Records; Invite Only Studios; Chris Leon; The Boomtown Studio; Easton Mayor Sal Panto, Karen Roscioli and staff; Costume Designer Sue Gandy; The Crayola Factory, Weyerbacher, Chrinergy, The Evangelical Lutheran Church, FIFO, The Lafayette Bar, Twin Rivers Music, Lehigh Valley Charter H.S. for the Arts, Regina Strayhorn, Bronwyn Bishop, Kendall Cafaro, A'Keyah Williams, Chuck Gloman @ DeSales University -- and our interesting energetic background actors of all ages! 

Share, share, share

In addition to making a contribution you could be instrumental in helping us by sharing this campaign, following us on social media, telling your family, friends and colleagues about this project -- and checking in for updates!  Share the campaign on campus and ask us for some music for your campus radio station. We've got a special perk in mind for the person who generates the most shares.

Risks & Challenges

Making a film is never easy!  Each one comes with it's own set of challenges. This one required working around Kinky Boots' Broadway show schedule, TV dates for Days of Our Lives filmed on the west coast, a play in North Carolina, recording dates in LA, 2 weddings, unpredictable rain, and the 5th grade!

We've done a lot of filmmaking and had some great successes -- please help us get Killian and the Comeback Kids to the finish line. We need to raise $50,000 to stay on schedule, raising more would be great (needed for PR and other support) if we raise less we will continue on to keep our momentum - hoping for deep discounts and extended payment options.     

Karmic Release Ltd. is an award winning multi-media production company specializing in independent films and Studio Features. Notable films/properties include Wallowitch & Ross: This Moment, (Oscar Short List 1999) Baghdad ER (4 Emmys. DuPont, Peabody Award) Tarnation (Cannes, Sundance) Walk Away Renee (Cannes Queer Palm Nominee) Our Heroes Ourselves. (Cine Golden Eagle) What Sex Am I? (HBO). A Father, A Son, Once Upon A Time in Hollywood (HBO). Down and Out in America (Academy Award 1987).

Do Cinema interview podcast with John Donchak, and plays folk music anywhere in New York that doesn't require a permit.Supporting CastMaryellen Conroy, Lisa Foley, Dave Fry, Tim Shuman, Dylan Ungaretta, Kyle Walton, John Weiss, and Chase Yenser.  Behind the scenesCrew:  Our fabulous crew -- this movie could not have been made without the creative, dedicated crew that joined us for the long hot summer in Easton, Pennsylvania.  Thanks to Gabe Boucher, Marina Christine, Maria Class, Beth Clausnitzer, Kelly Kanaley, Anna Langman, Josh Lederman, Isaac Leggett, Dave Ondusko, Sean Regan, Dylan Rex, Mariah Simone, Josh Synoracki, and the DeSales crew -- Ben Musser, Jacob Metzger, Joe Crognale, Myles Machin, and Rees Lobban!  Campaign Marketing: Alex Nielsen is a graduate of Monmouth University. In May of 2017, he concluded his 5 year enrollment at Monmouth University and had earned both a Bachelor's and a Master's degree, which were both focused around marketing and business administration. New Projects Intern: Leah Cozart is from Huntington, New York and is a Sophomore at Pace University on the NYC Campus.  There she is pursuing a double major in Film & Screen Studies and Communications.  Currently, Leah is involved in the Pace Sketch Comedy group in which she has both directed and acted in several skits.  While at Walt Whitman High School, Leah was intensely involved in the theater department where she had roles in many of the school productions and behind the stage, she was part of the stage crew leadership.   Her interests moved from the stage and she decided to pursue a career in film instead due to the abundance of opportunities that the film industry offers.Generous Community Support: Special thanks to Angelo "Doc" Velasquez and Future Fires Records; Invite Only Studios; Chris Leon; The Boomtown Studio; Easton Mayor Sal Panto, Karen Roscioli and staff; Costume Designer Sue Gandy; The Crayola Factory, Weyerbacher, Chrinergy, The Evangelical Lutheran Church, FIFO, The Lafayette Bar, Twin Rivers Music, Lehigh Valley Charter H.S. for the Arts, Regina Strayhorn, Bronwyn Bishop, Kendall Cafaro, A'Keyah Williams, Chuck Gloman @ DeSales University -- and our interesting energetic background actors of all ages! Share, share, shareIn addition to making a contribution you could be instrumental in helping us by sharing this campaign, following us on social media, telling your family, friends and colleagues about this project -- and checking in for updates!  Share the campaign on campus and ask us for some music for your campus radio station. We've got a special perk in mind for the person who generates the most shares.Risks & ChallengesMaking a film is never easy!  Each one comes with it's own set of challenges. This one required working around Kinky Boots' Broadway show schedule, TV dates for Days of Our Lives filmed on the west coast, a play in North Carolina, recording dates in LA, 2 weddings, unpredictable rain, and the 5th grade!We've done a lot of filmmaking and had some great successes -- please help us get Killian and the Comeback Kids to the finish line. We need to raise $50,000 to stay on schedule, raising more would be great (needed for PR and other support) if we raise less we will continue on to keep our momentum - hoping for deep discounts and extended payment options.     Karmic Release Ltd. is an award winning multi-media production company specializing in independent films and Studio Features. Notable films/properties include Wallowitch & Ross: This Moment, (Oscar Short List 1999) Baghdad ER (4 Emmys. DuPont, Peabody Award) Tarnation (Cannes, Sundance) Walk Away Renee (Cannes Queer Palm Nominee) Our Heroes Ourselves. (Cine Golden Eagle) What Sex Am I? (HBO). A Father, A Son, Once Upon A Time in Hollywood (HBO). Down and Out in America (Academy Award 1987).

story:
---------------------------------------English-------------------------------------------

Haga clic aquí para el texto en español! (Texto en español abajo)

Klicken Sie hier für deutsch! (oder ganz nach unten scrollen)

 

My story

My name is Jhon Jimenez, and I am the director of this film project. I am a professional classical guitarist with vast experience in the field of photography and video production. In 2014, I co-founded the music web channel specialized in classical guitar, Guitar TV World, with my friend and colleague Luciano Marziali, an Italian guitarist and sound engineer. Together, we are leading Guitar TV World, working in close collaboration with professional journalists, translators and moderators to develop a high-quality audiovisual project, which will enable us to present our instrument to as many people as possible around the world.

 

Where can you see our work?

If you are interested in learning more about our previous productions, visit Guitar TV World at www.gtvw.net!

 

Thema

The documentary tells the story of the lives of Antonio Lauro and Alirio Díaz, of their collaboration and of their magnificent contribution to the repertoire of classical guitar music. It documents at the same time the vast richness and diversity of the Venezuelan culture. The film shows the interesting and inspiring biography of Alirio Diaz, a man born into a family of farmers and into poverty, who became one of the greatest legends and most influential figures in the history of classical guitar!

 

The impact of this project

History helps us understand social and cultural processes, makes us aware of where we come from and helps us define where we are going. It helps us understand the world in which we live. This documentary project is the first in a series dedicated to the preservation and dissemination of the memory of the classical guitar. That's why our project is fundamentally important!

Additionally, this project includes the production of music videos with exceptional artists who perform works by Antonio Lauro and arrangements by Alirio Díaz. Some of these works are hardly known and have never been professionally produced in a video. Here are a few examples:

- Marisela for Harph (A. Lauro)

- Suite venezolana for piano (A. Lauro)

- Variations on a Venezulean children's song (for guitar, A. Lauro)

- Mariquita for two guitars (A. Lauro)

- Canzoni napoletane  (Transcription Alirio Díaz)

 

Testimonials

Roberto Aussel, Guitarist

 

Senio Díaz, guitarists, son of Alirio Díaz

 

 
Miacaela Pittaluga, president of Michele Pittaluga International Guitar Competition

 

 
Alfonso Montes (Duo Montes Kircher), guitarist, composer

 

 

Irina Kircher (Duo Montes Kircher), guitarist

 
Clara Rodríguez, Pianist, Teacher at Royal College of Music, London UK

 

 

WHERE ARE THE FUNDS GOING?

30% - Traveling: This will cover the cost of traveling to places in which the remaining interviews will be conducted to finish filming the documentary: these are in Mexico, the UK, Spain, Greece, Germany and Austria. We will use low cost airlines and will also need funds to cover accommodation and meals.

25% Post production: Post-production is one of the most important (and longest!) phases of creating a film. It usually takes longer than the actual filming process because it includes editing, color correction, soundtrack recording, synchronization, color grading, voice over recording and more.

18%  Music videoclips productions: This project also includes the production of music videos with renowned artists! This percentage will cover the rental of professional filming equipment, professional audio recording and transportation costs for the artists with whom the musical productions will be made.

10% Translation and subtitling: We want our project to be accessible to an international audience: for this reason, we will make the documentary available in Spanish, English and German!

3% - Perks: This percentage will be destined to the production of rewards for this campaign

5% - Taxes: The Indiegogo funds are seen as a form of income. Subsequently, the government takes its cut.

5% - Indiegogo fee: Indiegogo charges a 5% for its services.

4% - Transactions: Unfortunately Indiegogo does not offer a PayPal or Debit Cards option. The credit card fee is 3% + 0.30 € per transaction + a one-time 25,- € transfer fee. Please contact me if you have any trouble with the payment process.

Planning

When will the movie be made? Production for Rastros Indelebles (Indelible Traces) began in October 2016. For the second phase of the film production, shootings of interviews with leading personalities in the realm of classical guitar are planned during the first quarter of 2018 in Europe. During the second quarter of 2018, post-production, translation and subtitling will be completed.

When will the movie be released? Although we do not have an exact date locked in yet, we plan to release the documentary film at the end of 2018.

 

Risks & challenges

We are so convinced of the importance of this project that we started it with our own funds, and have already invested a lot of time and energy on it. We also obtained the support of institutions in Venezuela and Germany, which allowed us to produce some of the music videos. However, a project of this magnitude requires a greater investment to be able to finish it in the planned time. Our goal is to raise 20,000 Euros - it is a flexible goal which means every Euro counts to advance the project.

If we reach our campaign goal, we will be able to finish the shootings as planned. Otherwise, the production time will have to be significantly lengthened.

 

The Staff

JHON JIMENEZ: Producer, film director, project manager

 

ELADIO MUJICA: Adviser & project coordinator in Venezuela

 

JUAN MARCANO: Production assistant

 

LUCIANO MARZIALI: Sound engineer

 

ROCIO PRIEGO: Translator

 

GRETTA HINOJOSA: Project coordinator in Europe

 

JUANITO: Mascot and public relations director :)

 

More information about this film

For detailed information about this Documentary Film, please visit the website: www.rastros-indelebles.com

You can also follow us on Instagram and Facebook to stay informed about the development of this project:

Instagram: guitartvworld

Facebook: Guitar TV World

 

 

Other ways you can help

If you are also passionate about this project but currently can’t contribute, then help us make some noise and spread the word!  Use the Indiegogo social media share tools placed to the right of the "back it" button or just copy and paste the address of this browser to share it!

 

--------------------------------------------- Español -----------------------------------------------

English

Deutsch

 

Mi historia

Mi nombre es Jhon Jimenez y estoy a cargo de este proyecto. Soy guitarrista clásico profesional y con una vasta experiencia en el campo de la fotografía y la producción audiovisual. En 2014, junto con mi amigo y colega, el guitarrista italiano y técnico de sonido  Luciano Marziali, creamos Guitar TV World, un canal de música web especializado en guitarra clásica. Trabajamos en estrecha colaboración con profesionales de otras áreas, como periodismo, traducción y moderación, y decidimos unir nuestras habilidades con el objetivo de desarrollar un proyecto audiovisual que nos permitiera presentar la guitarra clásica a la mayor cantidad de gente posible a nivel internacional y con altos estándares de calidad!

 

Nuestro trabajo

Si está interesado en conocer nuestras producciones, lo invito a visitar la página web de Guitar TV World y a disfrutar de nuestro trabajo!  www.gtvw.net 

 

Tema


El documental "Rastros Indelebles" se enfoca en el inmenso legado que los Maestros Antonio Lauro y Alirio Díaz hicieron al repertorio de la guitarra clásica mediante la difusión de la música folklórica y tradicional venezolana, documenta además el impacto de estos dos artistas en la escena guitarrística internacional actual, se abordan las biografías de los personajes, mostrando su lado humano al mismo tiempo que se describirá la bella e inspiradora historia de cómo Alirio Díaz, de origen campesino, humilde y de muy escasos recursos logra consolidarse como una figura legendaria y de gran influencia en la historia de la guitarra clásica!

 

Importancia de este proyecto documental

La historia nos ayuda a entender  procesos socioculturales, nos hace tomar conciencia de nuestra procedencia y nos ayuda a definir hacia dónde vamos y de la misma manera nos ayuda a entender el mundo en el que vivimos. Este proyecto documental es el primero de una serie dedicada a preservar y difundir la memoria histórica de la guitarra clásica. ¡En este aspecto radica fundamentalmente la vital importancia de nuestro proyecto! Por otro lado, éste incluye además la producción profesional de videos musicales con artistas excepcionales de renombre mundial, quienes interpretan obras de Antonio Lauro y arreglos de Alirio Díaz. Algunas de estas obras son poco conocidas y nunca se han producido profesionalmente en video. A continuación  algunas de estas piezas musicales:

- Marisela para Harpa (A. Lauro)

- Suite venezolana para piano (A. Lauro)

- Variaciones sobre una canción infantil (para guitarra, A. Lauro)

- Mariquita (Merengue para dos guitarras, A. Lauro)

- Canciones populares napolitanas (selección / Transcripción: Alirio Díaz)

 

Testimonios

Roberto Aussel, Guitarrista

 
 
Senio Díaz, guitarrista, hijo de Alirio Díaz

 

 
Miacaela Pittaluga, presidente del Concurso Internacional de Guitarra  Michele Pittaluga de Alessandria

 

 
Alfonso Montes (Duo Montes Kircher), guitarrist, compositor

 

 

Irina Kircher (Duo Montes Kircher), guitarrista

 
 
Clara Rodríguez, Pianist, docente  en el  Royal College of Music, Londres

 

 

Cómo serán utilizados los fondos?

 

30% viajes: este porcentaje nos permitirá cubrir los costos de los viajes viaje para completar las entrevistas restantes y de esta manera finalizar la fase de filmación del documental. Planeamos realizar entrevistas en México, Reino Unido, España, Grecia, Alemania y Austria. Debido a que estamos ubicados en Alemania, podemos utilizar aerolíneas de bajo costo, pero por supuesto necesitamos cubrir además los costos referentes a alojamiento y alimentación.

25% post producción: La postproducción es una de las fases más importantes en la creación audiovisual. Por lo general, lleva más tiempo que la fase de filmación y puede tardar varios meses en completarse, ya que incluye la edición completa, la grabación de los soud tracks, la sincronización, la graduación de colores, la grabación del narrador, etc.

18% videoclips musicales: Este porcentaje cubrirá el alquiler de equipos de filmación, grabación profesional de audio y los costos de transporte de los artistas con los que se realizarán las producciones musicales para este proyecto.

10% Traducción y subtitulación: Nuestra meta es que nuestro proyecto sea accesible para una gran audiencia internacional, por esta razón, queremos que el documental esté disponible en español, inglés y alemán.

3% Perks: Este porcentaje estará destinado a la producción de recompensas paqra esta campaña

5% Impuestos: Los fondos recaudados a través de esta campaña contarán legalmente como ingresos, los cuales están sujetos a impuestos.

5% Tarifa de Indiegogo: Indiegogo es una gran plataforma, pero por supuesto cuesta dinero el hacer uso sus servicios. 

4% Transacciones:  Dado que  Lamentablemente, Indiegogo no ofrece una opción de pago mediante PayPal o tarjeta de débito, las donaciones deberán realizarse mediante tarjetas de crédito. El 4% de los fondos recaudados se destinará al pago de las transacciones mediante tarjetas de crédito y las transferencias  La tarifa por el uso de tarjeta de crédito es del 3% + 0,30 € por transacción + 25, - € por concepto de transferencia.

 

Planificación

¿Cuándo se hará el documental? La producción de Rastros Indelebles comenzó en Octubre de 2016. Para la segunda fase de producción, se planean futuros rodajes en Europa durante el primer trimestre de 2018, donde se realizarán entrevistas a personalidades destacadas en el ámbito de la guitarra clásica. Durante el segundo trimestre de 2018, se completará la postproducción, la traducción y el subtitulado.

¿Cuándo será la premier del documental? Aunque aún no tenemos una fecha exacta definida, planeamos el lanzamiento del documental a finales de 2018. Les informaremos en cuanto sea definida la fecha exacta del release.


Riesgos y desafíos

Estamos tan convencidos de la importancia de este proyecto que lo comenzamos con nuestros propios fondos, invirtiendo en él además de nuestro dinero, nuestro tiempo y energía. También hemos obtenido el apoyo de instituciones en Venezuela y Alemania, esto nos permitió producir algunos de los videos musicales planeados. Sin embargo, un proyecto de esta magnitud requiere una mayor inversión para poder ser llevado a buen término en el tiempo planificado. Nuestro objetivo es recaudar 20,000 Euros en esta campaña, es un objetivo flexible, ya que sus contribuciones nos ayudarán a avanzar en este proyecto, ¡eso significa que cada Euro cuenta! Si alcanzamos nuestro objetivo en esta campaña de crowdfunding, podríamos terminar los trabajos de filmación y post producción tal como se planeó, de lo contrario, tendremos que alargar significativamente el tiempo de producción.

 

 

El Equipo

 

JHON JIMENEZ: Productor, director del documental, director del proyecto

 

ELADIO MUJICA: Asesor y coordinador del proyecto en Venezuela

 

JUAN MARCANO: Asistente de producción

 

LUCIANO MARZIALI: Técnico de audio

ROCIO PRIEGO: Traductora

GRETTA HINOJOSA: Coordinadora del proyecto en Europa

JUANITO: Mascota y encargado de relaciones públicas :)

 

Más información sobre este proyecto 

Para obtener información detallada sobre este proyecto documental, lo invitamos a visitar el sitio web: www.rastros-indelebles.com También puede seguirnos en Instagram y Facebook 

Instagram: guitartvworld

Facebook: Guitar TV World

 

Otras formas de colaborar

Si no puede contribuir con una donación ¡lo entendemos! pero aún puede ayudarnos difundiendo y compartiendo esta página con sus familiares, amigos y contactos! Utilice las herramientas para compartir en redes sociales de Indiegogo ubicadas a la derecha del botón "Back it" o simplemente copie y pegue en su mail o redes sociales la dirección de esta página. ¡Le estaremos enormemente agradecidos!

 

--------------------------------------------- Deutsch -----------------------------------------------

English

Español

 

Meine Geschichte

Mein Name ist Jhon Jimenez und ich leite dieses Projekt. Ich bin professioneller klassischer Gitarrist, zugleich ausgerüstet mit umfassender Erfahrung im Bereich Fotografie und audiovisueller Produktion. Gemeinsam mit meinem Freund und Kollegen, dem italienischen Gitarristen und Tontechniker Luciano Marziali, habe ich 2014 Guitar TV World gegründet, ein auf klassische Gitarre spezialisierter Internet-Musiksender. Wir arbeiten eng mit Fachleuten aus verschiedenen Disziplinen zusammen (Journalismus, Übersetzung und Moderation). Wir haben uns für Zusammenarbeit ins Leben gerufen, um dem internationalen Publikum eine neuartige, qualitativ hochwertige, audiovisuelle Erfahrung rund um die klassische Gitarre anzubieten, und um gleichzeitig die Gitarre international möglichst vielen Menschen mit höchstem Qualitätsstandard zu präsentieren.

 

Unsere Arbeit

Wenn Sie sich für unsere Arbeit interessieren, lade ich Sie ein, die Website von Guitar TV World zu besuchen und unsere Produktionen zu genießen! www.gtvw.net

 

Thema

Der Dokumentarfilm “Rastros indelebles” erzählt die Lebensgeschichte Von Antonio Lauro und Alirio Díaz, über deren Zusammenarbeit und ihren enormer Beitrag zum klassischen Gitarrenrepertoire. Er dokumentiert zugleich den enormen Reichtum und die Vielfalt der venezolanischen Kultur. Der Film zeigt die interessante und inspirierende Biographie von Alirio Díaz und wie ein Mensch, der aus einer Bauernfamilie und aus ärmlichsten Verhältnissen stammt, zu einer legendären und einflussreichen Figur in der Geschichte der Klassischen Gitarre geworden ist.

 

Warum ist dieses Dokumentarfilmprojekt wichtig? 

Die Geschichte hilft uns, sozio-kulturelle Prozesse zu verstehen. Sie macht uns über unsere eigene Herkunft bewusst und hilft uns zu definieren, wohin wir gehen, und auf dieselbe Weise hilft sie uns, die Welt, in der wir leben, zu verstehen. Dieses Dokumentarfilm-Projekt ist das erste einer Reihe, die sich der Bewahrung und Verbreitung des historischen Gedächtnisses der klassischen Gitarre widmet. In diesem Aspekt liegt die grundlegende Bedeutung unseres Projekts! Auf der anderen Seite beinhaltet dieses Projekt auch professionelle Produktion von Musikvideos mit außergewöhnlichen international renommierten Künstlern, welche die Werke von Antonio Lauro und Arrangements von Alirio Díaz aufnehmen werden. Einige dieser Werke sind wenig bekannt und wurden nie professionell im Videoformat produziert. Hier sind einige dieser musikalischen Werke:

- Marisela für Harfe (A. Lauro)

- Venezolanische Suite für Klavier (A. Lauro)

- Variationen über ein venezolanisches Kinderlied (für Gitarre, A. Lauro)

- Mariquita (Merengue für zwei Gitarren, A. Lauro)

- Canzoni napoletane (Auswahl / Transkription: Alirio Díaz)

 

Testimonials

Roberto Aussel, Gitarrist

 

 

Senio Díaz, Gitarrist, Alirio Díaz Son

 

 
Miacaela Pittaluga, Direktorin von Michele Pittaluga International Guitar Competition

 

 
Alfonso Montes (Duo Montes Kircher), Gitarrist, Komponist

 

 

Irina Kircher (Duo Montes Kircher), Gitarrist

 
 
Clara Rodríguez, Professorin an der Royal College of Music, London, UK

 

 

Wie werden die Mittel verwendet?

 

30% Reisekosten: Dieser Prozentsatz ermöglicht es uns, die Reisekosten zu decken, um die restlichen Interviews zu beenden und damit die Drehphase der Dokumentarfilm abzuschließen. Wir planen Interviews in Mexiko, Großbritannien, Spanien, Griechenland, Deutschland und Österreich. Da wir in Deutschland unsere Sitz haben, können wir Billigfluggesellschaften nutzen, aber natürlich müssen die Kosten für Unterkunft und Verpflegung gedeckt werden.

25% Postproduktion: Die Postproduktion ist eine der wichtigsten Phasen des audiovisuellen Schaffens. Im Allgemeinen dauert es mehr Zeit als die Drehphase und kann mehrere Monate in Anspruch nehmen, da es das Editing, die Aufnahme der Soundtracks, die Synchronisation, die Farbkorrektur, die Aufnahme des Erzählers (voice over) usw. beinhaltet.

18% Musikvideoclips: Dieser Prozentsatz hilft uns die Kosten für den Verleih von Filmausrüstung, die professioneller Audioaufnahme und die Transportkosten der Künstler, mit denen die Musikproduktionen für dieses Projekt durchgeführt werden zu decken.

10% Übersetzung und Untertitelung: Unser Ziel ist es, unser Projekt einem großen internationalen Publikum zugänglich zu machen. Aus diesem Grund wollen wir, dass der Dokumentarfilm in Spanisch, Englisch und Deutsch verfügbar ist.

3% Perks: Dieser Prozentsatz ist für die Produktion von Prämien für diese Kampagne bestimmt.

5% Steuern: Die Mittel, die durch diese Kampagne gesammelt werden, zählen gesetzlich als Einkommen, welches der Steuerpflicht unterliegt.

5% Indiegogo Gebühr: Indiegogo ist eine großartige Plattform der Verbreitung, aber natürlich kostet es Geld, ihre Dienste zu nutzen.

4% Kreditkartengebühren und Überweisung: Da Indiegogo leider keine Zahlungsmöglichkeit per PayPal oder Debitkarte anbietet, müssen Spenden per Kreditkarte geleistet werden. 4% der eingenommenen Mittel brauchen wir für die Bezahlung von Transaktionen über Kreditkarten und Überweisung (3% + 0,30 € pro Transaktion + 25, - € Überweisung).


 

 

Planung

Wann wird der Dokumentarfilm gemacht? Die Produktion von "Rastros Indelebles" (unauslöschliche Spuren) begann im Oktober 2016. Für die zweite Produktionsphase sind in Europa im ersten Quartal 2018 weitere Shootings geplant, bei denen Interviews mit herausragenden Persönlichkeiten im Bereich der klassischen Gitarre durchgeführt werden. Im zweiten Quartal 2018 sollen Postproduktion, Übersetzung und Untertitelung abgeschlossen sein.

Wann wird die Premiere des Dokumentarfilms sein? Obwohl wir noch kein genaues Datum haben, planen wir die Veröffentlichung des Dokumentarfilms Ende 2018. Wir werden Sie informieren, sobald den Termin für die Premiere festgelegt wird.

 

 

Risiken und Herausforderungen

Wir sind von der Bedeutung dieses Projekts so überzeugt, dass wir es mit eigenen Mitteln gestartet haben. Wir haben nicht nur eigenes Geld sondern auch, unserere Zeit und Energie in dieses Projekt investiert. Glücklicherweise haben wir die Unterstützung von Institutionen in Venezuela und Deutschland bekommen (Hochschule für Musik und Tanz Köln, Rheinische Musikschule Köln, National Philharmonisches Orchestra Venezuelas, u.a.), so dass wir einige Musikvideos produzieren konnten, aber ein Projekt dieser Größenordnung braucht eine größere Investition. Unser Ziel ist es, 20.000 Euro in dieser Kampagne zu sammeln und Ihre Beiträge werden uns helfen, in diesem Projekt weiter voranzukommen, das bedeutet, dass jeder Euro zählt! Wenn wir unser Ziel in dieser Crowdfunding-Kampagne erreichen, könnten wir die Dreh- und Postproduktionsarbeiten wie geplant beenden, ansonsten müssen wir die Produktionszeit drastisch verlängern.

 

Das Team

JHON JIMENEZ: Produzent, Dokumentarfilmdirektor, Projektleiter

 

ELADIO MUJICA: Berater und Projektkoordinator in Venezuela

 

JUAN MARCANO: Produktionsassistent

 

LUCIANO MARZIALI: Tontechniker

ROCIO PRIEGO: Übersetzerin

GRETTA HINOJOSA: Projektkoordinatorin in Europa

JUANITO: Maskottchen und Öffentlichkeitsarbeit Manager :)

 

Weitere Informationen zu diesem Projekt

Um detaillierte Informationen zu diesem Dokumentarfilm-Projekt zu erhalten, laden wir Sie herzlich ein, die Website des Films zu besuchen: www.rastros-indelebles.com Sie können uns auch auf Instagram und Facebook folgen!

Instagram: guitartvworld

Facebook: Guitar TV World

 

Möchten Sie uns auf andere Weise helfen?

Sie können unseres Projekt auch unterstützen, indem Sie diese Seite mit Ihrer Familie, Freunden und Kontakte teilen! Verwenden Sie die Indiegogo Tools, die sich rechts neben der Schaltfläche "Back it!" befinden um die Information auf sozialen Netzwerke zu teilen. Sie können auch die Adresse dieser Seite kopieren und in Ihre E-mail einfügen oder in Ihre soziale Netzwerke posten. Wir wären Ihnen sehr dankbar!

 

Zum Anfang

My story
My name is Jhon Jimenez, and I am the director of this film project. I am a professional classical guitarist with vast experience in the field of photography and video production. In 2014, I co-founded the music web channel specialized in classical guitar, Guitar TV World, with my friend and colleague Luciano Marziali, an Italian guitarist and sound engineer. Together, we are leading Guitar TV World, working in close collaboration with professional journalists, translators and moderators to develop a high-quality audiovisual project, which will enable us to present our instrument to as many people as possible around the world.

If you are interested in learning more about our previous productions, visit Guitar TV World at www.gtvw.net!
 
Thema
The documentary tells the story of the lives of Antonio Lauro and Alirio Díaz, of their collaboration and of their magnificent contribution to the repertoire of classical guitar music. It documents at the same time the vast richness and diversity of the Venezuelan culture. The film shows the interesting and inspiring biography of Alirio Diaz, a man born into a family of farmers and into poverty, who became one of the greatest legends and most influential figures in the history of classical guitar!
 
The impact of this project
History helps us understand social and cultural processes, makes us aware of where we come from and helps us define where we are going. It helps us understand the world in which we live. This documentary project is the first in a series dedicated to the preservation and dissemination of the memory of the classical guitar. That's why our project is fundamentally important!
Additionally, this project includes the production of music videos with exceptional artists who perform works by Antonio Lauro and arrangements by Alirio Díaz. Some of these works are hardly known and have never been professionally produced in a video. Here are a few examples:
- Marisela for Harph (A. Lauro)
- Suite venezolana for piano (A. Lauro)
- Variations on a Venezulean children's song (for guitar, A. Lauro)
- Mariquita for two guitars (A. Lauro)
- Canzoni napoletane  (Transcription Alirio Díaz)

 
Testimonials
Roberto Aussel, Guitarist

 
Senio Díaz, guitarists, son of Alirio Díaz




 

 

Miacaela Pittaluga, president of Michele Pittaluga International Guitar Competition



 

 
Alfonso Montes (Duo Montes Kircher), guitarist, composer



 

 
Irina Kircher (Duo Montes Kircher), guitarist

 
Clara Rodríguez, Pianist, Teacher at Royal College of Music, London UK

 



 

WHERE ARE THE FUNDS GOING?

30% - Traveling: This will cover the cost of traveling to places in which the remaining interviews will be conducted to finish filming the documentary: these are in Mexico, the UK, Spain, Greece, Germany and Austria. We will use low cost airlines and will also need funds to cover accommodation and meals.
25% Post production: Post-production is one of the most important (and longest!) phases of creating a film. It usually takes longer than the actual filming process because it includes editing, color correction, soundtrack recording, synchronization, color grading, voice over recording and more.
18%  Music videoclips productions: This project also includes the production of music videos with renowned artists! This percentage will cover the rental of professional filming equipment, professional audio recording and transportation costs for the artists with whom the musical productions will be made.
10% Translation and subtitling: We want our project to be accessible to an international audience: for this reason, we will make the documentary available in Spanish, English and German!
3% - Perks: This percentage will be destined to the production of rewards for this campaign
5% - Taxes: The Indiegogo funds are seen as a form of income. Subsequently, the government takes its cut.
5% - Indiegogo fee: Indiegogo charges a 5% for its services.
4% - Transactions: Unfortunately Indiegogo does not offer a PayPal or Debit Cards option. The credit card fee is 3% + 0.30 € per transaction + a one-time 25,- € transfer fee. Please contact me if you have any trouble with the payment process.
Planning
When will the movie be made? Production for Rastros Indelebles (Indelible Traces) began in October 2016. For the second phase of the film production, shootings of interviews with leading personalities in the realm of classical guitar are planned during the first quarter of 2018 in Europe. During the second quarter of 2018, post-production, translation and subtitling will be completed.
When will the movie be released? Although we do not have an exact date locked in yet, we plan to release the documentary film at the end of 2018.

 
Risks & challenges
We are so convinced of the importance of this project that we started it with our own funds, and have already invested a lot of time and energy on it. We also obtained the support of institutions in Venezuela and Germany, which allowed us to produce some of the music videos. However, a project of this magnitude requires a greater investment to be able to finish it in the planned time. Our goal is to raise 20,000 Euros - it is a flexible goal which means every Euro counts to advance the project.
If we reach our campaign goal, we will be able to finish the shootings as planned. Otherwise, the production time will have to be significantly lengthened.

Mi historia
Mi nombre es Jhon Jimenez y estoy a cargo de este proyecto. Soy guitarrista clásico profesional y con una vasta experiencia en el campo de la fotografía y la producción audiovisual. En 2014, junto con mi amigo y colega, el guitarrista italiano y técnico de sonido  Luciano Marziali, creamos Guitar TV World, un canal de música web especializado en guitarra clásica. Trabajamos en estrecha colaboración con profesionales de otras áreas, como periodismo, traducción y moderación, y decidimos unir nuestras habilidades con el objetivo de desarrollar un proyecto audiovisual que nos permitiera presentar la guitarra clásica a la mayor cantidad de gente posible a nivel internacional y con altos estándares de calidad!
 
Nuestro trabajo
Si está interesado en conocer nuestras producciones, lo invito a visitar la página web de Guitar TV World y a disfrutar de nuestro trabajo!  www.gtvw.net 
 
Tema
El documental "Rastros Indelebles" se enfoca en el inmenso legado que los Maestros Antonio Lauro y Alirio Díaz hicieron al repertorio de la guitarra clásica mediante la difusión de la música folklórica y tradicional venezolana, documenta además el impacto de estos dos artistas en la escena guitarrística internacional actual, se abordan las biografías de los personajes, mostrando su lado humano al mismo tiempo que se describirá la bella e inspiradora historia de cómo Alirio Díaz, de origen campesino, humilde y de muy escasos recursos logra consolidarse como una figura legendaria y de gran influencia en la historia de la guitarra clásica!
 
Importancia de este proyecto documental
La historia nos ayuda a entender  procesos socioculturales, nos hace tomar conciencia de nuestra procedencia y nos ayuda a definir hacia dónde vamos y de la misma manera nos ayuda a entender el mundo en el que vivimos. Este proyecto documental es el primero de una serie dedicada a preservar y difundir la memoria histórica de la guitarra clásica. ¡En este aspecto radica fundamentalmente la vital importancia de nuestro proyecto! Por otro lado, éste incluye además la producción profesional de videos musicales con artistas excepcionales de renombre mundial, quienes interpretan obras de Antonio Lauro y arreglos de Alirio Díaz. Algunas de estas obras son poco conocidas y nunca se han producido profesionalmente en video. A continuación  algunas de estas piezas musicales:
- Marisela para Harpa (A. Lauro)
- Suite venezolana para piano (A. Lauro)
- Variaciones sobre una canción infantil (para guitarra, A. Lauro)
- Mariquita (Merengue para dos guitarras, A. Lauro)
- Canciones populares napolitanas (selección / Transcripción: Alirio Díaz)
 
Testimonios

Roberto Aussel, Guitarrista


 
 
Senio Díaz, guitarrista, hijo de Alirio Díaz



 

 
Miacaela Pittaluga, presidente del Concurso Internacional de Guitarra  Michele Pittaluga de Alessandria



 

 
Alfonso Montes (Duo Montes Kircher), guitarrist, compositor



 

 
Irina Kircher (Duo Montes Kircher), guitarrista

 
 
Clara Rodríguez, Pianist, docente  en el  Royal College of Music, Londres

 



 
Cómo serán utilizados los fondos?

 
30% viajes: este porcentaje nos permitirá cubrir los costos de los viajes viaje para completar las entrevistas restantes y de esta manera finalizar la fase de filmación del documental. Planeamos realizar entrevistas en México, Reino Unido, España, Grecia, Alemania y Austria. Debido a que estamos ubicados en Alemania, podemos utilizar aerolíneas de bajo costo, pero por supuesto necesitamos cubrir además los costos referentes a alojamiento y alimentación.
25% post producción: La postproducción es una de las fases más importantes en la creación audiovisual. Por lo general, lleva más tiempo que la fase de filmación y puede tardar varios meses en completarse, ya que incluye la edición completa, la grabación de los soud tracks, la sincronización, la graduación de colores, la grabación del narrador, etc.
18% videoclips musicales: Este porcentaje cubrirá el alquiler de equipos de filmación, grabación profesional de audio y los costos de transporte de los artistas con los que se realizarán las producciones musicales para este proyecto.
10% Traducción y subtitulación: Nuestra meta es que nuestro proyecto sea accesible para una gran audiencia internacional, por esta razón, queremos que el documental esté disponible en español, inglés y alemán.
3% Perks: Este porcentaje estará destinado a la producción de recompensas paqra esta campaña
5% Impuestos: Los fondos recaudados a través de esta campaña contarán legalmente como ingresos, los cuales están sujetos a impuestos.
5% Tarifa de Indiegogo: Indiegogo es una gran plataforma, pero por supuesto cuesta dinero el hacer uso sus servicios. 
4% Transacciones:  Dado que  Lamentablemente, Indiegogo no ofrece una opción de pago mediante PayPal o tarjeta de débito, las donaciones deberán realizarse mediante tarjetas de crédito. El 4% de los fondos recaudados se destinará al pago de las transacciones mediante tarjetas de crédito y las transferencias  La tarifa por el uso de tarjeta de crédito es del 3% + 0,30 € por transacción + 25, - € por concepto de transferencia.
 
Planificación
¿Cuándo se hará el documental? La producción de Rastros Indelebles comenzó en Octubre de 2016. Para la segunda fase de producción, se planean futuros rodajes en Europa durante el primer trimestre de 2018, donde se realizarán entrevistas a personalidades destacadas en el ámbito de la guitarra clásica. Durante el segundo trimestre de 2018, se completará la postproducción, la traducción y el subtitulado.
¿Cuándo será la premier del documental? Aunque aún no tenemos una fecha exacta definida, planeamos el lanzamiento del documental a finales de 2018. Les informaremos en cuanto sea definida la fecha exacta del release.

Riesgos y desafíos
Estamos tan convencidos de la importancia de este proyecto que lo comenzamos con nuestros propios fondos, invirtiendo en él además de nuestro dinero, nuestro tiempo y energía. También hemos obtenido el apoyo de instituciones en Venezuela y Alemania, esto nos permitió producir algunos de los videos musicales planeados. Sin embargo, un proyecto de esta magnitud requiere una mayor inversión para poder ser llevado a buen término en el tiempo planificado. Nuestro objetivo es recaudar 20,000 Euros en esta campaña, es un objetivo flexible, ya que sus contribuciones nos ayudarán a avanzar en este proyecto, ¡eso significa que cada Euro cuenta! Si alcanzamos nuestro objetivo en esta campaña de crowdfunding, podríamos terminar los trabajos de filmación y post producción tal como se planeó, de lo contrario, tendremos que alargar significativamente el tiempo de producción.
 
 
El Equipo

ELADIO MUJICA: Asesor y coordinador del proyecto en Venezuela
