Meine Geschichte
Mein Name ist Jhon Jimenez und ich leite dieses Projekt. Ich bin professioneller klassischer Gitarrist, zugleich ausgerüstet mit umfassender Erfahrung im Bereich Fotografie und audiovisueller Produktion. Gemeinsam mit meinem Freund und Kollegen, dem italienischen Gitarristen und Tontechniker Luciano Marziali, habe ich 2014 Guitar TV World gegründet, ein auf klassische Gitarre spezialisierter Internet-Musiksender. Wir arbeiten eng mit Fachleuten aus verschiedenen Disziplinen zusammen (Journalismus, Übersetzung und Moderation). Wir haben uns für Zusammenarbeit ins Leben gerufen, um dem internationalen Publikum eine neuartige, qualitativ hochwertige, audiovisuelle Erfahrung rund um die klassische Gitarre anzubieten, und um gleichzeitig die Gitarre international möglichst vielen Menschen mit höchstem Qualitätsstandard zu präsentieren.
 
Unsere Arbeit
Wenn Sie sich für unsere Arbeit interessieren, lade ich Sie ein, die Website von Guitar TV World zu besuchen und unsere Produktionen zu genießen! www.gtvw.net
 
Thema
Der Dokumentarfilm “Rastros indelebles” erzählt die Lebensgeschichte Von Antonio Lauro und Alirio Díaz, über deren Zusammenarbeit und ihren enormer Beitrag zum klassischen Gitarrenrepertoire. Er dokumentiert zugleich den enormen Reichtum und die Vielfalt der venezolanischen Kultur. Der Film zeigt die interessante und inspirierende Biographie von Alirio Díaz und wie ein Mensch, der aus einer Bauernfamilie und aus ärmlichsten Verhältnissen stammt, zu einer legendären und einflussreichen Figur in der Geschichte der Klassischen Gitarre geworden ist.
 
Warum ist dieses Dokumentarfilmprojekt wichtig? 
Die Geschichte hilft uns, sozio-kulturelle Prozesse zu verstehen. Sie macht uns über unsere eigene Herkunft bewusst und hilft uns zu definieren, wohin wir gehen, und auf dieselbe Weise hilft sie uns, die Welt, in der wir leben, zu verstehen. Dieses Dokumentarfilm-Projekt ist das erste einer Reihe, die sich der Bewahrung und Verbreitung des historischen Gedächtnisses der klassischen Gitarre widmet. In diesem Aspekt liegt die grundlegende Bedeutung unseres Projekts! Auf der anderen Seite beinhaltet dieses Projekt auch professionelle Produktion von Musikvideos mit außergewöhnlichen international renommierten Künstlern, welche die Werke von Antonio Lauro und Arrangements von Alirio Díaz aufnehmen werden. Einige dieser Werke sind wenig bekannt und wurden nie professionell im Videoformat produziert. Hier sind einige dieser musikalischen Werke:
- Marisela für Harfe (A. Lauro)
- Venezolanische Suite für Klavier (A. Lauro)
- Variationen über ein venezolanisches Kinderlied (für Gitarre, A. Lauro)
- Mariquita (Merengue für zwei Gitarren, A. Lauro)
- Canzoni napoletane (Auswahl / Transkription: Alirio Díaz)
 
Testimonials
Roberto Aussel, Gitarrist

 
 
Senio Díaz, Gitarrist, Alirio Díaz Son



 

 
Miacaela Pittaluga, Direktorin von Michele Pittaluga International Guitar Competition



 

 
Alfonso Montes (Duo Montes Kircher), Gitarrist, Komponist



 

 
Irina Kircher (Duo Montes Kircher), Gitarrist

 
 
Clara Rodríguez, Professorin an der Royal College of Music, London, UK

 



 
Wie werden die Mittel verwendet?

 
30% Reisekosten: Dieser Prozentsatz ermöglicht es uns, die Reisekosten zu decken, um die restlichen Interviews zu beenden und damit die Drehphase der Dokumentarfilm abzuschließen. Wir planen Interviews in Mexiko, Großbritannien, Spanien, Griechenland, Deutschland und Österreich. Da wir in Deutschland unsere Sitz haben, können wir Billigfluggesellschaften nutzen, aber natürlich müssen die Kosten für Unterkunft und Verpflegung gedeckt werden.
25% Postproduktion: Die Postproduktion ist eine der wichtigsten Phasen des audiovisuellen Schaffens. Im Allgemeinen dauert es mehr Zeit als die Drehphase und kann mehrere Monate in Anspruch nehmen, da es das Editing, die Aufnahme der Soundtracks, die Synchronisation, die Farbkorrektur, die Aufnahme des Erzählers (voice over) usw. beinhaltet.
18% Musikvideoclips: Dieser Prozentsatz hilft uns die Kosten für den Verleih von Filmausrüstung, die professioneller Audioaufnahme und die Transportkosten der Künstler, mit denen die Musikproduktionen für dieses Projekt durchgeführt werden zu decken.
10% Übersetzung und Untertitelung: Unser Ziel ist es, unser Projekt einem großen internationalen Publikum zugänglich zu machen. Aus diesem Grund wollen wir, dass der Dokumentarfilm in Spanisch, Englisch und Deutsch verfügbar ist.
3% Perks: Dieser Prozentsatz ist für die Produktion von Prämien für diese Kampagne bestimmt.
5% Steuern: Die Mittel, die durch diese Kampagne gesammelt werden, zählen gesetzlich als Einkommen, welches der Steuerpflicht unterliegt.
5% Indiegogo Gebühr: Indiegogo ist eine großartige Plattform der Verbreitung, aber natürlich kostet es Geld, ihre Dienste zu nutzen.
4% Kreditkartengebühren und Überweisung: Da Indiegogo leider keine Zahlungsmöglichkeit per PayPal oder Debitkarte anbietet, müssen Spenden per Kreditkarte geleistet werden. 4% der eingenommenen Mittel brauchen wir für die Bezahlung von Transaktionen über Kreditkarten und Überweisung (3% + 0,30 € pro Transaktion + 25, - € Überweisung).
 
 
Planung
Wann wird der Dokumentarfilm gemacht? Die Produktion von "Rastros Indelebles" (unauslöschliche Spuren) begann im Oktober 2016. Für die zweite Produktionsphase sind in Europa im ersten Quartal 2018 weitere Shootings geplant, bei denen Interviews mit herausragenden Persönlichkeiten im Bereich der klassischen Gitarre durchgeführt werden. Im zweiten Quartal 2018 sollen Postproduktion, Übersetzung und Untertitelung abgeschlossen sein.
Wann wird die Premiere des Dokumentarfilms sein? Obwohl wir noch kein genaues Datum haben, planen wir die Veröffentlichung des Dokumentarfilms Ende 2018. Wir werden Sie informieren, sobald den Termin für die Premiere festgelegt wird.
 
 
Risiken und Herausforderungen
Wir sind von der Bedeutung dieses Projekts so überzeugt, dass wir es mit eigenen Mitteln gestartet haben. Wir haben nicht nur eigenes Geld sondern auch, unserere Zeit und Energie in dieses Projekt investiert. Glücklicherweise haben wir die Unterstützung von Institutionen in Venezuela und Deutschland bekommen (Hochschule für Musik und Tanz Köln, Rheinische Musikschule Köln, National Philharmonisches Orchestra Venezuelas, u.a.), so dass wir einige Musikvideos produzieren konnten, aber ein Projekt dieser Größenordnung braucht eine größere Investition. Unser Ziel ist es, 20.000 Euro in dieser Kampagne zu sammeln und Ihre Beiträge werden uns helfen, in diesem Projekt weiter voranzukommen, das bedeutet, dass jeder Euro zählt! Wenn wir unser Ziel in dieser Crowdfunding-Kampagne erreichen, könnten wir die Dreh- und Postproduktionsarbeiten wie geplant beenden, ansonsten müssen wir die Produktionszeit drastisch verlängern.
 
Das Team

JHON JIMENEZ: Produzent, Dokumentarfilmdirektor, Projektleiter
 

ELADIO MUJICA: Berater und Projektkoordinator in Venezuela
 

JUAN MARCANO: Produktionsassistent
 

LUCIANO MARZIALI: Tontechniker

ROCIO PRIEGO: Übersetzerin

GRETTA HINOJOSA: Projektkoordinatorin in Europa

JUANITO: Maskottchen und Öffentlichkeitsarbeit Manager :)

story:
(ITA)

MoviEst Project

Fin da piccolo ho sempre avuto la passione per la fotografia, mi piaceva fermare in immagine i bellissimi luoghi che con la scuola s’aveva la fortuna di visitare. Col passare degli anni ho poi visto che le mie emozioni erano più a loro agio se espresse attraverso una telecamera. 

Ho iniziato circa 18 anni fa col filmare qualcosa con gli amici del paese. Ci si divertiva tantissimo e son nate così delle amicizie intime molto forti come quella con Alex Gabrici, mia insostituibile spalla.

Dopo anni di prove e di filmati (a detta degli amici) simpatici, è nato il nostro primo lungometraggio nel 2004 “Last lie”, un film poliziesco nei più classici canoni Hollywoodiani.

Abbiamo poi avuto la fortuna di conoscere Francesco Baita durante una produzione documentaristica. Da qui l’idea di un film intitolato “Striaments” (sortilegi) dove il tema principale erano le leggende Friulane intrise di Streghe, figure mistichee tradizioni.

Forte è stato, dopo questa esperienza, il desiderio di legare le nostre sceneggiature e produzioni appunto alle tradizioni e leggende friulane recitate anche nella nostra lingua madre.

L’attuale associazione è nata quando al gruppo si sono uniti Christopher Bertolutti, Daniele Pavinato ed Erica Grattoni, ognuno con le proprie competenze e professionalità. Lavoriamo a stretto contatto con varie Associazioni Storiche che credono fortemente nei nostri progetti. L’ultimo frutto di queste collaborazioni è stato il film “Un Frêt Invièr” “A Cold Winter” del 2015, ambientato in epoca medievale a cui è preceduta un’accurata ricerca storica sulle usanze, fatti, costumi e location.

MoviEst Project nasce dalla voglia di studiare, comprendere, creare, sperimentare e divertirsi, trasponendo il tutto in progetti filmici, senza tralasciare un aspetto per noi molto importante: la divulgazione e la riscoperta delle nostre antiche tradizioni, radici storiche e leggende popolari, fotografate nei luoghi più suggestivi del nord est Italia.

MoviEst Project nei compiti: 

Gianluca Fioritto - director

Alex Gabrici - outsider consultant

Christopher Bertolutti - photography director.

Daniele Pavinato - assistant director.

Erica Grattoni - script supervisor.

Francesco Baita - sound director.

 

Le Anime del Fiume

Il film sarà ambientato tra il 1468 e il 1518 in Veneto e Friuli, in un periodo storico particolarmente difficile tra incursioni dei Turchi e degli Ungari, rivolta dei contadini verso i nobili del 1511 e sempre nel 1511 l’epidemia di peste ed il terremoto che devasterà ampie zone del Friuli.  Tutti questi eventi saranno presenti nel film. 

Narra la storia di un uomo che nasce in un villaggio delle colline friulane. La sua vita semplice cambierà drasticamente causa un’epidemia di tifo. Unico sopravvissuto della sua famiglia, creduto morto e lasciato in una fossa comune, viene trovato da un gruppo di uomini e portato in salvo. 

Nel 1501 si trasferisce in un’abbazia veneta ove trascorrerà la sua vita tra lavoro e preghiera. Causa un evento particolare l’uomo deciderà di lasciare questo luogo e di intraprendere un cammino a ritroso, verso i suoi luoghi d’origine. Nel suo viaggio incontrerà dei personaggi anch’essi messi duramente alla prova dagli avvenimenti, emarginati e vittime delle superstizioni e una strega a cui è legato da un fatto avvenuto durante la sua nascita. 

È una storia sì di avvenimenti infelici, ma che vuole portare un messaggio di speranza. Quest’uomo, pur incontrando continuamente il male lungo il proprio cammino, fa sì che la fede gli permetta di superare gli ostacoli con estrema consapevolezza, abbandonando la rassegnazione della prima parte della sua vita. 

 

Budget Breakdown

 

(ENG)

MoviEst Project

Ever since I was a child, I’ve had interest in photography, I loved taking pictures of the beautiful places we used to visit on school trips. Years later I noticed that I was more comfortable with expressing my emotions through a camera.

Me and my friends started shooting the first movies 18 years ago. We used to have so much fun and that led to very strong and deep friendships, as the one with Alex Gabrici, my irreplaceable right-hand man.

Our first feature “Last lie” came in 2004, after years of experiments and fun films (that’s what friends were saying at the time). It was a crime novel abiding by Hollywood classics.

Then we met Francesco Baita, while we were working on a documentary. From that encounter was born “Striaments” (witchcrafts), the main theme of that being tales from Friuli filled with witches, mystic figures and traditions.

After this experience our desire of bonding our scripts and productions to our own traditions and regional tales, using our regional native language, became stronger.

The current association was born when Cristopher Bertolutti, Daniele Pavinato and Erica Grattoni joined us, bringing their expertise and skills. We work closely with many historical organizations that strongly believe in our projects. The last outcome of this collaboration was the movie “A Cold Winter” that came out in 2015. It was set in medieval age and it was the result of a thorough historical research on habits, facts, traditions and locations.

MoviEst Project was born out of the desire to study, understand, create, experiment and have fun, channeling all of those elements in movie projects, without omitting a component that is very important to us: rediscover and broadcast our ancient traditions, historical roots and popular tales portrayed in the most evocative places of Northeast Italy.

MoviEst Project team: 

Gianluca Fioritto - director

Alex Gabrici - outsider consultant

Christopher Bertolutti - photography director.

Daniele Pavinato - assistant director.

Erica Grattoni - script supervisor.

Francesco Baita - sound director.

 

The Souls of The River

The movie will be set between 1468 and 1516 in Veneto and in Friuli. This is an historical period particularly difficult, as it is characterized by the Turkish and Hungarian's incursions, the peasants' rebellion against nobleman in 1511 and by the plague epidemic and the earthquake which will devastate wide zones in Friuli in the same year. All these events will be present in the movie. 

It tells the story of a man who is born in a village in Friuli hills. His simple life will drastically change because of a typhus epidemic. Even if he is believed dead and is left in a mass grave, he will be the only survivor of his family, thanks to a group of man who find and rescue him. 

In 1501 he moves to an abbey in Veneto where he will spend his life between work and pray. Due to a particular event, the man will decide to leave this place and to undertake a journey backward to his places of origin. In his journey he will meet characters who were tested by the events, marginalized and victims of superstitions and of a witch who has a connection with the protagonist for something which happened during his birth. 

It's a story of unhappy events but it also wants to bring a message of hope. Even if this man continuously meets evil during his journey, his faith permits him to overcome obstacles with extreme consciousness, abandoning the resignation of the first part of his life.
story_txt:
(ITA)
MoviEst Project
Fin da piccolo ho sempre avuto la passione per la fotografia, mi piaceva fermare in immagine i bellissimi luoghi che con la scuola s’aveva la fortuna di visitare. Col passare degli anni ho poi visto che le mie emozioni erano più a loro agio se espresse attraverso una telecamera. 
Ho iniziato circa 18 anni fa col filmare qualcosa con gli amici del paese. Ci si divertiva tantissimo e son nate così delle amicizie intime molto forti come quella con Alex Gabrici, mia insostituibile spalla.
Dopo anni di prove e di filmati (a detta degli amici) simpatici, è nato il nostro primo lungometraggio nel 2004 “Last lie”, un film poliziesco nei più classici canoni Hollywoodiani.
Abbiamo poi avuto la fortuna di conoscere Francesco Baita durante una produzione documentaristica. Da qui l’idea di un film intitolato “Striaments” (sortilegi) dove il tema principale erano le leggende Friulane intrise di Streghe, figure mistichee tradizioni.
Forte è stato, dopo questa esperienza, il desiderio di legare le nostre sceneggiature e produzioni appunto alle tradizioni e leggende friulane recitate anche nella nostra lingua madre.
L’attuale associazione è nata quando al gruppo si sono uniti Christopher Bertolutti, Daniele Pavinato ed Erica Grattoni, ognuno con le proprie competenze e professionalità. Lavoriamo a stretto contatto con varie Associazioni Storiche che credono fortemente nei nostri progetti. L’ultimo frutto di queste collaborazioni è stato il film “Un Frêt Invièr” “A Cold Winter” del 2015, ambientato in epoca medievale a cui è preceduta un’accurata ricerca storica sulle usanze, fatti, costumi e location.
MoviEst Project nasce dalla voglia di studiare, comprendere, creare, sperimentare e divertirsi, trasponendo il tutto in progetti filmici, senza tralasciare un aspetto per noi molto importante: la divulgazione e la riscoperta delle nostre antiche tradizioni, radici storiche e leggende popolari, fotografate nei luoghi più suggestivi del nord est Italia.
MoviEst Project nei compiti: 
Gianluca Fioritto - director
Alex Gabrici - outsider consultant
Christopher Bertolutti - photography director.
Daniele Pavinato - assistant director.
Erica Grattoni - script supervisor.
Francesco Baita - sound director.
 
Le Anime del Fiume
Il film sarà ambientato tra il 1468 e il 1518 in Veneto e Friuli, in un periodo storico particolarmente difficile tra incursioni dei Turchi e degli Ungari, rivolta dei contadini verso i nobili del 1511 e sempre nel 1511 l’epidemia di peste ed il terremoto che devasterà ampie zone del Friuli.  Tutti questi eventi saranno presenti nel film. 
Narra la storia di un uomo che nasce in un villaggio delle colline friulane. La sua vita semplice cambierà drasticamente causa un’epidemia di tifo. Unico sopravvissuto della sua famiglia, creduto morto e lasciato in una fossa comune, viene trovato da un gruppo di uomini e portato in salvo. 
Nel 1501 si trasferisce in un’abbazia veneta ove trascorrerà la sua vita tra lavoro e preghiera. Causa un evento particolare l’uomo deciderà di lasciare questo luogo e di intraprendere un cammino a ritroso, verso i suoi luoghi d’origine. Nel suo viaggio incontrerà dei personaggi anch’essi messi duramente alla prova dagli avvenimenti, emarginati e vittime delle superstizioni e una strega a cui è legato da un fatto avvenuto durante la sua nascita. 


È una storia sì di avvenimenti infelici, ma che vuole portare un messaggio di speranza. Quest’uomo, pur incontrando continuamente il male lungo il proprio cammino, fa sì che la fede gli permetta di superare gli ostacoli con estrema consapevolezza, abbandonando la rassegnazione della prima parte della sua vita. 
 

Budget Breakdown

 
(ENG)
MoviEst Project
Ever since I was a child, I’ve had interest in photography, I loved taking pictures of the beautiful places we used to visit on school trips. Years later I noticed that I was more comfortable with expressing my emotions through a camera.
Me and my friends started shooting the first movies 18 years ago. We used to have so much fun and that led to very strong and deep friendships, as the one with Alex Gabrici, my irreplaceable right-hand man.
Our first feature “Last lie” came in 2004, after years of experiments and fun films (that’s what friends were saying at the time). It was a crime novel abiding by Hollywood classics.
Then we met Francesco Baita, while we were working on a documentary. From that encounter was born “Striaments” (witchcrafts), the main theme of that being tales from Friuli filled with witches, mystic figures and traditions.
After this experience our desire of bonding our scripts and productions to our own traditions and regional tales, using our regional native language, became stronger.
The current association was born when Cristopher Bertolutti, Daniele Pavinato and Erica Grattoni joined us, bringing their expertise and skills. We work closely with many historical organizations that strongly believe in our projects. The last outcome of this collaboration was the movie “A Cold Winter” that came out in 2015. It was set in medieval age and it was the result of a thorough historical research on habits, facts, traditions and locations.
MoviEst Project was born out of the desire to study, understand, create, experiment and have fun, channeling all of those elements in movie projects, without omitting a component that is very important to us: rediscover and broadcast our ancient traditions, historical roots and popular tales portrayed in the most evocative places of Northeast Italy.
MoviEst Project team: 
Gianluca Fioritto - director
Alex Gabrici - outsider consultant
Christopher Bertolutti - photography director.
Daniele Pavinato - assistant director.
Erica Grattoni - script supervisor.
Francesco Baita - sound director.

The movie will be set between 1468 and 1516 in Veneto and in Friuli. This is an historical period particularly difficult, as it is characterized by the Turkish and Hungarian's incursions, the peasants' rebellion against nobleman in 1511 and by the plague epidemic and the earthquake which will devastate wide zones in Friuli in the same year. All these events will be present in the movie.

In his journey he will meet characters who were tested by the events, marginalized and victims of superstitions and of a witch who has a connection with the protagonist for something which happened during his birth. 

It's a story of unhappy events but it also wants to bring a message of hope. Even if this man continuously meets evil during his journey, his faith permits him to overcome obstacles with extreme consciousness, abandoning the resignation of the first part of his life.

story:
From the director of BLINDED, Official Selection of the International Open Film Festival in New York, we bring you CHICKEN AND THE ED.

CHICKEN AND THE ED is a short musical about Ed, a lost musician who stumbles upon Kevin, an equally lost chicken with whom he finds and unlikely friendship. Through a specially curated soundtrack of popular songs, Ed is forced to choose between Kevin and his neglected 8-year-old son, Ben. Take part in our unique journey to discover what matters more, a stranded feathered companion or his loving human offspring. With this film you'll discover an odyssey of comedy, tragedy, and music in this heart-warming story set in the serene countryside of Dundee, Scotland.

We are a nest of digital film production students, studying at Ravensbourne University, making our graduation film! 

OUR LAST MUSICAL

Here's the musical we made last year. It was great fun, and we got some great feedback to make our next one bigger and better than before.
 

YOU'RE A CRACKER!

This self-funded production needs your support to turn this bold concept into a reality. CHICKEN AND THE ED will be produced with the professional guidance of top industry filmmakers, in an attempt to break the mould of the comedy-musical genre. Your contribution will allow us free reign to develop this narrative into something truly special. EVERY one of our generous patrons will be acknowledged in the film's end credits, among many other perks offered as part of this campaign.

WHO MAKES A MUSICAL ABOUT A CHICKEN?

Meet the eggtravigent team behind this film, all of whom are freelance filmmakers, tryna' make you laugh. 

DIREGGTOR  - Sam Ettleman 

Sam primarily directs narrative shorts, with experience in a range of genres. Over the past few years he has written and directed numerous films, music videos and corporate content (Deliveroo, L'Oreal, Barclays). Having also had a background in production, assistant direction and acting in major feature productions (Kingsman: The Golden Circle, On Chesil Beach), he understands the challenges and strives to give 110% to an entertaining picture for audiences to enjoy. Sam strives to make his mark in the film industry, apparently by hatching a love story about a man and a bird. He looks forward to seeing this story come to life as he watches from the wing.

PROGOOSER  - Lucy Miles

Lucy Miles is a freelance producer, working for brands such as Formula One, Playboy and ITV. Her newest project is a musical about a chicken, a decision she made whilst drunk.  She works part time as a studio manager, as well as making short films: Metaverse (2016), Spitfire (2018) and Desk Job (2016). She wants you to check her imdb page out, as she pays for it out of her student finance: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9080939/?ref_=nv_sr_1. 

EGGITOR - Alex Stuart 

Alex Stuart has been editing religiously since he was ten. Studying his final year of Editing and Post Production at Ravensbourne, Alex has already worked alongside many important creative institutions. Graduate of the BFI Future Film Academy and the NFTS Craft Residential, edit assistant for up and coming directors like Rob Savage and editor of several successful student shorts, Alex is bent on making a name for himself in the editing world.

DIREGGTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY - Katie Wardle 

Katie has been making her own documentaries since chickhood (14), resulting in work alongside the BFI and her work being released on TV stations internationally. She was recently successful in becoming a new 'National Geographic Explorer' to get closer to chickens, and she hopes to use that opportunity to spread awareness on more conversational efforts. With a firm background in the film industry; she has a rich knowledge of production, working on large productions within highly involved departments like lighting, for example, in a cinematic release feature called ‘Kaleidoscope’. Katie has completed over 80 short films in various roles from Assistant Camera and Gaffer to recently progressing into becoming a cinematographer. She has been a DOP now for 15 shoots with a sufficient budget and success after release , screening internationally and being commended for her cinematography. She looks forward to honing in her past experience and creating her best work yet with this cracking team and great director.

What eggsactly do we need?

We need your help. We need locations (in Scotland). We need food for crew. We need food for the cast, including a chicken (KEVIN). We need equipment to film on. We need a chicken and an understudy, because apparently chickens get camera shy. We need a van to take equipment to Scotland. We need costume. We need film things. We need your support. Basically, we just need you! 

The perks:

If you'd like to donate a custom amount, remember you WILL get the perk below the amount you donated! Every donation gets a perk (despite what Indiegogo tells you).

- Egg:  Digital download of film, digital poster and thanks in credits.

- Chick: Digital download of film, digital poster, thanks in credits and exclusive behind the scene photos and videos. 

- Hen: Digital download of film, digital poster, an IMDb page, and exclusive behind the scene photos and videos. 

- Cockrell:  Digital download of film, digital poster, an IMDb page, executive producer credit and exclusive behind the scene photos and videos. 

Why our film?

This project looks to be an exciting contribution to the musical-comedy genre, exploring the reality of family, trauma and coming-of-age in an exceptional tale suitable for all ages.

SHARE IF YOU CANNOT DONATE!

story:
Splatter Camp™ is a full-length feature film that tells the story of a group of young filmmakers who, while filming a documentary at the long since closed CAMP CANDY, discover that the legend of SCARY LARRY may be more than just fiction when a string of murders start picking them off, one-by-one.

Things only worsen for the survivors when distrust begins to tear them apart, for how could Scary Larry be real?  Is this killer the authentic package?  Could it actually be the groundskeeper?  Or, has the so-called masked madman been residing among the members of the group all along, posing as one of the helpless survivors?

Splatter Camp will be an old-school style Slasher Film with undertones of comedy and fun, as well as elements of modern-day meta.  The film takes inspiration from and will pay homage to 80's horror films and their villainous icons, especially that of Jason Voorhees the beloved Friday the 13th franchise he belongs to.  

 The idea for Splatter Camp came to writer/director Brandon Tobatto after several attempts to reach Paramount Pictures with a pitch for a new Friday the 13th film failed.  Out of this disappointment, and during the midway between Tobatto's last project 'Sugarplum', and his continuing work on 'Madhouse', Tobatto carried over almost all of the elements and story beats of that original treatment, molding the final product into its own version of Friday the 13th without being Friday the 13th.  

What was born was a self-aware, 80's throwback slasher story, with likable characters, purposely campy scenes and dialogue, and a new franchise icon that is, himself, aware of and inspired by his horror idol: Jason Voorhees.  This, of course, is the character of Scary Larry, and it has become apparent, judging from the screenplay, that even he would give Jason a run for his money.  

Without the financial backing of a major studio, Tobatto and his team decided to fund and produce the film independently, with positions both in front of and behind the cameras being filled by either long-time Team Tobatto members, or picked from the pools of both independent actors and filmmakers alike.  This will be the fundraising campaign that decides whether Splatter Camp is a small-time, low-budget little indie horror flick, or a well-funded, masterfully polished independent slasher film!

 

We here at Decomposing Pictures truly believe that if we are blessed with the funds to grab this opportunity by the heels, Splatter Camp will be a slasher movie unlike anything you've ever seen before.  

Our team has devoted the last few months to planning the production of Splatter Camp; figuring out what we need to produce a high-quality horror film that will not only look and sound fantastic, but present itself as something unique within a sea of horror excess.

Our fundraising goal of $10,000 will contribute to the full scope and scale of this project, from principle photography to post-production, and of course, give our believers the opportunity to walk away with some really great backer rewards. 

With the pledges made by our backers, Splatter Camp will begin principle photography in late May 2018 in Rutledge, Georgia, at the Camp Daniel Morgan campground, which also happens to be the filming site of Camp Crystal Lake in 1986's Friday the 13th Part VI: Jason Lives.

story:
About The Team:

Most of you probably know these details from the previous campaign that was launched on the initial build-up to shooting but for those don't, here is a run-down!

  • Matt Shaw and Michael Bray wrote the novel which went to number one on Amazon. Since then it has been picked up by a major publisher in Japan for translation and another publisher in Germany for translation there too. The German release is due in 2018 to coincide with the film and the Japanese translation is due November 2017. Shaw and Bray also wrote the screenplay but enlisted the help of horror legend Shaun Hutson (Slugs, Monolith, Chase) to ensure it was the best it could be!
     
  • The film was cast by Andrew Lynford CSA (Eastenders) and has attracted Tracy Shaw (Coronation Street), Danielle Harold (Eastenders), Rod Glenn (American Assassin, The Hippopotamus), Tony Cook (Kingsman; The Golden Circle), Laura Wilson (Coven of Evil) and Clair Buckley (The Comedian's Guide to Survival).
     

Why Another Campaign?

This is the third campaign for MONSTER with two out of three hitting the goal required at that stage so you might be wondering why we're doing yet another campaign. Hopefully these bullet points will help clear up any confusion!

  • Films are expensive. Matt Shaw sold all of his film merchandise and hit the convention run hard in order to raise more money for the film, to go with the initial funding we received. Unfortunately there is nothing left that he can realistically sell and credit isn't an option. If we don't hit the goal on this campaign, the film WILL be completed (on schedule we hasten to add) but to do so will require the film equipment purchased to be sold off. Why do we want to try and keep the equipment (cameras, lights, sound etc) - simple - we want to carry on making films for you to enjoy!
  • The funds from this campaign will be going directly on post-production of the film including sound design and editing costs. Because we want the film to look and sound as good as it possibly can, we're not looking at cutting corners to get it done on the cheap. Those of you in the industry will know - this can cost serious money to get right.
  • If we don't reach the full goal, we will sell off the equipment we have bit by bit until the goal is met. The closer we can get to the goal, the less we need to sell off and the more films you can expect from the same crew of people! Don't think of it as helping one film, think of it as helping many films...
     

The Impact

Matt Shaw and Michael Bray are mostly disheartened with the state of horror films at the moment. One film will come out and be a success and then multiple copycat films will come out offering nothing knew. Hollywood is quick to remake films with little care and thought and - well, it's a bit of an insult to fans of the genre. Authors by trade, with over 200 titles between them, Shaw and Bray will be looking to adapt numerous titles to bring you more horror and by hitting this goal, it means we walk away from the project with zero debt and all future monies made from sales will go on funding more films. Better yet, they're not just looking at their titles, they're looking at books from all independent authors with the dream of helping more people get from page to screen! Horror needs this. Independent artists need this. We need this.

Risks & Challenges

As already stated, the risk of not hitting the goal basically means we have to sell expensive equipment off to ensure post-production can be completed on time with zero debts. The problem with this is that it will slow progress for a second film and a third and a fourth.... By hitting the goal, we're ready to plow all future investment back into more films.

Thankfully, at this stage, the bulk of the risks and challenges we have faced have already been overcome although that doesn't mean the journey to this stage has been an easy one!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute as money is tight (understandable), but that doesn't mean you can't help! Please do share this campaign with your friends via any means possible. The more people we can reach, the more we can raise. And if we raise over £5,000 - simple, the rest of the funds go straight into a second film...

The German release is due in 2018 to coincide with the film and the Japanese translation is due November 2017. Shaw and Bray also wrote the screenplay but enlisted the help of horror legend Shaun Hutson (Slugs, Monolith, Chase) to ensure it was the best it could be! 
The film was cast by Andrew Lynford CSA (Eastenders) and has attracted Tracy Shaw (Coronation Street), Danielle Harold (Eastenders), Rod Glenn (American Assassin, The Hippopotamus), Tony Cook (Kingsman; The Golden Circle), Laura Wilson (Coven of Evil) and Clair Buckley (The Comedian's Guide to Survival). 


Why Another Campaign?
This is the third campaign for MONSTER with two out of three hitting the goal required at that stage so you might be wondering why we're doing yet another campaign. Hopefully these bullet points will help clear up any confusion!

Films are expensive. Matt Shaw sold all of his film merchandise and hit the convention run hard in order to raise more money for the film, to go with the initial funding we received. Unfortunately there is nothing left that he can realistically sell and credit isn't an option. If we don't hit the goal on this campaign, the film WILL be completed (on schedule we hasten to add) but to do so will require the film equipment purchased to be sold off. Why do we want to try and keep the equipment (cameras, lights, sound etc) - simple - we want to carry on making films for you to enjoy!
The funds from this campaign will be going directly on post-production of the film including sound design and editing costs. Because we want the film to look and sound as good as it possibly can, we're not looking at cutting corners to get it done on the cheap. Those of you in the industry will know - this can cost serious money to get right.
If we don't reach the full goal, we will sell off the equipment we have bit by bit until the goal is met. The closer we can get to the goal, the less we need to sell off and the more films you can expect from the same crew of people! Don't think of it as helping one film, think of it as helping many films... 


The Impact
Matt Shaw and Michael Bray are mostly disheartened with the state of horror films at the moment. One film will come out and be a success and then multiple copycat films will come out offering nothing knew. Hollywood is quick to remake films with little care and thought and - well, it's a bit of an insult to fans of the genre. Authors by trade, with over 200 titles between them, Shaw and Bray will be looking to adapt numerous titles to bring you more horror and by hitting this goal, it means we walk away from the project with zero debt and all future monies made from sales will go on funding more films. Better yet, they're not just looking at their titles, they're looking at books from all independent authors with the dream of helping more people get from page to screen! Horror needs this. Independent artists need this. We need this.

Risks & Challenges
As already stated, the risk of not hitting the goal basically means we have to sell expensive equipment off to ensure post-production can be completed on time with zero debts. The problem with this is that it will slow progress for a second film and a third and a fourth.... By hitting the goal, we're ready to plow all future investment back into more films.
Thankfully, at this stage, the bulk of the risks and challenges we have faced have already been overcome although that doesn't mean the journey to this stage has been an easy one!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you just can't contribute as money is tight (understandable), but that doesn't mean you can't help! Please do share this campaign with your friends via any means possible. The more people we can reach, the more we can raise. And if we raise over £5,000 - simple, the rest of the funds go straight into a second film...

story:
Who we are:

Tropical Regeneration is a new permaculture project in Puerto Viejo, Costa Rica. Our principle tool to create this project is permaculture (read below for more details).   Here’s a little more about us as individuals:

  • Mic Dahl (BA in Film and Media, Art Minor) - Media Development - Filmmaker, Artist, will be creating and publishing the public videos of Tropical Regeneration.
  • Jean Pullen (BA in Business Administration, Finance and Accounting) - Project Coordinator - Yoga Teacher, Gardener, Retreat Planner.
  • Alan Del Pozo (Engineer, Permaculture Consultant) - Permaculture Master Planner - Gardener, seed protector and co-creater in ceremonies.

By donating to Tropical Regeneration you’ll be helping bring the tools to plant and grow a message of having a deeper relationship with our Earth and everyone's local communities. Our means of helping bring a healthier lifestyle for both humanity and the Earth is through the documentation of Tropical Regeneration and the educational videos of permaculture and a simple life that connects us to one Tribe. All donation are truly appreciated as they help us spread this message and conversation about adjusting our lifestyle to caring more for the Earth, people, and fair share.

Where are the donations going?

Your donations will help fund the educational videos about permaculture and our techniques of having a deeper relationship with a healthy Earth, as well as the documentation of the Tropical Regeneration story, purpose, and lifestyle. We are aiming for funding $3000 to help equip ourselves with the proper weatherproof film tools, equipment for low light, “shoot-and-go” style, and sound equipment for interviews. These donations will help heighten our sound and video quality, ease of use, reach a larger audience, and be more equipped to film in the plethora of environments within Costa Rica’s tropical landscape. By having the funds for this film equipment and activism, we can contribute more of our funds and time to developing and growing our permaculture garden, sustainable equipment for our energy needs (solar power, oil burn, etc.), and construction of our shelters.

Activism Costs:

  • Envision Workshop Leader and Filmmaking: Travel cost: $250
  • Cacao Ceremony Essence Arenal Retreat Planning and Love Ceremony  (For 5 nights of accommodation, cacao, food) : $500

Equipment:

  • Sony Wireless Lavaliers $600
  • Waterproof DSLR case $50
  • Abonnyc Waterproof Camera Bag $70
  • Go Pro Hero 5 $300
  • Go Pro Sports Mounts $16
  • Magnus VT-300 Tripod $80
  • Panasonic 25mm f/1.4 $600
  • Panasonic 12-35mm f/2.8 $700

If you have any further questions, please email us tropicalregeneration@gmail.com or myself Mic at m1cd4hl@gmail.com. 

What is Permaculture?

Permaculture is a lifestyle of living with the land that fosters care for the Earth and one another. Permaculture allows one to live independently and respectfully with their environment, providing a healthy foundation for both the Earth and those living with it.

What is the Tropical Regeneration Plan?

Vision:

Regeneration of the life in the tropics and the reconnection of the  Relations between humans and Earth improving the quality of life and happiness of different communities.

Mission:

Regeneration of the ecosystems using agroforestry. Protecting existential rainforest. improving the quality of life and happiness of different communities.

Our principle tool to create this project is permaculture and describe our objectives we will use the permaculture flower starting this Land & nature Stewardship in a clockwise direction.

  1. Land & nature Stewardship
    • Improve the existential casita, office and botanical garden land. Creating nursery, Seed bank, and propagation of seeds, and starting a compost for regeneration of soil. Creation of medical, herbs, and greens gardens. Planting of fruits, veggies, and flowers. Next we will obtain a secondary land that needs regeneration using agroforestry to grow enough food and other services to sustain the project. Later, we will involve investor to help us fund or donate other properties to protect and regenerate.
  2. Buildings
    • In the existential property there is a shelter and office area for volunteers and contributors. We will redesign the shelter using natural and local resources reusing some of the existing materials. In the future lands of the project we will build simple shelters that will use natural and local materials.
  3. Tools & Technology
    • The existing shelter have water and electricity from local services and a water toilet with a septic tank and a kitchen with a small gas stove. Many of the systems will be improved and redesigned to use solar electricity, wood burning stove, well water, rain catchment, compost toilet and greywater systems.  In the future shelters of the project they will be improved and redesigned for similar or more simple systems than the existing shelters redesign.
  4. Education and Culture: 
    • We are educators that collaborate with some of the top permaculture activists in the world. We are growing, connecting and collaborating the network in the local area and throughout the world. We continue to educate ourselves by attending workshops, teaching workshops, and going to permaculture convergences.
    • The project will offer education and improve and restore the culture to reconnect and remember our care for people, our fair share and earth care. We will provide experiences and retreats in the tropics to help people connect humans to their tribal roots and learning a simple life. We are involved in collaborating cacao ceremonies and fire ceremonies within the community. We will create an online platform that has educational tools, and social awareness.
  5. Health and Spiritual Well Being
    • Within the existing property we are creating a medicinal garden, apothecary, fermentation station, and organic garden to grow our own medicine and food. This connection to our primary source of medicine and food is a spiritual practice. Also we have other spiritual practices that help use connect to our source and light within. A few examples being ceremonies, dance, yoga, fires, or meditation. The project will be involved in some of these practices that improve the health of the community.
  6. Finance and Economics
    • Our initial investment to the project is $250k. This is for land, startup costs, tools, labor, and volunteer cost of living. After the project has been establish online such as website, marketing, and social media, we will call for investments. The investments in monetary support will be in exchange for shares in the associate and back by land and be allocated to the following:
  7. Land Tenure and Community Governance
    • The existing land is within the marti-time zone and we have the permission to use the land. In the future, lands for protection and regeneration these will be the associations. Although the lands ownership is the associate, the investors will have share in the association based on the amount of funds received. These shares are backed by the land purchased by the association. The project is open to create coops that can within the local community, that are that of the cooperative members.

Working Plan as of 11/17/2017

Channeled by Jean and Alan

Risks & Challenges

We have created an associate called ‘Tropical Regeneration’ that will link a global community of beings that want to protect and restore the rainforest. In addition, we will have volunteers, locals, and farmers that contribute to the garden, the association, and the community ie. local schools, community gardens, and workshops. We aim to protect and regenerate the land. The land to establish the homestead and office is 500 square meters that will be a botanical garden, home for volunteers, and office. We will establish a food forest for least 2.5 acres that can satisfice 90% of the food for 10 persons, between the time it takes to establish the food forest, we will grow annual and seasonal crops to satisfice the 50% to 60% of the food. We have a shelter that is our casita and office. It will need to be redesigned for the current systems. We will have rain catchment systems and a well for water needs. The shelter will be built with natural materials from the land and from the local area and recycled material like an earthship. Occasional, we use concrete for the foundation of homes, and use alternative prefabricated roofs. The reason being for long term preservation and emerging of the structure. In our day to day life we will move in the most simple ways such as bicycles and horses, but occasionally we will use a small truck for long trips or farm related activities, this can be transformed to use burn oil (vegetable oil, etc.) in the future. We will offer retreats, Yoga, ceremonies and temazcal practices and some many others environmental workshops to help to develop spiritually and education to share with the different community’s. We aim to develop videos aimed to educated individuals and communities on the ease and benefit for the Earth of the life lifestyle of permaculture. Your donation will help contribute to the funding of the proper sound equipment and weather protective gear needed to for quality video documentation within the tropical and rainy environment of Costa Rica.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are inclined to help more with donations and/or would like to get involved please email us at tropicalregeneration@gmail.com. Help us plant these seeds, spread this message by sharing this video and page; and these videos will be made possible with your donation.

story:
This is the official page to get your tickets.

 

To book yourself a ticket to the premiere of 'Murphy's Birthday', just pledge a total of 8.00 (Unless you have previously donated to us before to pay half admission, in which case only 4.00) into the Indiegogo leaving either your name or Email address which you will use at the location to have ticked off to confirm it is you that has paid.

 

If you have contributed enough already to get a free ticket, your name or and or email address you used to pledge last time will be on site ready to  be ticked off.

story:
Hi there,

I'm David Call and I wrote and will be directing and acting in COLE. After over a decade helping to tell other artist's stories as an actor, making many independent films of all sizes and many dozens of television episodes, I'm finally ready to step behind the camera again and tell one of my own and I'm hoping you'll help me. 

THE STORY

Cole is a military veteran recovering from a Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) which has left him with a form of speech impairment called aphasia, specifically 'anomic aphasia'. While his mental faculties are fine, the speech center of his brain has been damaged, making it difficult for him to find the proper words or put them in the right order, especially in stressful situations. Now that he's out of the military and re-building his life in the civilian world he needs to find a job, a task made all the more stressful and uncertain by the disability he has to conquer.

Our film follows Cole and his wife Ashley as he spends the morning preparing for an interview, rehearsing what he wants to say and struggling to keep his aphasia under control when the moment of truth arrives.

Why COLE?

I chose this story because I wanted to make something simple and direct that also held special meaning for me. 

As someone with close family and friends currently serving in the armed forces, these are issues I am very familiar with and care deeply about. My brother is an active duty combat veteran and this script came about after visiting him on post and talking with him and some other soldiers and vets. We discussed the difficulties they faced reentering the civilian world and how the all too common depiction of vets in film and television as unstable & psychologically troubled or as unimpeachable heroes had led a widening of the gulf between them and their civilian counterparts, making it increasingly difficult for them to find jobs and re-integrate into American society. 

 

FUNDING & BUDGET

Even though COLE is a short film, it's still a film and to make it with the quality and care it deserves will cost some money. Fortunately, I and my production team have a lot of experience making high-quality independent films with very limited resources, so you can trust that every dollar we raise will be accounted for and spent wisely.

The budget for this 15-minute short film is $20,000.

About 10% of that goes to IndieGoGo and PayPal/credit card processing.

The rest will be spent on payment to the cast and crew, and "hard costs," of a 4-day shoot and post-production.

Cast and crew payments include actors, Production Department (producers & production assistants), Camera Department (cinematographer, assistant cameramen, grips, electricians), sound mixer, script supervisor, production designer, editor, and post production supervision,

"Hard costs" include craft service set food, prop purchases, meals for cast and crew, equipment rental, vehicle rental, production supplies, batteries, hard drives, film festival submission fees, and promotion.

If we are unable to reach our entire fund-raising goal here, there are two possibilities for the money. We will either see what we can eliminate from the production to make a smaller budget work, or we will hold the money in an account while other fund-raising efforts are made to achieve the target amount. In either case, the contributions will ONLY be used for the production of COLE.

In the event we raise more money than our goal, the funds will be used to pay the cast and crew more than just the bare minimum, get more and better equipment, have better options in post production, and have more effective means of promoting the film.

PERKS

We don't expect something for nothing and we've put together a great set of perks and rewards for our backers. We take our contributors seriously and want them to feel part of the production. That is why the perks are focused on credits on the film, behind the scenes photos and videos, scripts and cast & crew screening invitations. 

All perks over the $35 price will have password access to the final cut of the film online.

 

THE TEAM

David Call (writer/director/actor)

David has been a staple of the American indie film scene for the last decade, appearing in films such as TINY FURNITURE, JAMES WHITE, GABRIEL, THE GIRL IN THE BOOK, TWO GATES OF SLEEP, DEAD MAN'S BURDEN, AMERICANA and many others. He has also been on multiple TV series, most recently THE BREAKS, QUANTICO, THE MAGICIANS, SMASH, GOSSIP GIRL, FRINGE, RESCUE ME and more. This will be his 2nd time behind the camera, his first short film, B.U.S.T., won a Special Jury Prize at the Dallas Film Festival.

Carlos Zozaya (producer)

Carlos is an very smart young filmmaker that I met working on AMERICANA. He has also worked on films with Sebastian Silva, Anna Rose Holmer and Nick Pesce. The guy knows how to get things done and get them done right.

Zach Kuperstein (cinematographer)

Zach is a great DP recommended to me by my friend's at Borderline Films. His work on their Sundance sensation THE EYES OF MY MOTHER won Best Cinematography at Fantastic Fest and was nominated at the Independent Spirit Awards and Cameraimage. He also just finished shooting  the upcoming feature, JONATHAN. You can see his work here.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, there are still ways you can help us get this film made.

The most important thing you can do is to spread the word about this campaign. Please share this link on social media, whether it's Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, MySpace, AOL IM, sky writer or carrier pigeon, literally everything helps.

Thank you for taking a look and we hope you support our campaign!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, there are still ways you can help us get this film made.
The most important thing you can do is to spread the word about this campaign. Please share this link on social media, whether it's Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, MySpace, AOL IM, sky writer or carrier pigeon, literally everything helps.
Thank you for taking a look and we hope you support our campaign!

story:
From Our Producers... 

Marla Kate Fuller & Mariel Kathryn Hunter

When "The Belladonnas" was first conceived a year ago, I thought it was a good way to draw attention to the taboo issues many homeless women and women in developing nations face concerning finding and affording menstrual products. At the time, I couldn't have predicted that access to women's health care would become so widely threatened for so many. Now, with the leader of the free world pushing such a blatantly regressive agenda in women’s healthcare, the need for a group like the Belladonnas is even more pressing. As an American myself, I believe it's never been more important to remain vigilant and informed. As the Belladonnas do, we also believe it’s incredibly important to stand up, be heard and make a difference.

We believe The Belladonnas will be successful in serving several purposes. Firstly, obviously, to create an entertaining and unique short film which will prove the potential for an entertaining and unique feature. Secondly, this is an amazing opportunity to work with a talented, kick-ass group of young filmmakers and we’ve created a far too rare chance to showcase what a predominantly female crew can create. Finally, and this is where we really need your help, we have a moment here in which we can raise awareness of what is happening. We can use this moment to foster a much needed dialogue around these issues, and hopefully we can build a lasting community capable of taking these themes (and this rebellion) off the screen and into the real world. 

When you donate to the film, when you sport your Belladonna gear, or when you even simply share the campaign with friends, you help keep bring this conversation to life and your voice becomes one that cannot and will not be ignored. It’s then that you too become a Belladonna yourself. Welcome to the Belladonnas. Welcome to the rebellion. 

 

The Belladonna Breakdown

Here's what we need your support for:

Camera Equipment & Rentals: $1500 

We're lucky to have some hookups that'll give us great rates and even loan us some gear because they too believe in the Belladonna rebellion, but we could use your help to boost our production value and make this message one that cannot be ignored.

Production Design: $1500  

We're telling you now- this film is going to look AMAZING. We could not be more excited about what we are already working with- but could it look so amazing that investors for the feature couldn't help but say "shut up and take my money!"

...ABSOLUTELY. 

Your boost to our budget will allow us to truly create the world in which the Belladonnas are waging the good fight against the powers that be. We're eternally grateful for your help saving us from the future they are asking us to save them from. 

Locations: $1000 

The Belladonnas have a kick ass underground clubhouse- and we have the perfect place to shoot it! The only issue is that nothing comes from free- much less anything perfect. S0- if you could help us finance our dream Belladonna abode we would love you for forever! 

Crafty & Catering: $800 

Cast & Crew has gotta eat- a happy productive team is one with full bellies and as we cannot afford to pay everyone for this shoot the least we can do is be sure they are well provided for with plenty to nourish them as they work hard (and for free) on behalf of the rebellion. 

Sound: $150

We're fighting the rebellion to have our voices heard! So...it'd be good to have some decent sound on this production! We're calling in favours and we've got some pretty great folks on our side here at Belladonnas HQ who can help us out, but at the end of the day great sound is still gonna cost you a little cha-ching. Thanks for your help in making us heard around the world! 

Makeup & Hair: $250

Oh wow, do the Belladonnas have some great supporters and friends! We're having the pros come out in spades to help us as affordably as they can- and these magnificent creatures are going to run their department with only a budget for their kit fees. Please help us thank them by at least being able to cover their expenses for their efforts in the rebellion! 

Emergency/Insurance/Miscellanous: $1800

This contingency will ensure we've got all our bases covered, any day-of costs covered and our oh-so-important insurance needs covered! Anything left over from this budget at the end of production will be put towards donating feminine hygiene products to initiatives working with the homeless population locally here in Vancouver. Donations will be made in the names of our backers, THAT'S YOU! Way to go you! What a true Belladonna you are! 

An important note about this part of our budget: We originally had slated a contingency and miscellaneous budget of $500 and our original overall production budget was $8000. We are so lucky to have so many industry professionals who believe in this project and what it stands for that our entire crew is working for free and charging only the minimum of what they need to cover their own expenses. They are Belladonna Backers and we could not be more grateful for their support. 

AND! Don't forget to check out our perks --->

What?! You thought we were going to leave you emptyhanded? Puh-lease! You're a #BelladonnaBacker and we want to be sure you have the rewards to show that off to the world! 

 

How You Can Join & Empower The Rebellion.

(aka Becoming a Belladonna 101)

Back the Belladonnas:

Backing our project is huge, whether its $1 or $1000 is just a number- but your support is so much more to us that that. You backing our project says that this message matters and we need to make it heard. It tells our potential investors down the road that you believe in us, that you support us and that you want to see more of the Belladonnas rebellion. It will hopefully support us in taking this from a short film to a full length feature empowering women all around the world to stand up, fight back, and join the Belladonnas in taking back control of our own rights over our bodies and our healthcare.  

Share Our Story:

We have it all. We have Instagram, we have Twitter, we have Facebook- and of course we have this Indiegogo Page. What else have we got? You.

We are only heard by those we get exposure to. If  you can please spread our voices through the reaches of your social networks then we can truly get the support we need to spread this message far and wide. 

Please check us out on our social media pages, please like & share our content and please consider sharing our Indiegogo page in your statuses and posts. 

We can truly change the world- we just need to come together to do so. 

#BandwiththeBelladonnas #BacktheBelladonnas #BeaBelladonna

 

Thank you so much for your support, financially & otherwise. It truly means the world to us. 

xox, 

The Belladonnas.

story:
Storyline

We are in a world where a certain division of man isn't born, but artificially created. We follow AL, a man who wakes with no knowledge of who or what he is. Imprisoned in a dream like room, his only connection to the outside world is a TV, which begins to inform his personality. He is presented with a set of characters and footage which teaches him to think, function and express himself, however, the room likes to play games with AL. It exposes him to progressively disturbing imagery and engages him in a series of debilitating challenges. AL must find a way to free his mind from the influence of the TV and escape the room.

Characters

AL, the man in the room -

    AL is the central character in our story, we see him grow and transform through his experiences in the room. Early in the story, he is in many ways like a child but as the story progresses, we see how life in the room manipulates his development. It becomes his goal to break free and define himself as an individual, as opposed to a collection of information presented through a TV.

In addition to footage of the world, landscapes, wildlife, cartoons, music and film, etc. There are a series of characters AL sees on TV which are detrimental to his growth and understanding of what a human is. The footage of these characters often resembles CCTV footage.

Hunter, 'The man on TV'

    Hunter is the first human AL sees on TV. He is a teacher of sorts. Through imitating him, AL learns many basic human functions and abilities, including eating, speaking, reading and writing. He often emphasises AL's need for a friend or a parent figure,

Rose, 'The Woman on TV'

    Rose is AL's introduction to love and infatuation. He is shown footage of her, often in private or intimate scenarios, that are designed to make AL grow romantically attached to her. Her presence emphasises AL's loneliness, his desire for a partner, and his need to love and feel loved. 

Grey, 'The prisoner on TV'

    Grey is a man being driven mad. Trapped in a claustrophobic environment, he behaves like a caged animal, his situation often emphasising AL's own captivity, fear, and need to escape. Grey is the only character who looks into the CCTV camera. He often shows signs of awareness and rebellion against his captors.

'The singer on TV'

    The singer on TV is a 50s/60s R&B pop star who appears occasionally throughout the film. She sings a song which seem as if it's be directly about AL, the lyrics of which often reflect his infatuation with Rose, his loneliness, and his need to escape. As the story progresses, the song transforms from a piece of catharsis, into a reflection of his entrapment, the validity of the lyrics often emphasises the likelihood that he is being watched.

The Team

Our Challenge

As many people working in the arts can attest to, one of the biggest problems when setting out to create an idea, is funding. However, this is a feature film that can be made for a few thousand pounds rather than several millions. Not only is it an idea that allows me to tell a story with I deeply believe in, but it's an idea that gives me the opportunity to break into the feature film industry without the massive funding restrictions that hold so many young creatives back.

The total contribution of £3500 allows me to achieve my dream of directing a feature film, with a story I love. It allows me the chance to make a name for myself in an industry otherwise limited for opportunities. And it allows me to give my filmmaking team the chance to succeed. I believe If this does well on the festival circuit, it could be the big break me and team are looking for.

What We Need

The £3500 (minus indiegogo's 5% cut) is to be split across 3 main sectors.

1. £1000 for set dressing, props, and stock footage

These items are quite specific, as they all need to fit within the artistic style. It includes -

A chair, bed, rugs, floor tiling, curtains, a mirror, several different paints, a TV, furniture, several lights and diffusers to be built within the set, a large framed painting of Caspar David Friedrich's 'the wanderer above the sea of fog', several decorative props, and props to be used by the character.

The stock footage is for some educational material to be displayed on the TV. While a lot of the TV footage will be filmed and made by myself, some of it, such as world war II footage and atomic bombs, can't feasibly be shot realistically with the limitations we have.

2. £1000 for cast and crew expenses

Everyone is working on this film voluntarily, but in order to do so, they need support. £1000 is to be spent on covering all the cast and crew expenses. This includes travel, food, and general hospitality for the cast and crew over the 15 day shoot period.

3. £1325 is for video and audio gear

In order to shoot the way desired, we require a series of video and audio gear. Rental was considered for a lot of this equipment, but as the shoot is over a long period of 15 days, it became more logical to buy most of the equipment, which can then later be resold and used to spend on marketing and entering into film festivals.

We will be purchasing

  •  Zhiyun 3-axis gimbal stabiliser for DSLR and BMPCC
  • 14mm panasonic lens top be used with a black magic pocket cinema camera
  • A Rode NTG 4+
  • Zoom H4N SP
  • Cheap florescent lights, with stand, soft boxes, and green, black, and white screen
  • 2 day Rental of Sony FS5 with accessories for high quality slow motion shots

The last £175 is taken by indiegogo, as they require a 5% hosting fee.

If we exceed our target, the surplus funds will go towards post production, marketing, film festival entries, and providing the cast and crew with pay. If you wish to keep contribute after the initial target, please feel free to do so.

What You Get

To set this apart from many other crowdfunding campaigns, I think it's important that contributors really feel apart of the film in someway.

As a result anyone who donates £20 or more gets a special thanks in the end credits of the film. That's your name forever immortalised in a feature film. 

Anyone who donates £30 or more, gets to make up their own credit. The idea behind the make your credit choice is that it allows a much more interactive contribution, each individual gets to imprint their personality in someway at the end of the credits.

There are many other perks, from props, to signed materials, and everyone who donates £10 or more gets a downloadable copy of the film.

The biggest perk however comes at £1000. This is a fully fledged producers credit (limited at two). This means that as one of the primary funders, your name will appear next to the directors on the DVD and all promotional material.

I designed these perks to reward those who really believe in the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some of you can't contribute money but want to help. Simply by sharing this project, showing your friends our campaign video, spreading the word and getting as many people involved, you can help us achieve this target!

Thank you for taking your time to read through all this!

story:
Thanks for those of you who have contributed to this campaign.  But we are short of our goal.

When my life changed drastically three years ago, I questioned if it was because I hadn't been doing enough, being enough to my husband and family, or even being enough for God. I have heard many others are struggling in the same way, and I want to point them to Jesus - the enough for everything.

But I need your help to make that happen.  We lost a major funding source and now I am taking on that financial burden.

My goal is to raise $100,000 in the next 30 days. That sounds impossible, but I know you, my fans, and I serve a God that makes all things possible.

So if you feel led to contribute, you can do so on this page. But whether you can support this message financially or not, please come to the movie. And bring your girlfriends, your daughters or even your mother.  We will laugh, some might cry, but we can all rejoice together in a gathering of like-minded women celebrating that, through faith in Jesus, we are enough.

story:
Essence of Death is the story of Mortemus, The angel of death, who is growing to despise humanity. He is sent by his brothers to remember what it was like to love Gods favourite creation, mankind. Mortemus wakes up in a hospital encounters humans, various angels and the devil himself all sharing their perspectives of life, the after life, and what it means to existence.

This campaign means the world to us because our crew has so many skills and talents that we want to showcase the best way possible. We have taken many many MANY production, design and acting classes in our University career, and now it is time to put our degree to good use! This is our first independent film project branching away from the in class assignments we hated conforming to. It's now time for us to take our first big step towards the professional film world.

 

Our goal is $2000. We want to bring you the best film possible, and unfortunately, film making costs money. We want to invest a lot in art direction. Art direction covers a lot of materials such as make-up, special effects, set design, costumes, etc. Outside of that, we want to put a lot of money into equipment rentals, paying actors/actresses, location rental fees, and food.

 

For those who donate to us, we have a wide variety of incentives available to you. That includes things such as: a digital download of the film, a special thanks in the credits, an Essence of Death t-shirt, a Private Screening to the film, or even an associate or executive producer credit!

Campaign Exclusive T-Shirt worn by our Assistant Director!

Campaign Exclusive Poster

Michael J. Krym is an Italian born Canadian actor actor/writer. Has been writing for film and television since 2012. Began on stage as Ahmed in The Resolution (2016), followed as Junior Dawson in Better Living (2017). Michael has been involved in films such as Gotham Night, Dead Love, and a number of Canadian commercials.

 

Kitu Turcas After high school, Kitu quickly became an ensemble member of Korda Artistic Productions playing various roles. From a charismatic alien lover in Devil Boys from Beyond, to a decrepit Pope in Faustus. Kitu is currently enrolled in the BFA - Acting program at University of Windsor and hopes one day it might actually mean something. Pretty good with nunchucks.

 

Lauren Fields is in her fourth year of the BFA acting program at the University of Windsor. She is very excited for the release of "Essence of Death" and would like to thank the whole cast and crew for all the support and confidence in her abilities in the role as Gabrielle.

 

Sean Williams is incredibly excited to be playing Lucifer in Essence of Death. Past performances include Aramis in The Three Musketeers and Radleigh in Blue Stockings through the University Players. Sean would like to thank his Mum, Dad, Nina, Faye, and all his friends and relatives for their love.

Eric Branget is a professional actor/singer born and raised in Windsor. He graduated from the University of Windsor's BFA acting program in 2016 and since then has appeared in various stage and commercial productions. He is the artistic director of Spark Plug Players; a theatre troupe that has toured productions across Ontario and most recently Orlando Florida. More recently he has appeared in the Windsor Confidential Music Theatre Project's production of Company. He is currently assistant directing University Player's production of Lion In The Streets and will perform in Windsor Feminist Theatre's production on The Bolt House in May. Previous credits include Molière (Molière Impromptu), University Players; Albus Dumbledoor (A Very Potter Musical) Boarder City Players; Friar Lawrence (Love Unbound: Romeo and Juliet), Seven Siblings; Michael Katurian (The Pillowman), Spark Plug Players; and Bobby (Company), Confidential Music Theatre Project.

The challenges that may arise during production will simply be our access to resources. Filmmaking is not a poor man's hobby, unfortunately. That is to say, if we do not make our goal the film will still be made, but we would have to cut a few corners, and that's something we'd rather not do.

  • We all have that ambition and desire to produce an amazing product, and will stop at nothing. Even though funds will save us IMMENSELY.
  • We are confident in our strengths as artists to put forth the best product we are able to for you!
  • If we do not reach our goal, every intention will be made in order to make sure every department receives funding. Our two top priorities are special effects and actor payment. 

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Every donation, like, comment and share counts and we truly cannot say enough how grateful we are for any bit of engagement.
  • Give us a like on Facebook and Instagram!
  • Don't forget to use Indiegogo's share features and share it with your friends!
  • This isn't just OUR film. It's very much YOURS as well.
story_txt:
Essence of Death is the story of Mortemus, The angel of death, who is growing to despise humanity. He is sent by his brothers to remember what it was like to love Gods favourite creation, mankind. Mortemus wakes up in a hospital encounters humans, various angels and the devil himself all sharing their perspectives of life, the after life, and what it means to existence.
This campaign means the world to us because our crew has so many skills and talents that we want to showcase the best way possible. We have taken many many MANY production, design and acting classes in our University career, and now it is time to put our degree to good use! This is our first independent film project branching away from the in class assignments we hated conforming to. It's now time for us to take our first big step towards the professional film world.
 


Our goal is $2000. We want to bring you the best film possible, and unfortunately, film making costs money. We want to invest a lot in art direction. Art direction covers a lot of materials such as make-up, special effects, set design, costumes, etc. Outside of that, we want to put a lot of money into equipment rentals, paying actors/actresses, location rental fees, and food.
 


For those who donate to us, we have a wide variety of incentives available to you. That includes things such as: a digital download of the film, a special thanks in the credits, an Essence of Death t-shirt, a Private Screening to the film, or even an associate or executive producer credit!

Campaign Exclusive T-Shirt worn by our Assistant Director!


Campaign Exclusive Poster


Michael J. Krym is an Italian born Canadian actor actor/writer. Has been writing for film and television since 2012. Began on stage as Ahmed in The Resolution (2016), followed as Junior Dawson in Better Living (2017). Michael has been involved in films such as Gotham Night, Dead Love, and a number of Canadian commercials.
 

Kitu Turcas After high school, Kitu quickly became an ensemble member of Korda Artistic Productions playing various roles. From a charismatic alien lover in Devil Boys from Beyond, to a decrepit Pope in Faustus. Kitu is currently enrolled in the BFA - Acting program at University of Windsor and hopes one day it might actually mean something. Pretty good with nunchucks.
 

Lauren Fields is in her fourth year of the BFA acting program at the University of Windsor. She is very excited for the release of "Essence of Death" and would like to thank the whole cast and crew for all the support and confidence in her abilities in the role as Gabrielle.

story:
In 2016,  I was the recipient of the Women in Film Fellowship Award from the Shawna Shea Memorial Foundation, which comes with a $500 stipend towards my film along with a mentorship from a variety of professionals in the filmmaking and arts community, including Skip Shea, a local award-winning writer and director and father of the late Shawna Shea. Read more about Shawna and the foundation here: https://www.shawnasheaff.com/foundation

The synopsis of my film is as follows:  

Told through the eyes of multiple couples, a story of interconnectedness unfolds as Chrysta opens herself to the possibility of love. Brief encounters reveal the invisible current that eventually leads to the moment she lays eyes on her future. Interweaving natural elements and surroundings, Namaste takes you on a moving visual journey of loss and love.

Written and directed by myself, Namaste will be produced in conjunction with the Shawna Shea Memorial Foundation. The professional crew will include DP Jonathon Millman, an Emmy and Telly award-winning cinematographer and David Frederick, a multi award-winning and Emmy nominated composer. Both reside in NH. https://www.jamillman.com/  http://www.dfmusicgroup.com

Principal photography will begin on June 10-11, 2017  and take place entirely in Exeter, NH. This will be my directorial debut. 

My goal of $5,000 will cover the expenses of catering my cast and crew, pay for equipment rental fees, specific wardrobe, set design, post production, marketing, and other miscellaneous costs associated with the production of this film. I will not profit from this project in any matter, except the pride of creating a beautiful film and offering the community and other collaborators the opportunity to be a part of this.

Namaste will be an unique film easily relatable to a diverse audience. A connection with simplicity intertwined with aesthetic moments will leave the viewer in awe of the beauty of humanity combined with stunning, natural locations. It will be a memorable experience. 

Find out more about the director by visiting her IMDb page at http://www.imdb.me/christinealtan
