story:
SYNOPSIS

The story takes place in a small fishing village in southeastern China, a village of little importance, at a time when China was still heavily male-dominated. Thousands of women fell victim to widespread societal misogyny. Among these women is six-year-old Lin. Raised by a widowed mother, Lin does not only have to toil with house work, she also has to find ways to make money to support her 8-year-old brother’s education.

One day, her brother brings her surprising news: their mother has met a man who wants to relocate them to a place called Taiwan. Lin, thrilled that her dream of leaving Shajiang is about to come true, tosses and turns through a long sleepless night. But the next day, Lin wakes to an empty house, only to realize that she has been left behind.

Key Art illustrated by Sue Lin

_________________________________________________________________________________

MAIN CHARACTERS

Lin (6), Smart and sensible, warm but doesn’t smile often. Growing up as a girl in rural China is tough. Though times are hard, Lin still manages to have fun and stay optimistic. She always looks to the ocean hoping that one day she will escape this place.

*Reference photo pulled from movie "Bedeviled."

Mother (25), Diligent, independent. Mother of two children at a very young age. Life became much more ruthless when she was widowed two years ago due to her husband’s sudden death. Overwhelmed by the heavy economic pressure of supporting the only male descendant in the family, she is about to make a huge decision which is going to change all their lives.

_________________________________________________________________________________

DIRECTOR'S STATEMENT

         I received a call from my mother one Sunday afternoon while I sat around doing nothing in my shabby Jersey City apartment. It was 3 am in China, where my mom was calling from. She told me that she had just had a nightmare about her mother, a nightmare she had been having since she was six. “I think I am probably never going to be able to forgive her,” she told me.

         I was shocked. My mother was forty-five, which meant that she’d been having this nightmare for forty years. As the conversation unfolded, a piece of buried memory was unveiled.

         Pearl is inspired and loosely based on this memory from my mother’s tragic past. I don’t intend to recreate her nightmare but I want to put myself in this little girl’s shoes and see what she saw, through the art of cinematic storytelling. By examining the event from different perspectives, I hope to better understand this traumatic moment. I believe that the process of writing and reexamining what went on in each character’s mind will help me shed some light on the complex fabric of the human condition.

_________________________________________________________________________________

THE TEAM

Yuchao “Robbin” Feng | Writer/Director

Robbin is an award-winning Chinese director/cinematographer who currently resides in New York. His exposure to two immensely contrasting worlds has deeply impacted his perspective on life and cinema. With a rich cultural background and unique visual style, Robbin is inspired to integrate his eastern aesthetics with western storytelling. His passion for film is driven by his free spirit, charisma, and eagerness to understand humanity in a complex and ever-changing global environment.

Robbin was recently awarded Best Cinematography at The 2016 ShortPole London International Film Festival for, Final Cassette, one of his earlier works as the Director of Photography. Since his graduation from Temple University, Robbin has shot numerous short films, music videos and commercials as a well-acclaimed Director of Photography. Robbin is currently studying Directing in the prestigious Graduate Film program at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts.

Lasse Ulvedal Tolbøll | Director of Photography

Lasse Ulvedal Tolbøll is an award-winning cinematographer from Denmark. His work has been screened at festivals such as Sarasota Film Festival, Maryland Film Festival, Montclair Film Festival. He just won Best Cinematography at the First Run Film Festival in New York. Lasse gained interest in filmmaking during high school while making skate videos before slowly transitioning into making narratives.

After living in Taiwan for six months, he started a masters program in Film and Media at the University of Copenhagen but dropped out when he was accepted into the Graduate Film program at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts. He is now based in New York where he is a BAFTA Scholar sponsored by HBO.

You can check out Lasse's reel HERE!

Gracie Vergara | Producer

Rachel “Gracie” Vergara is writer, director, and producer from Manila, Philippines. She is currently a dual-degree Film Producing student at New York University Stern and Tisch. She graduated with the top artistic award for screen arts, The Loyola School Award for the Arts, from the Ateneo de Manila University. Her thesis film, “Immanuel” screened at the Cinemalaya Cinco Festival, and her documentary “Munting Mundo,” was a finalist at the Catholic Mass Media Awards. Recently, her script “Supermodel” was selected to receive a production grant from the Cinematografo Originals Short film competition.

Yifei He | Producer

Yifei He was born and raised in Beijing, and is currently pursuing her masters degree in the Graduate Film program at New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts. She resided in the United States at the age of 18 to attend college, where she studied film production and theatre. She has written, directed and edited multiple shorts in China and U.S. She produced the short film"A Test" which was selected for the 2017 Sundance Film Festival, Nashville Film Festival, and FIRST Film Festival in Xining.

_________________________________________________________________________________

THE LOCATION

Shajiang Village, Xiapu Country, Fujian Province, China｜中国福建省宁德市霞浦县沙江村

*All location photos were taken by the filmmaker

Read about Xiapu, the 'most beautiful fishing village'.

_________________________________________________________________________________

THE ASK

We need to raise at least $8,500 to make this project possible. The major culprits for cost are equipment rentals, transportation, and the cost of feeding a cast & crew of around 15 for 5 days. Once principal photography is complete, the costs continue with post-production, which includes color correction and professional sound-mixing. Finally, a film is made to be seen, and to get it seen requires a solid chunk of money vis-à-vis festival submission fees and Digital Cinema Packages (DCPs).

BUDGET BREAKDOWN

  • Chinese local crew - 30%
  • Crew Flights & Transportation - 20%
  • Equipment rental - 13%
  • Production Design - 6%
  • Casting - 25%
  • Crew Meals - 6%

We are receiving the following free of charge:

  • Alexa Classic Camera Package
  • Accommodations
  • NYU key crew 
  • Post Production Facilities
  • Insurance

By offering your support, you're not just making an investment in a short film, you're making an investment in a promising young filmmaker's career.

_________________________________________________________________________________

​NYU

Pearl is made with the support of New York University’s Tisch School of the Arts. Esteemed filmmakers and professors such as Todd Solondz, Alex Rockwell, Andrew McLean, and Barbara Schock are all part of the process of shaping this film.

MARKETING/FESTIVALS/DISTRIBUTION

This film is set to begin principal photography in late December 2017 and aims to finish post production in May 2018. It's important for young directors to apply for film festivals both to get their work recognized, as well as to meet other filmmakers and producers around the world. I am highly ambitious about taking this project as far as I possibly can. Therefore I am set out to submit the film to major festivals including Sundance, Toronto, Berlin and Cannes as well as smaller festivals that suit the genre.

For backers who resides in China in the case that you don't have a VISA card, please use the QR codes above to contribute through WeChat or Alipay.

在中国地区无法使用VISA信用卡的朋友，您可以使用上方的二维码使用微信或者支付宝支持这个项目！非常感谢！

Thank you so so much for all your love and support! I can't wait to share this film with the rest of the world!

 

Sincerely,

Robbin

Esteemed filmmakers and professors such as Todd Solondz, Alex Rockwell, Andrew McLean, and Barbara Schock are all part of the process of shaping this film.MARKETING/FESTIVALS/DISTRIBUTIONThis film is set to begin principal photography in late December 2017 and aims to finish post production in May 2018. It's important for young directors to apply for film festivals both to get their work recognized, as well as to meet other filmmakers and producers around the world. I am highly ambitious about taking this project as far as I possibly can. Therefore I am set out to submit the film to major festivals including Sundance, Toronto, Berlin and Cannes as well as smaller festivals that suit the genre.For backers who resides in China in the case that you don't have a VISA card, please use the QR codes above to contribute through WeChat or Alipay.在中国地区无法使用VISA信用卡的朋友，您可以使用上方的二维码使用微信或者支付宝支持这个项目！非常感谢！Thank you so so much for all your love and support! I can't wait to share this film with the rest of the world! Sincerely,Robbin

story:
Hello!

I'm Dan O'Neill, a zoologist come Masters student of Wildlife Filmmaking at The University of the West of England in partnership with the BBC Natural History Unit. For the Masters, we have to produce a broadcast quality 10-13 minute short film which will then be screened to industry leading natural history filmmakers in November 2018 in Bristol.  

For as long as I can remember I have had an abiding interest in animals and the natural world, particularly jungles. Some people may find the idea of sleeping in a hammock in the rainforest a complete nightmare, whereas for me its a dream come true. Some years ago, I joined a research expedition into the green heart of Guyana doing just that and it was the most captivating experience of my life. For my final masters project, I intend to follow someone else's unforgettable journey to this magical country - but to tell this story the best it can be told, I need your help.

The Story

Over 80% of Guyana is still wilderness. Spider monkeys swinging and howler monkeys roaring from trees as tall as skyscrapers, black caimans basking on the riverbanks and otherworldly blue butterflies landing on giant leaves are just a snapshot of its immersive beauty. But for all the brilliantly coloured and iridescent animals in Guyana's jungles, there is one giant grey bird with a history shrouded in myth and legend... The Harpy Eagle

Natasha Ellison, a mathematician, theoretical physicist and mathematical ecologist has spent years writing equations to describe how birds use their space. Her theoretical models, she one day hopes could be used in the fight to save the rainforest habitat of the Harpy Eagle. But her work, as much potential as it has, keeps her from chasing her life-long dream of seeing the formidable  and enigmatic bird in the wild...

Until now.

"To See the Grey" is the story of PhD mathematician, Natasha Ellison, diving head first into the adventure of a life-time to realise a life-long dream and see one of the rarest birds of the Amazon rainforest in the wild - the Harpy Eagle.

Natasha Ellison

Manchester born mathematician and keen bird watcher, Natasha Ellison, has barely left her lab in the last two years. Her PhD at The University of Sheffield involves writing complex equations to describe how birds use their space - with hopes they could be used in rainforest conservation. However, a chance encounter in with a local in Belize sparked a passion for the Harpy Eagle, the most powerful bird on the planet and ever since, she has dreamt of seeing one in its natural habitat.

The Harpy Eagle

The incredibly rare and mysterious Harpy Eagle is the most powerful raptor on the planet.

Being right at the top of the food chain, the apex avian predator hunts animals as large as sloths and monkeys. With legs as big as a human arm, talons longer than a grizzly bear and a razor sharp beak, its easy to see how it received a name taken from that of Greek mythology.

But masked behind the gruesome appearance of this mysterious creature, there is a caring parent, a devoted partner, and an enduring survivor fighting hard for its existence in a rapidly shrinking home.

The Locations

Guyana is a small, low populated country on the north coast of South America. About 80% of Guyana is forested, approximately 60% of which is classified as primary rainforest. Guyana's forests are highly biodiverse - the country has an estimated 8,000 species of plants and 1,800 species of amphibians, birds and mammals. The country also has a high diversity of habitats from lowland rainforest, montane forest, swampland and marshland, dry evergreen forest, seasonal forest and mangroves.

Iwokrama International Centre for Rainforest Conservation and Development

The IIC is an international not-for-profit organisation managed by staff in the Iwokrama forest interior and in Georgetown. It was established in 1996 through a joint mandate with the Guyanese government and the commonwealth to manage the incredibly diverse Iwokrama forest reserve or 371,000 hectares of rainforest.

The Rupununi

The Rupununi is a region in the south-west of Guyana bordering the Brazilian Amazon within which lies the Surama, Yupukari and Katoka Amerindian villages that Natasha will visit on her quest. The Rupununi river, known also by its local indigenous name, Raponani, cuts through the Rupununi region and is one of the major tributaries of Guyana’s largest river, the Essequibo.

The Rupununi river’s direct and surrounding areas harbour a huge diversity of aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems that are home to an even larger diversity of species no longer present in other parts of South America. The freshwater ecosystems of the Rupununi are of exceptional species richness, comparable to that of the Central Amazonia. Animals and plants are so successful in the Rupununi river because of the area’s separation from large-scale human activity.

The flora and undisturbed tree life down the Rupununi river, is a haven for many rare species of bird-life. some 300 bird species live along the river – one of which - the largest aerial predator in South America and Natasha's holy grail, the Harpy Eagle.

The Impact

Guyana is a country that many people know little about. Not just that, it has a forward thinking and conservation minded attitude when it comes to its forests.

With this film, I want to raise awareness about the sustainable use practices run by the Iwokrama Centre and the conservation minded ecotourism ventures of the indigenous communities we meet along the way.

This film, I hope, will not just be the realisation of a life-long dream for Natasha, but will show people the beauty of a country and its forest, giving a message of hope in a time where a lot of what we hear about our natural world is the opposite. 

An Inspiration

In the development of this story, I came across the much loved and maverick birder, Tim Cleeves, who sadly passed away in December. After reading about his story, I spoke to some of his friends and family. Tim's wife, Ann, wrote an inspiring post on her online journal urging people to be more like him, and to live life to its fullest in the face of any adversities. Her words and Tim's story have been a great inspiration to me as I'm sure they have been for many others:

"To take risks, be open to new possibilities and not let the fear of being hurt or rejected prevent us from approaching people and ideas with an open mind and an open heart. To dance, and cook, and drink, and walk, and perhaps break the rules every now and then."

#BeMoreTim

With support from:

&

The Masters is co-designed and co-taught by The University of the West of England and the BBC Natural History Unit.

BBC Mentor

Rob Sullivan

Rob is an award-winning producer director with twenty years experience self-shooting. Rob produced the conservation episode of BBC1's 'The Hunt' for Silverback Films involving the formidable Harpy Eagle, and has made five 'Natural World' films for the BBC Natural History Unit. Rob recently directed the Everest sherpa sequence for the opening of BBC1's 'Earth's Natural Wonders' and in 2008 won a BAFTA for Bruce Parry’s Amazon series. 

The Crew

Dan O'Neill - Producer/Cinematographer

Dan has a BSc Zoology degree from The University of Sheffield. He worked in publicity, sales and creative direction as well as in international biological field research before beginning a masters in Wildlife Filmmaking at UWE Bristol. Dan co-founded the conservation minded wildlife film festival, Wilderland.

Jonny Poole - Second Camera/Sound

Jonny is an experienced camera operator and filmmaker working at the BBC in London. He has worked on projects both in the UK and abroad.

Ashley Holland

Ashley was born in England but moved to South Africa at 3 months of age, where he grew up on remote farms in the Transvaal. It was here he developed his love of wild and remote places and learnt to speak Afrikaans. At the age of 10 Ash moved to Botswana on the edge of the Okavango Delta where his mother was running a lodge. After two years they re-migrated to England for a couple years of education before moving to Guyana, where Ashley’s mother set up a bush camp on the Mazaruni River.

In 1994 Ashley travelled to the Rupununi and fell in love with the area and lifestyle and commenced working at Karanambu Lodge. Since then he has learned about the area, its people and the incredible flora and fauna. Ash is most at home out in the bush, especially on the rivers where he can fish, observe wildlife, explore new and remote areas, and learn from the locals about bush lore. He considers he was born 100 years too late, and would have been best suited as an early explorer, or naturalist of some kind.

Ashley is now a well respected guide who enjoys leading small groups into the remote and wild areas of the Rupununi. He is an excellent boat captain and naturalist and will help Natasha on her quest to see the Harpy Eagle in the wild.

Where Your Support Will Go

The money you donate will go straight into the production of the film, making a film is not cheap (especially in the jungle!) and although we have support with kit from UWE, the rest we have to raise ourselves so any help you can give will be amazing!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our page and spread the word about our campaign to your friends on social media!

story:
"Amazigh" - meaning "free people" in Berber - is an artistic short film, which aims at consolidating diverse art-forms with the authentic life experiences of Sofia, Aziz, and Brahim. Art is the single universal language in the world. These three unique individuals, from two separate parts of the world, found a common path through their passionate and ambitious endeavors. Indeed, their difficult childhood, as well as the struggles they encountered at every step of the way, have been surmounted due to the fact that these free people bravely danced and sang their way through their hurdles. Hereby, the given project not only exploits the incredible stories of those remarkable artists, but also allows for further artistic expansion. 

Our main production team includes the following members: 

- Centre Social et Culturel l'Escale: Producer

- Sofia and Amad: Executive Producers

- Yann and Hayk: Co-directors

"Amazigh" is of crucial importance to us, for it redefines freedom through music. The realization of the given project will inhibit us to further explore possibilities of mixing various art forms - in this case, flamenco, hip-hop, moroccan music - all the whilst creating something truly exceptional. Moreover, our team believes that these artists deserve the proper recognition, because let's admit it, they are incredible! 

The success of this project will open new doors for future possibilities of exploiting the potential of these artists, meanwhile exploring new opportunities with regards to up-and-coming artists, seeking to experiment new and innovative ideas, and showcase their talents. 

Significant investments have already been made to complete phase one, which consisted of shooting the first part of the movie in Strasbourg, France. "L'Escale" has contributed around 7000 euros from its personal resources to make this project a reality. 

However, phase 2 - filming in Morocco - will require an additional investment of 8000 euros, which will cover the following expenses: traveling fees, technical equipment (ex: camera, ronin, drone rentals), housing, costumes, accessories, decoration, and local transport fees. 

In exchange, for the corresponding amounts of investments, contributors benefit from personal interviews with the actors of the short film; an exclusive preview of the film; a copy of the film in DVD format; and personal recognition as associate producers in the credits of the film. 

In case, the campaign doesn't reach it's final goal and the required funds are not raised, all collected funds will nonetheless be invested in the development of the film. 

Since we have already successfully completed phase one of the short film, the main risk we face for phase two is not being able to raise the necessary amount in order to complete the motion picture. However, in the eventuality that we will face such an impediment, we will either rework the script to adapt it to more feasible conditions, or foresee a longer period of time during which we can implement the second phase in Morocco. 

If you have come this far, then you have already contributed. Your participation and support mean the world to us! We are already grateful for your attention. If you aren't able to contribute by investing a certain amount to make this project a reality, then we kindly ask you to consider sharing our campaign and spreading the word as much as possible. Once again, thank you!!

story:
If you had two doors in front of you, one going into the room of which you know every corner, and the other was a mystery, which one would you choose to enter?

The Great Journey is a documentary series bringing you inside this unknown room, the scary and uncomfortable, but exciting one; everything that comes with pursuing a dream. Throughout the episodes, you will follow seven different female filmmakers who all have decided to open the door and venture into the unknown. You will follow them from start to finish, combating failures and reaching success.

This is where my crazy journey begins. With my dog Jackie by my side and my (first ever) car Paulette, I left Belgium two years ago to go find these women. In every country that I’ve crossed since then, I have met some incredibly strong and inspiring filmmakers; all women, all from different countries and cultures. They all work on independent films and have had their films travel to some of the best festivals in the world. These women have broken stereotypes and demonstrated to the world that filmmaking has no gender. These are the women that inspire me.

In each episode, you will get to follow these women in their daily lives, as they work on their films and do everything in their power to reach success. They are all at different stages of their projects, but they are equally determined. Alongside them, you will discover true diversity of the film industry.

This series is a unique portrait of great women storytellers. The world needs more stories told by women and it needs a more diverse representation of the world.

This is the story of contemporary women.

 

- With The Great Journey, I want to inspire YOU by showing that it is possible to pursue your dreams, regardless of your gender or ethnicity. I believe it’s important to represent people from all around the world. Today we see more and more western countries closing their borders on people, with The Great Journey I want to open those borders, to invite you to a range of different countries where filmmakers operate.

- We need more female role models. In this age of social media, we only see happiness, beauty, and accomplishments. But what about failures? For me, having a real role model means looking up to someone who doesn’t put on a façade. The women in this film have all struggled and pulled through. You will find some incredible women to look up to.

- We don’t have enough representation of women in film. Even though films are everywhere and such a huge part of humankind, there are very few women who get recognized for their work in this industry. This film is an opportunity to explore the diversity of filmmakers.

- The Great Journey lets you dive into different cultures and see different societies from the point of view of strong women.

 

The filmmakers have been selected by the following criteria:

  • they must be women

  • they must be making independent film

  • they have been competing in main international film festivals

Each filmmaker is well-known, nationally or internationally. As of now, we’ve met and shot 5 (including Coco) of the filmmakers, and there are two remaining in China and India.

Here are the different heroines of The Great Journey:

 

The Great Journey is half-way done. But only with the support of your donations, I will be able to film the two last characters in China and India and complete my journey.

I truly believe that the world needs more stories told by women and this is why I feel it is necessary to finish this story. By donating you will also contribute towards a deeper cultural understanding of circumstances and prerequisites. And you will help me prove that it is possible to follow your dream!

By joining our campaign, you will be contributing to giving a bigger voice to female filmmakers in the world, as well as helping independent filmmaking by bringing meaningful stories to the big screen. Let’s do it together!

 

Supporting The Great Journey is a beautiful way to support female filmmakers from around the world.

 

 

If we are able to go that far, I would be extremely grateful, but that mean I have enough money to make the best documentary I can and I will be able to bring you the stories of those women filmmakers. You will have a direct impact of changing our society by giving a more positive image of women’s today. 

 

I TRULY appreciate any amount of contribution and every single euro will be of big help to me. But if you absolutely can’t give money, there are of course other ways you can help.

SHARE our campaign link to your friends and family

LIKE us on Facebook and Instagram

FOLLOW us on Twitter

SUBSCRIBE to our Youtube channel

Official hashtag: #thegreatjourney #cocojackie

 

Making an independent documentary film in such a big scale and with a tiny crew sure isn’t easy. So far, I’ve managed to film in 5 countries, and thus proved to myself that I am able to work in hard conditions with high levels of stress and instability. But a lack of money presents a much bigger risk and it will reduce the efficiency of my work. I need to travel by car to both China and India where my two remaining characters are. I am not able to do this without money.

I can ensure you that your contribution will be used as presented in the budget. Any extra money will go directly to first try and reach the optimal budget, and then the postproduction of the film.

This is only possible with your help. If you put your faith in this film, I promise I won't let you down.

In this age of social media, we only see happiness, beauty, and accomplishments. But what about failures? For me, having a real role model means looking up to someone who doesn’t put on a façade. The women in this film have all struggled and pulled through. You will find some incredible women to look up to.- We don’t have enough representation of women in film. Even though films are everywhere and such a huge part of humankind, there are very few women who get recognized for their work in this industry. This film is an opportunity to explore the diversity of filmmakers.- The Great Journey lets you dive into different cultures and see different societies from the point of view of strong women. The filmmakers have been selected by the following criteria:
they must be women
they must be making independent film
they have been competing in main international film festivals
Each filmmaker is well-known, nationally or internationally. As of now, we’ve met and shot 5 (including Coco) of the filmmakers, and there are two remaining in China and India.Here are the different heroines of The Great Journey: The Great Journey is half-way done. But only with the support of your donations, I will be able to film the two last characters in China and India and complete my journey.I truly believe that the world needs more stories told by women and this is why I feel it is necessary to finish this story. By donating you will also contribute towards a deeper cultural understanding of circumstances and prerequisites. And you will help me prove that it is possible to follow your dream!By joining our campaign, you will be contributing to giving a bigger voice to female filmmakers in the world, as well as helping independent filmmaking by bringing meaningful stories to the big screen. Let’s do it together! Supporting The Great Journey is a beautiful way to support female filmmakers from around the world.  If we are able to go that far, I would be extremely grateful, but that mean I have enough money to make the best documentary I can and I will be able to bring you the stories of those women filmmakers. You will have a direct impact of changing our society by giving a more positive image of women’s today.  I TRULY appreciate any amount of contribution and every single euro will be of big help to me. But if you absolutely can’t give money, there are of course other ways you can help.SHARE our campaign link to your friends and familyLIKE us on Facebook and InstagramFOLLOW us on TwitterSUBSCRIBE to our Youtube channelOfficial hashtag: #thegreatjourney #cocojackie Making an independent documentary film in such a big scale and with a tiny crew sure isn’t easy. So far, I’ve managed to film in 5 countries, and thus proved to myself that I am able to work in hard conditions with high levels of stress and instability. But a lack of money presents a much bigger risk and it will reduce the efficiency of my work. I need to travel by car to both China and India where my two remaining characters are. I am not able to do this without money.I can ensure you that your contribution will be used as presented in the budget. Any extra money will go directly to first try and reach the optimal budget, and then the postproduction of the film.This is only possible with your help. If you put your faith in this film, I promise I won't let you down.

story:
The Story

Cardboard Dreams is an original screenplay written by Tucker Hampson, based on his childhood experiences and memories with his father.

In this Sci-fi/Fantasy, Neil Manning (not Armstrong,  but that's the idea) builds his space-obsessed son, Timmy, a cardboard spaceship. While Timmy enjoys  his new toy immensely, Neil becomes curious of his son's make believe after Timmy produces a space rock from his travels. Neil investigates, even going so far as to get inside the cardboard spaceship and press a few buttons.

To his surprise, the cardboard rumbles to life and blasts off from earth. Neil passes out in his terror, and wakes up in a still and quiet cardboard box. When he emerges, he finds himself on an unknown planet. Awestruck, Neil explores and finds an identical rock to the one Timmy had.

Neil quickly returns home and calls NASA with his findings, but when a NASA representative arrives, Neil discovers  that Timmy has torn up the cardboard ship, leaving nothing to prove the miraculous trip besides the pair of space rocks. 

 

About the Crew

 

Writer & Director

Tucker Hampson

Tucker Hampson is an aspiring science fiction writer, director, and editor, as well as a current graduate student at the University of Southern California School of Cinematic Arts. He got his Bachelors in English Creative Writing from The Colorado College and has since worked professionally in film with Rocky Mountain PBS and as the Executive Producer of his own film production company, Tucker Hampson Productions. He has also published a science fiction novel, Resonance. Tucker grew up with a love of storytelling, especially science fiction, and strives to create powerful, emotional films without massive hollywood budgets or special effects.

 

Producer & Editor

Karina Gomez

Karina graduated from UC Berkeley with a Bachelor’s degree in English and a minor in Performing Arts. She worked in bay area theater (SF Playhouse, Berkeley Rep, California Shakespeare Theater, etc) as an actor and took on work as a dramaturgy, writer and production assistant before making the leap to Los Angeles for film. Currently, she’s working towards her MFA in Film and Television Production at USC. 

 

Cinematographer & Production Designer

Melanie Lim

Melanie emigrated from Manila, Philippines to Los Angeles, CA to pursue a career in film and television. As a first generation immigrant, she hopes to bring the American audience a fresh take on Filipino culture. Her short film, Anito, won a screenwriting grant from 2017 Cinematografo Originals contest and recently screened at the 2018 Los Angeles Asian Pacific Film Festival. She's currently working on her masters in Film Production at the University of Southern California. 

 

What We Need

Science Fiction and Fantasy films are generally prohibitively expensive and difficult to create, especially for student filmmakers. The hope is to blend a low budget, do-it-yourself mentality and skills with creative techniques to create an authentic and powerful science fiction film without spending tens of thousands of dollars on production.

$1,250 is the allotted budget for this film to be successful. Much of this will be used to secure a location, a beach or desert, that will look like another planet. This is absolutely essential to create the illusion of the film.

Another costly part of the film is being able to work with a child actor, which requires a studio teacher on set at all times. The other smaller chunk will be used for character costumes and props, and set design to make the cardboard box come alive as much as possible.

The final expense is to feed and transport the crew and cast, who will be working for no pay and deserve to be treated as professionally as possible. 

ANY amount of money helps, even if we don't reach our goal! The more we receive, the better the film will be!

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you can't contribute but value the project, please tell others about it by sharing it! Facebook, Twitter, etc. and word of mouth are great ways to help.

story:
Hi, I’m Elizabeth Sampson, I’m the writer and Scott Alan Smith is the director of this short film. We have both been making theatre together for over 30 years and been acting in television and film since 1991. I’ve been writing plays since 1996. We are making a short film based on one of my full length plays about a cottage on a lake in upstate Michigan. All the contributors to this project will be entirely responsible for it getting made. You will all be producers of this film and some of you will get to be in it. 

For those of you at Lakeside, Cottage Grove and Pinewoods – Scott and I were the ones who brought you A Midsummer Night’s Dream in the Dell ten years ago.

We need to raise $20k. This will cover bringing 9 actors and a few crew members from Los Angeles to shoot this short. The cast are all veterans of film and television, some of whom might be quite familiar to you from shows you’ve seen them in. We have some fun perks – look at the list of things you get for donating. We have signed posters, dinner with the cast, I have included scarves and two pieces of jewelry that I make and for those of you who want to be “big producers” you get to be in the film. The money would cover union fees, food, lodging, costumes, rental equipment, airfare and insurance.

Scott and I believe this film is important because it is about love, loss and legacy – things that every family goes through and deals with, and I believe that framing those issues with the beauty of this lake and these woods makes this story potent, poignant and powerful.

As far as risks…the only risk here is that we don’t raise enough funds to finish the project. Although Scott and I have been in many films, this is our first time helming a production and we anticipate making a few mistakes. But that will be part of the fun, sometimes mistakes lead to the most magical solutions beyond what you had initially intentioned, or could have imagined.

Please “Share” our campaign page on social media and to friends and family or anyone who likes movies and would like to be part of making a truly beautiful and powerful one. There are “Share” tools on the Indiegogo page – and thank you so much for being a part of this film!

The Director

Scott Alan Smith holds an MFA in Acting from the prestigious American Conservatory Theatre, renowned for its classical actor training. He serves as the Associate Artistic Director of the award-winning Road Theatre Company and has been the Festival Director of the theater's annual Summer Playwrights Festival (the largest new play staged reading series in the nation) since it began in 2010. At The Road he has directed the critical hit Melissa Arctic by Craig Wright (LA Times Critic's Pick), Sovereign Body (world premiere), That Good Night (world premiere and Ovation Recommended) and Lady by Craig Wright (4 Ovation nominations and 5 LA Weekly Award nominations with 2 wins) Scott also directed New York Mets (ADA nominated) and So Nice to See You (1 Dramalogue award), and The Petoskey Stones. At Pepperdine he has directed Almost, Maine, These Shining Lives, Three Days of Rain, Bus Stop, Proof (with Michael O'Neill), The Roads to Home. Other directing credits include: Bus Stop (at Spokane's Interplayers Theater - People's Choice Award), Tabak (The Met), Lynette at 3AM, Mr. Happiness, A Midsummer Night's Dream, and Elizabeth Sampson's play Bringin' Home the Girl. He has assistant-directed Mother Courage, Light (Theater@Boston Court ) and True West (Deaf West Theater).

Scott is co-author along with Adam Paul of King of the Moon which ran Off-Off Broadway, in Los Angeles at the Groundlings Theater and HBO Workspace. He co-wrote and produced the film version which and was made for FOX Searchlab and premiered at the 2004 Tribeca Film Festival. He directed Ed Harris for the L.A. Philharmonic's 2005 Season Opening Gala at Disney Hall, and Heart...Beat for the Boston Court's Music at the Court series. As an Associate Artist at the New American Theatre he directed The Adding Machine. Scott's lengthy acting career includes The Dinosaur Within (Theatre@Boston Court - Stage Scene L.A. Award), Apollo (Taper Too), Richard III (with Alfred Molina), King of the Moon, Kindertransport, Detachments, The Memorandum, The Water Engine, A Midsummer Night's Dream, and The Rose Tattoo. Scott has also appeared regionally at the Studio Theater, Scena and the Source Theater, as well as in New York at the Present Company where his two-man show, King of the Moon, ran to sold-out houses.

His over 100 appearances in television and film include playing Kate Walsh's therapist on 'Private Practice' appearing in 21 episodes. Other TV credits include the upcoming 'The Catch', ‘Scorpion’, ‘Supergirl, American Horror Story, ‘Switched at Birth’, ‘Scandal’, 'The Fosters', 'State of Affairs' 'Revenge' 'Newsroom' (with Jeff Daniels), 'Rizzoli and Isles', 'Murder in the First', 'Hung', 'CSI: Miami', 'CSI:NY', 'CSI', 'Medium', 'NCIS', 'NCIS:LA', 'Cold Case', 'Without a Trace', 'Next', 'Rules of Engagement', 'Bones', 'Three Rivers', 'True Blood', 'House', 'Chuck', 'The Closer', 'Veronica Mars', 'Big Love', 'Entourage', 'Justice', 'Philly' (recurring), 'NYPD: Blue', 'Boston Legal', 'Six Feet Under', '24', 'JAG', 'Alias', a recurring role as Dr. Jack Gannon on 'The Young and the Restless', and others. Scott's film credits include "A Matter of Faith", "The Curse of Sleeping Beauty", "Stargate", "Mousehunt", "D.C.9/11", "Magnolia", "Déjà Vu", "Bewitched", "The Ring", "X-Files: The Movie", and "Bounce". He is also featured in the documentary, "No Net" about making intimate theater in Los Angeles. Scott trained at Arena Stage and the Studio Theater before earning his MFA from the American Conservatory Theater in San Francisco. He is a member of the Academy of Television Arts and Sciences, SAG-AFTRA, AEA, SDC and the Actor's Studio Playwrights/Directors Unit, and is also a proud alumnus of the Lincoln Center Theater Director's Lab West (Gold Medal Class of '05).

The Writer/Actor

Elizabeth Sampson is an actor, director and playwright. She is a graduate of the M.F.A. program at The American Conservatory Theatre. She teaches Acting at UCLA in their Professional Program and is also an adjunct Professor of acting at Pepperdine University in addition to her private coaching. While at A.C.T. she was asked to join the prestigious resident acting company where she performed in the west coast premiere of 1918, as well as Christmas Carol, and Twelfth Night.  Her NYC credits include Bringing’ Home the Girl (Here Space as co-writer and actor), King of the Moon (Present Company, director). As a Los Angeles based actor she has been seen in Melissa Arctic, That Good Night, As White As O at The Road Theatre Company and in Detachments w/ Glenn Headley at the Loretta Theatre Company. She is a founding company member of A Noise Within where she did The Way of the World. Other L.A. Theater credits include The Memorandum, The Dearest of Friends, Mr. Happiness, A Midsummer Night’s Dream (Ashbury Actor’s Group) and Measure for Measure directed by Tina Packer for the Los Angeles Women’s Shakespeare Company. Elizabeth has also studied and performed at The Studio Theatre in Washington D.C., in 27 Wagons Full of Cotton. Other D.C. credits include, Ten Little Indians, Killing Real Estate Women. Her film and television work includes the films ‘Last Rampage – The Escape of Gary Tison’, ‘Leaving Barstow’, ‘As Easy as Pie’, ‘Battle of the Sexes’ (Sundance), ‘Disfigured’, ‘Modern Vampires’ (w/ Rod Steiger). TV includes ‘Law and Order True Crime’ ‘Aquarius’, ‘Rizzoli and Isles’, ‘Law and Order: Los Angeles’, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’, ‘Private Practice’, ‘Without a Trace’, ‘E.R.’, ‘Boston Legal’, ‘Strong Medicine’, ‘The Unit’, ‘Cold Case’, ‘The Pretender’, ‘Medical Mystery Investigation’ and a long recurring on ‘The Brotherhood of Poland, New Hampshire’. She has been performing her short stories in the heralded Spark Off Rose, Melt In Your Mouth and Tree People spoken word events in Los Angeles for the last 13 years. As a playwright her plays The Petoskey Stones has been performed at The Road Theatre Company and The Bay Theatre Company in Annapolis, MD (chosen for the New Women’s Voices in Theatre Festival Washington DC 2015). Her short play trilogy Irish Coffee was presented in succession at the Road Theatre Company’s Summer Playwrights Festival 2013 with Kathy Baker and Perry King. It Was The Lark 2014 with Michael O’Neill.  The Lighthouse in 2015. In 2016 her festival play Hell Is Empty was performed. As a director she has directed Finish and Trim at the Road Theatre, Spring Dance (Pepperdine University), King of the Moon (The Groundlings) and has worked with playwright Craig Wright on several of his plays including Lady, The Unseen, and Melissa Arctic. She is a member of The Road Theatre Company, AEA and SAG-AFTRA.

story:
The Film

Sean has lived in London for the past few years chasing a career as a rap artist. Reaching his mid-30s, the loss of his girlfriend and a sense that he has failed in his career and his relationships has led him to the point of being ready to take his own life. Days before he plans to end it all, he visits his family in the north of England one last time where they hold an unexpected intervention for him.

 

About Me

My name is Marcus Lee, I'm a filmmaker from Bradford, West Yorkshire. I set up Reel Street Films, a video production company in 2007 with the hope of helping young people by telling engaging stories through drama and documentary. Since its inception I've created short films and feature films about subjects such as family, relationships, marriage, mental health, life and death amongst other topics.

 

The Campaign and It's Importance

This film will be the most personal film I have ever made. I myself have had feelings of depression, anxiety and suicide with the sense of my own life not moving forward like I believed it should have at the time. If you've lived through your 20s/30s and watched your peers do all the things that Western society expects of you (graduate from university, get a high paying job, get married, purchase a big house, have children, drive a nice car) but you haven't done any of those things yourself, a sense of disappointment can rest on you which is partly due to the conventions of society. This film brings all of those pieces together to focus on an individual ready to take his own life, who like many others who feel like this won't show their feelings outwardly; to put it another way, they suffer in silence. 

I feel like a film like this is important because it addresses the pressure that millions of young adults face in a world where the pressures to keep up with technology, look good on social media and fight for success in the workplace and "keep up with the Jones's" in our personal lives are never ending. I believe millions of people will be able to relate to the main character's plight in this film.

So why should you give to this campaign?

Simple answer, your contribution will help to bring this film to life! By supporting this project you will be supporting the creation of a feature length film that will be entered into film festivals across the world, be available to watch online through video on demand and potentially be available in stores should we find a distributor. This is a film with a small budget, but a budget sufficient that we will be able to create a product of great quality and strong production values. It isn't an expensive or flashy project, but it does require financial contributions to make it happen. 

 

The Impact

Often when there is a main character in a film we watch at the cinema or on our televisions, there are often several things we can't relate to about them. They are a superhero, an action hero with an amazing knowledge of science, or a high flying member of society who is going to change the world. This film features an everyday person who we can all relate to, as his issues of mental health and emotional wellbeing are things we all experience. I thoroughly believe the film will have positive ramifications, in terms of creating a dialogue around men, women and suicidal feelings, depression and the importance of the relationships around us.

 

What We Need & What You Get

So how much does this cost?

I've budgeted this project at £9,000. This is filmmaking at its most affordable level. Funds will pay for actors, production staff, equipment, locations and food! I've kept the budget as low as possible to make the project happen. Considering low budget cinema is considered to be for films made around the one million pound mark, this is considerably smaller! The way this is possible is that we are not an overly fancy production with trailers for actors demanding high fees and bowls of only red skittles. A small production team will be in place to make this happen over two to three weeks, but if additional funds are available, we will be able to attract additional production staff to make everything run smoother and faster.

If the funds aren't reached entirely, we will use it to honour people's expenses and travel costs, and pay for the fundamental parts of producing this film. We will try and obtain as many items for production for the lowest possible and most affordable costs possible, whilst not trying to dishonour people's time, talent and willingness to bring the project to life.

So what do you get out of the film as a contributor?

There are several perks to contributing to this project! As well as being part of the team who bring this project to life, there are a few choice items that will sweeten the deal. Depending on the amount you are able to give, you could receive a digital download of a rap music EP, written by the character Sean from his perspective. There is also the option of being able to attend an advance screening of the film, get invited to the official premiere of the film, receive posters of the film, get private digital copies of the film.

 

Risks & Challenges

Let's be honest, people don't always believe in low budget films. Some of them are great, some of them are not so good. There is an element of faith in any project, but I believe the script and storyline is strong enough and there is enough experience behind and in front of the camera that it the quality will shine through. As a filmmaker I have already produced a feature film called IMMENTAL which can be viewed on Amazon Instant Video. I worked as the Producer and Director on this film, which was essentially a black and white murder mystery where the main character accused of a crime was dealing with severe mental health issues.

I've worked previously on low budget productions where the work has to be carried out very quickly. I've worked in video production for 11 years, on projects large and small, often coming across many different obstacles along the way. We will aim to produce the film over a three week period, however we will add additional days if necessary.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that everyone can't contribute financially, but there are other ways you can support us. Do you know of someone who this project might strike a chord with? Could you share it with them? Do you know of business angels or organisations looking to get behind positive projects, especially in relation to mental health? Let them know!

One of the greatest gifts we have in this modern age is social media, so can you retweet us on Twitter? Can you share our posts on Facebook? Can you repost the video on Instagram? Can you at least share the two minute video which explains what the film is about? Can you share this Indiegogo page and help us to get the word out? Each of these things takes a few moments to do, the more people that know about the project, the better.

Thanks in advance!

Marcus Lee

Director, Reel Street Films
story_txt:
The Film
Sean has lived in London for the past few years chasing a career as a rap artist. Reaching his mid-30s, the loss of his girlfriend and a sense that he has failed in his career and his relationships has led him to the point of being ready to take his own life. Days before he plans to end it all, he visits his family in the north of England one last time where they hold an unexpected intervention for him.
 
About Me
My name is Marcus Lee, I'm a filmmaker from Bradford, West Yorkshire. I set up Reel Street Films, a video production company in 2007 with the hope of helping young people by telling engaging stories through drama and documentary. Since its inception I've created short films and feature films about subjects such as family, relationships, marriage, mental health, life and death amongst other topics.
 
The Campaign and It's Importance
This film will be the most personal film I have ever made. I myself have had feelings of depression, anxiety and suicide with the sense of my own life not moving forward like I believed it should have at the time. If you've lived through your 20s/30s and watched your peers do all the things that Western society expects of you (graduate from university, get a high paying job, get married, purchase a big house, have children, drive a nice car) but you haven't done any of those things yourself, a sense of disappointment can rest on you which is partly due to the conventions of society. This film brings all of those pieces together to focus on an individual ready to take his own life, who like many others who feel like this won't show their feelings outwardly; to put it another way, they suffer in silence. 
I feel like a film like this is important because it addresses the pressure that millions of young adults face in a world where the pressures to keep up with technology, look good on social media and fight for success in the workplace and "keep up with the Jones's" in our personal lives are never ending. I believe millions of people will be able to relate to the main character's plight in this film.
So why should you give to this campaign?
Simple answer, your contribution will help to bring this film to life! By supporting this project you will be supporting the creation of a feature length film that will be entered into film festivals across the world, be available to watch online through video on demand and potentially be available in stores should we find a distributor. This is a film with a small budget, but a budget sufficient that we will be able to create a product of great quality and strong production values. It isn't an expensive or flashy project, but it does require financial contributions to make it happen. 
 
The Impact
Often when there is a main character in a film we watch at the cinema or on our televisions, there are often several things we can't relate to about them. They are a superhero, an action hero with an amazing knowledge of science, or a high flying member of society who is going to change the world. This film features an everyday person who we can all relate to, as his issues of mental health and emotional wellbeing are things we all experience. I thoroughly believe the film will have positive ramifications, in terms of creating a dialogue around men, women and suicidal feelings, depression and the importance of the relationships around us.

 
What We Need & What You Get
So how much does this cost?
I've budgeted this project at £9,000. This is filmmaking at its most affordable level. Funds will pay for actors, production staff, equipment, locations and food! I've kept the budget as low as possible to make the project happen. Considering low budget cinema is considered to be for films made around the one million pound mark, this is considerably smaller! The way this is possible is that we are not an overly fancy production with trailers for actors demanding high fees and bowls of only red skittles. A small production team will be in place to make this happen over two to three weeks, but if additional funds are available, we will be able to attract additional production staff to make everything run smoother and faster.
If the funds aren't reached entirely, we will use it to honour people's expenses and travel costs, and pay for the fundamental parts of producing this film. We will try and obtain as many items for production for the lowest possible and most affordable costs possible, whilst not trying to dishonour people's time, talent and willingness to bring the project to life.
So what do you get out of the film as a contributor?
There are several perks to contributing to this project! As well as being part of the team who bring this project to life, there are a few choice items that will sweeten the deal. Depending on the amount you are able to give, you could receive a digital download of a rap music EP, written by the character Sean from his perspective. There is also the option of being able to attend an advance screening of the film, get invited to the official premiere of the film, receive posters of the film, get private digital copies of the film.
 

Risks & Challenges
Let's be honest, people don't always believe in low budget films. Some of them are great, some of them are not so good. There is an element of faith in any project, but I believe the script and storyline is strong enough and there is enough experience behind and in front of the camera that it the quality will shine through. As a filmmaker I have already produced a feature film called IMMENTAL which can be viewed on Amazon Instant Video. I worked as the Producer and Director on this film, which was essentially a black and white murder mystery where the main character accused of a crime was dealing with severe mental health issues.
I've worked previously on low budget productions where the work has to be carried out very quickly. I've worked in video production for 11 years, on projects large and small, often coming across many different obstacles along the way. We will aim to produce the film over a three week period, however we will add additional days if necessary.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that everyone can't contribute financially, but there are other ways you can support us. Do you know of someone who this project might strike a chord with? Could you share it with them? Do you know of business angels or organisations looking to get behind positive projects, especially in relation to mental health? Let them know!
One of the greatest gifts we have in this modern age is social media, so can you retweet us on Twitter? Can you share our posts on Facebook? Can you repost the video on Instagram? Can you at least share the two minute video which explains what the film is about? Can you share this Indiegogo page and help us to get the word out? Each of these things takes a few moments to do, the more people that know about the project, the better.
Thanks in advance!Marcus Lee
Director, Reel Street Films

story:
Short Summary

My name is Cory Rowe and I’m the writer and director of the film “How To Train Your Boyfriend”.  Just the title alone makes you laugh.  I have always enjoyed making people smile, laugh, and be entertained and I feel this is a way that I can share it with the world.

“How To Train Your Boyfriend” came about just as a random thought.  The title is what I came up with first and I thought to myself “How and why would a woman want to train her man?”  And then I thought “Dumb question!”  So I came up with the theme “You can’t teach an old dog new tricks”.

This campaign is important because movies these days are remakes, sequels, and prequels.  This gives an original idea to be put out into the universe for people to see.  We as people strive for entertainment and to escape reality.  What better way than to go see a movie about training your man?

Let’s be realistic though.  Can a man really be changed?  What is it that drives you nuts that he does or doesn’t do?  What needs aren’t being fulfilled?  There are many reasons why men don’t listen or seem like they don’t care.  But those stats aren't what this film is about.  Rather that the questions I ask are more rhetorical.  This film shows how a group of women try to train their men and may succeed.  Or they may fail.  The only way to know for sure is to get the movie made and we need your help with that.

What We Need & What You Get

So the funding we need is to pay for our named talent, remainder of cast, crew, and post-production needs.  We have acquired a well-known song for the dance off sequence in the film which brings out more of the comedy. 

To make the best movie possible, sometimes it takes some money to make.   But we have some pretty neat rewards for you supporters, no matter how little or big you contribute.

If we don’t reach our goal, we still will get the funds of those who have contributed and we will be making the film the best we can at that point.  So in advance, thank you!

The Impact

The impact you have by contributing is huge.  Every dollar earned is one dollar towards our goal.  It means so much to us that you are contributing to our film and to help make it be the best film possible.  I believe when people see this film at festivals.  This film will be sent to festivals across the US.  If all goes well with the short, then next step will be to make it into a feature length film. 

Risks & Challenges

Every film has risks and challenges.  I have a great team that support the idea, the film, and each other.  We anticipate there are going to be some struggles, but with the funds we obtain, we can ensure that we will get done what we need to get done.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not able to contribute, please don’t hesitate to share the link to the IndieGoGo page.  Every share is equivalent to a contribution.  Make some noise with this film.  Spread the word.  Share our IMDB page.  If you are able to send us proof that you have shared the page and obtain 15 LIKES, then we will give you a Special Thank You at the End Credits.

story:
What is Twins?

Twins is a narrative feature-film that explores the themes of false convictions, exoneration, and various other societal ills that we are currently facing. 

Snoop Robinson is an award-winning writer, director, producer and actor. After working on a project regarding an individual that had been exonerated, Snoop felt the urge to share a similar story in a narrative form. He assembled a writing team which included Calvin J Walker, Demarcus Bailey, and himself. The goal was to create a story that would enlighten and help to start a conversation around the effectiveness of our justice system. The result is a beautiful script that allows you to see what happens when people are denied their rights. It is harrowing film about a justice system that uses people like pawns on a chess board. It is a story that must be told and we need your help to do it. 

The Team 

Snoop Robinson (Creator, Writer, Producer)

Snoop Robinson has pierced the veil of notoriety as a director and creator of short films with his most recent film “Her Eyez,” received the 2015 Excellence Award of Best Film of the Year. Snoop has proven his acumen in both comedic and dramatic roles which is giving him a great platform to work with other moguls in the industry. Snoop is currently at the helm of the entertainment industry with “Bold Evil Liar”, ” Snoop Robinson Sinful Confessions”, “Racial Conscience” and She’s Not Our Sister the stage play launched him the opportunity to showcase his films on The Gospel Music Channel. Additionally, SNOS was the top rated show in GMC network history at the time, which Snoop is constantly developing concepts, scripts and stage setting to bring multiple talents and vibrant work ethic to the entertainment industry.

Calvin Walker (Writer) 

Calvin J. Walker is a filmmaker based in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area.

Calvin formed his production company, Watchmen Media Productions, in 2009. Since it's inception, he's produced  nearly 20 projects - short films and webseries. In addition, he's written for producers in Atlanta, California, and Denmark. He's praised for his visual writing style and uncanny humanization of "villains." Calvin has won several awards for his short films.

 

J.F. Bailey (Writer)

In August 2007 J.F. Bailey productions was created. Seeing the need to bring passion, honor, and integrity to the stage Demarcus Bailey reacted swiftly. Taking a love for sitcoms, comedy and ministry, standing out has been no challenge. In honor of the late James. F Bailey, this production company is not only successful in bringing laughter to many, but the importance of restoration, reconciliation, and the awareness of helping others through powerful pieces. J.F Bailey Productions not only encourages healing through laughter, conversation and giving back, it is safe to say planting seeds though charitable organizations is half of their outstanding work. The debut of “The Prodigal Son” in 2009 sparked a movement that would continue to grow. Gaining so much momentum, hits such as “Ain’t Nothing Like Family”, and “A Women’s Pride” J.F bailey caught the attention of many. Acquiring a jaw dropping following the first film “Love and Drugs” was completed in 2018. As a graduate from Robert E. Lee high school in Tyler, Tx Demarcus was humbled by the opportunity to take his hit play “One Mama” to Washington, D.C; and it doesn’t stop there. Getting the attention of the elite is rare, yet J.F bailey has had the honor of working with Tank, Lyfe, Pooch Hall, Columbus Short, Kelley Price, Keith Robinson, and Jagged Edge, just to name a few. When you here the name J.F. Bailey, it is so much more than productions, it is the literal representation of good will, good faith, and good works. Having a reputation that precedes an introduction is an accomplishment one can only hope for.  With so much accomplished, this is still only the beginning. With many thanks to Tyler. Tx, the staff, Cast, and crew the legacy of J.F. Bailey Productions is far from finished. Through dedication, and integrity this company truly embodies, anything is possible. Stay connected to see what’s in store from J.F Bailey Productions.

Andromeda Jones (Producer)

Andromeda Jones is a Georgia native and relocated to Dallas, TX in 2009. Her acting career began as a child and has continued to present day. She can be seen on HGTV’s “Texas Flip and Move” and ABC’s “False Profits.” She has also appeared in numerous stage plays such as “Leaving You For Me,” “Love, Lies, and Friendship,” “Sex Changes,” and “57 Years” among many others. Her film career includes “BEL,” “57,” “Deacon Brown’s Daughters” and  “Deceptions of Love,” to name a few.

 After becoming pregnant with her second child, she decided that while her acting career may be on hold for a few months, she still needed to remain active on the production side.  This began her career as a Stage Manager and Production Assistant. She has worked on productions such as the Stage Plays “I deserve your Husband,” “Frienemies,” and “You Can’t Raise A Man,” to name a few. She has also worked on the Web Series “Racial Conscious” and the film “Stolen Virginity.”

Among her many talents, hairstyling is her greatest gift. In 2017 she was awarded the “Church Stars Award” for “Best Hair and Makeup” in a Stage play. She has worked with several celebrity clients and makes it a point to educate every client that sits in her chair and provide them with stellar customer service. She has also worked on several productions as lead hairstylist including Fred Hammond’s “The Choir” and the stage play “I Deserve your Husband” and the nationally touring stage play “One Mama,” and many others.

Rayanna S Walker (Producer)

Rayanna S Walker is an artist based out of the DFW Metroplex. Rayanna has worked for Watchmen Media Productions for over 8 years where she has assisted with films, stage, other productions. She has been apart of the arts since she was a young child. She has a passion for film, music, dance, and seeing lives changed for the better. Finally, she is an advocate for those in need, disabled, and mishandled by broken systems.

What We Need & What You Get

Films cost money. 

We're seeking to raise $100,000 in order to complete this project. We've provided an abbreviated list below that explains what those funds will be going to:

   - Cast 

   - Crew

   - Locations 

   - Equipment 

   - Permits 

   - Food

   - Insurance 

   - Travel and lodging 

   - Post-Production  (Editing, Color Grading, Composing) 

In return for your generous donation, we've got several cool perks that include walk-on roles in the film, producer credits, and cool autographed film swag. 

The Impact

We are in a moment where prison reform and sentence reform are a hot topic. While several documentaries have been put out in the past few years, we've not seen very many narrative films that speak to this extremely important topic. Art will always be an amazing vehicle used to get a message to the masses. 

It is important that people understand how detrimental a false conviction is to the life of the person and their family. In addition, it is hurtful to the family of the victim. For many, a conviction is the closing of a very painful chapter. If the conviction is not true, the system has done a disservice to the family that it was serving as well. 

As we stated before, we pray this starts a conversation in our communities. 

Risks & Challenges

There are several challenges that come with filmmaking. The biggest of which is usually weather. There's, also, last minute cast swaps. Locations that have been secured for months might slip through your fingers hours before you are supposed to shoot. All kinds of crazy things happen when you are trying to create. However, our team is comprised of individuals that have a collective twenty years of experience in between them. We know how to turn a mishap into magic without breaking a sweat. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with your friends, family and your social media circle. Let's help get the word out about "Twins." Also, if you have a blog, vlog, or radio show, please reach out. We'd love to speak to your outlet about our project.

story:
IL FILM
Questo progetto nasce dal forte desiderio di raccontare il rapporto più profondo che si possa instaurare nella vita di chiunque. L’idea invece, vuole ricercare la concezione più sbagliata di esso. Giulio necessita l’affetto di una madre che non è presente. Agnese, ricerca sé stessa, nei pensieri e nelle azioni, che non sono mai rivolte al figlio.

NUAGES FILMS
Francesco Alessandro Cogliati (sceneggiatore e regista) e Federica Sosso (produttrice esecutiva) iniziano a lavorare insieme a Santa Fe, New Mexico (US) realizzando nel 2016 l’opera prima “Soledad”, che ha di recente ottenuto la selezione ufficiale al Los Angeles CineFest.
Nasce così “Nuages Films”.

IL REGISTA
Francesco Alessandro Cogliati nasce a Desio nel 1995. È laureando in Media Design e Arti Multimediali presso la NABA- Nuova Accademia di Belle Arti di Milano.
Inizia a scrivere già durante le scuole superiori, decide poi di unire questa passione a quella del cinema.

IL CAST
Fabrizia Sacchi è stata nominata al David di Donatello e ai Nastri d'Argento come miglior attrice non protagonista per "Viaggio sola" di Maria Sole Tognazzi.
E’ anche nel cast, tra tanti altri titoli, di "La prima cosa bella" di Paolo Virzì e sempre al fianco di grandi registi di cinema e teatro.
Luigi Fedele studia presso l’Accademia Nazionale d'Arte Drammatica Silvio D’Amico.
Nel 2016 interpreta il ruolo di Ferro in “Piuma” diretto da Roan Johnson e selezionato in concorso alla 73ª Mostra internazionale d'arte cinematografica di Venezia.

IL TUO AIUTO
Il tuo contributo è importante!
Ci permetterà di coprire alcune spese di produzione e post-produzione, raggiungendo così la qualità a cui aspiriamo.
Per ringraziarti riceverai una speciale ricompensa.

---

THE MOVIE
This project comes from the strong desire to deal with the deepest relationship you can have in your life: the one with the mother. The idea is to explore the most complicated part of this relationship. Giulio needs his mother's love, but she is not there for him. Agnese tries to know herself better, through both her thoughts and actions, that do not involve her son.

NUAGES FILMS
Francesco Alessandro Cogliati (screenwriter and director) and Federica Sosso (executive producer) start working together in Santa Fe, New Mexico (US), in 2016 they realize their first short movie “Soledad”, officially selected at the Los Angeles CineFest.

THE DIRECTOR
Francesco Alessandro Cogliati was born in Desio in 1995. He is graduating in Media Design and Multimedia at NABA- New Academy of Fine Arts in Milan.
He starts writing in high school, then decides to use this one together with his passion for movies.

CAST
Fabrizia Sacchi  has been nominated to the David di Donatello award and Nastri d'Argento as best supporting actress for "Viaggio sola" (A Five Star Life) by Maria Sole Tognazzi.
She also worked in “La prima cosa bella” (First Beautiful Thing) by Paolo Virzì and she always works with talented movie and theater directors.
Luigi Fedele  currently studies at Accademia Nazionale d'Arte Drammatica Silvio D’Amico.
In 2016 he plays “Ferro” in “Piuma” directed by Roan Johnson. The movie has been selected at the 73rd edition of “Mostra internazionale d'arte cinematografica di Venezia”.

YOUR HELP
Your donation is important!
That will let us cover some production costs and we will reach the quality goals we aim to.
You will recevie a special perk to thank you.
That’s how we will use the funds:

 

 

CREW

AGNESE Fabrizia Sacchi
GIULIO Luigi Fedele

with
Milutin Dapcevic
Alessadro Dinuzzi

---

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER Federica Sosso
ASSISTANT PRODUCER Sofia Atzori
DIRECTOR/SCREENWRITER Francesco Alessandro Cogliati
1st AD Stefano Brunati
DOP Angelo Gatti
GAFFER Riccardo Panzeri
GRIP Barbara De Lazzari
1st CAMERA ASSISTANT Giacomo Pandiani
2nd CAMERA ASSISTANT Davide Morabito
SOUNDTRACK/ SOUND OPERATOR Marco Monti
PRODUCTION DESIGNERS Alessia Donnini/Caterina Berta
COSTUME DESIGNER Ilaria De Lorenzi
MAKE UP ARTIST Amanda Campana
DATA MANAGER Filippo Carletti
BACKSTAGE Elena Chiechio

story:
About Grimshaw and Our Campaign

Logline: Two men...one battling addiction, the other his past, mend their broken relationship over a game of chess.

Grimshaw: A device found in chess in which two black pieces arriving on a particular square mutually interfere with each other.

  • Writer's Note: "Growing up without a father isn't easy. And sometimes there's even shame around it because no one was there to teach you how to be a man. See, my dad passed away when I was five because of his alcohol and drug addiction. It took me a long time to realize his actions weren't personal. And once I had that understanding, I was able to heal. To all the people dealing with someone close to you who is enslaved by their vices, remember that it's not your fault. You can't change someone but you can change how you react to them. My hope is that everyone who's gone through something similar, will get to see this film and have a chance to heal, as well." 

  • Our writer, producer and lead actor, Cottrell Guidry, has written for companies such as Funny or Die, The Aids Healthcare Foundation and Maker Studios.  He's appeared on shows such as Powerless (NBC) and in Films such as See you on the other side.  In creating Grimshaw, Cottrell's main goal was to make a film that was honest, vulnerable and in moments, hard to watch.  Grimshaw is his first Dramatic Narrative. 

  • We are reaching out to our followers, fans, indie film supporters, movie goers and people who can relate to the film to support us.

  • Every dollar helps get us closer to finishing the project. We are currently in post-production. The funds for the campaign will be used to pay our crew and talent (who worked on deferment to get it completed as soon as possible), post production (editing, color correction/grading and sound),  for festivals, expenses to festivals, marketing materials (posters, postcards). 
  • Our campaign manager/executive producer has had multiple films funded, completed with a majority of them becoming award winning films.
  • Our team is lead by incredibly talented people in the film industry with a wealth of credits to help market this film to the most sought after festivals.
  • We appreciate all gestures and contributions whether you give $5 to $10,000+. 

 

The Impact We Make...

The success of this film not only brings recognition to filmmakers but it also brings assistance and support to a non profit called ENGAGE THE VISION. They are a group of young professionals that mentor young boys ages 8-11, at Martin Luther King Elementary School in south central LA. 10% of all contributions received will go directly to ETV. 

 

Work With Us...

We get to finish the film in post production, submit to festivals and gain exposure and marketing funds:

  • We need 28K to meet our goal to finish in post-production (cover editing, post-sound mix, VFX, ADR), market the film in festivals (festival fees, marketing costs for festivals including DCP's, blu-rays, brochures and much more) and paying our talent and crew that were gracious enough to deferred their payment until the funds are raised from this campaign.

Great Perks

  • We are offering some amazing perks from signed posters to meeting the cast at their private screening, dinner with our lead actor Cottrell Guidry and director Elyes Gabel (from the hit show Scorpion) at the incredible SOHO House West Hollywood!

    Risks & Challenges

    Everyone involved in the making of this film put their blood, sweat and tears into this project.  And the reason for that is because they all felt passionate about making sure that this story was seen.  Let's celebrate them by making sure they are all compensated for their hard work and love. 

    • Credit cards were maxed out. Crew spent 12 to 14 hour days on set to get this project done. Emotions ran high...but we were all able to come together to make sure that every single scene from this script was shot. 
    • $28,000 isn't a walk in the park to raise but we feel strongly enough, that this happen.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    All contributions and support are welcome whether it be a sacrifice of your coffee for the day or merely to share our campaign with others, we appreciate you greatly:

    • Please share our campaign and get the word around!
    • Just click on the easy icon share buttons to create more exposure for Grimshaw!
    • We will be having an incentives contest as well so start referring (make sure to be signed in to make your referral count)

    Meet some of our key team members:

    Our Producers:

    • Elyes Gabel - Game of Thrones, Interstellar, Scorpion CBS
    • Cottrell Guidry - Powerless NBC, The Audition Funny or Die
    • Christian Adkins- Blackish
    • Co-Producer  -  Sonari Jo- Modern Family

    Executive Producers: KrisD Mauga & Evan Arnold

    Writer:

    Cottrell Guidry- Funny or Die presents: the Audition, Funny or Die presents: Black and Jewish, Breaking the Record Maker Studios

    Director:

    Elyes Gabel- Scorpion CBS, Game of Thrones HBO, Interstellar

    Lead Actors:

    Cottrell Guidry- Powerless NBC, The Auditon Funny or Die

    Cornell Womack- Rescue Me FX, On Golden Pond {Broadway}, Talk Radio {Broadway}

    Jonathan Kowalsky- Justified FX, True Blood HBO

Cottrell Guidry - Powerless NBC, The Audition Funny or Die

Christian Adkins- Blackish


Co-Producer  -  Sonari Jo- Modern Family
