story:
The Story

UberLand is a feature length documentary film that pulls back the curtain on the labor issues surrounding Uber and the gig economy. It’s the story of a scandal-ridden startup that upended transportation, defied regulators, decimated the taxi industry and ended up cannibalizing its own drivers. The film follows San Francisco Uber drivers Eric, Robin, Antonio and Xavier as these independent contractors navigate the gig economy where many workers have meager earnings and few labor protections. UberLand features interviews with workers and Silicon Valley thought leaders and asks us to consider the true cost of taking an Uber.

The Main Character

Eric grew up in a working class neighborhood in Richmond and began driving for Uber in 2015. Having worked full-time as an independent contractor for a number of tech startups, Eric knows all too well what it’s like to make a living in the gig economy. When he’s not behind the wheel, you can find Eric spending time in the East Bay with his wife and four children.

The Director

Nick St. Charles was born and raised in Silicon Valley. Before directing UberLand, he worked as a Producer and News Writer at CBS Radio where he helped organize a campaign to unionize employees with the support of the Screen Actors Guild and the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists. His work has also aired on KPFA and FSRN. When he doesn’t have his finger on the record button, you can find Nick exploring the Bay Area on his bike.

The Impact

The number of people working as independent contractors in the gig economy is growing. By contributing to UberLand, you're putting a spotlight on the pitfalls of gig work and helping raise awareness about the need for reform.

The Cost

UberLand is currently in post-production but we've run out of money to finish the film. With your generous support, we'll be able to raise the $20,000 needed to take this film across the finish line. Here's how your contribution will be spent:

  • 25% Editing & Graphics
  • 25% Audio Post-Production
  • 25% Color Correction
  • 10% Marketing
  • 7% Licensing Fees
  • 8% Indiegogo Fees

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about this film and our Indiegogo campaign by sharing it on social media: uberlandfilm.com

story:
The Story

     Kingsnake is a southern gothic story about a woman, Anna, who was forced into prostitution by Kingsnake, the local hustler. Years after her escape, Anna has returned to enforce her judgement.  

The Team

Director 

     Jon Mark Nail has been directing films for over ten years. He is most known for his feature film Eyes of the Roshi starring Academy Award Nominee, Eric Roberts. His most recent short film, Anne Marie After The Party, is currently running the film festival circuit.

Cinematographer/Producer

     Leonard P Walsh II has been living and working in Los Angeles since 2012 as a 1st Assistant Cameraman on Commercials, TV, Features and Music Videos. He is transitioning to full-time Cinematographer. Leonard and Jon Mark have been working together since film school. He was the Cinematographer and Producer of their last short film, Anne Marie After The Party.

The Money

Fundraising Goal

Our goal is $15,000. This is the lowest budget we will be able to make this project for. If our goal is not met the money will be held by our production company in hopes to raise further funds for Kingsnake or be used on future film projects. 

Budget

  • We are very excited to be shooting our project on Super 16mm film. The film, processing, and scanning will account for 1/3 of our budget. 
  • Talent. Our actors will be working on deferred pay but once the project has been finished and played at festivals we want to make the film available to the public. In order for us to do that we will need to pay our wonderful Talent first.
  • In order for us to rent camera and lighting equipment we will need Production Insurance. 
  • Camera, Lighting and Grip equipment. The camera will come from Los Angeles. The rest will be from local vendors.
  • Professional Crew. We need to pay our hard working crew for their skills.
  • Catering and Craft Services. Everybody loves to eat!
  • Post Production will consist of Editing, Color Correction, Post Sound and Original Music.
  • Finally...FILM FESTIVALS! We will be submitting the finished film to dozens of festivals around the world. Unfortunately submissions are not free. 

Challenges

    Our biggest challenge will be raising funds. If you are able to support us then we can't thank you enough. If you are unable to support us with funds, there is another way to help. TELL EVERYONE about our project here on Indiegogo.

Previous Work

 

  • Anne Marie After The Party - Official Trailer

 

  • Cinematography Reel - Leonard P. Walsh II

story:
PLOT

Remus and Ron tells the story of how Remus a 35-year-old eccentric and awkward man ended up in the back of a police car arrested for murder. He looks back on his childhood and reminisces on how he turned out so different from his identical twin brother Ron, despite being inflicted the same bizarre and abusive upbringing.  Exploring themes of nurture vs nature and twisting the stereotypes of a conventional serial thriller, Remus and Ron is a dark and disturbing look at how one twin could be so evil and the other so caring.

STYLE

Remus and Ron is currently being pitched as a mix of Taxi Driver, Dead Ringers, and Mindhunter. The influence of David Fincher’s Mindhunter is not just evident in the story’s exploration of psychopaths but also in the cinematography and directing style. The dark contrasty look of Fincher’s TV and films, plus his smooth cinematic camera style, and precise performances are a massive influence on this film. 

Any filmmakers planning to make a twin film need to study David Cronenberg’s masterpiece Dead Ringers featuring the duel performance by Jeremy Irons. And the filmmakers of Remus and Ron have deeply studied it and it’s making of and will be using similar split screen techniques to bring our multiple duel-performances film to life.

There is no movie out there that has succeeded better than Martin Scorsese’s Taxi Driver at immersing the audience into the head of a character. Using similar voice-over, slow-paced editing, sound design, and scoring techniques as (one of the director’s favourite films) Taxi Driver that is exactly what we aim to achieve with Remus and Ron.

WHY MAKE THE FILM:

Not only is this a great opportunity for the cast to show off their acting skills by acting opposite themselves on screen, this short will also be a big step up in the crew’s future career as feature filmmakers. Despite having multiple award winning short film credits the crew are currently in a grey zone of too inexperienced to receive Government funding but without funding can’t gain that needed experience. This is also an opportunity for the crew to explore a darker side of their story telling skills, something the writer/director in particular has been itching to do. 

BUDGET BREAKDOWN:

BY DEPARTMENT:
Production Design - $3,500
Camera & Lighting - $5,000
Locations - $2,600
Management & Unit - $1,300
Crew Fees - $600
Total: $13,000

Print & Advertising budget: $2000

Complete budget - $15,000


CAST:

WILL KELLY - Adult Remus/Ron

Bio: Will has over 15 years’ experience in Theatre, Film and Television. He has won numerous awards for both acting and producing. Theatre credits include: RENT, Jesus Christ Superstar and Jekyll and Hyde: The Musical alongside Australian Musical legend Rob Guest. Film and television credits include Hoges: the Paul Hogan Story for Channel 7 as well as many award winning short films that have screened at film festivals around the world including The Insect & the Alien, SHAKES and SEASON. He has starred alongside Guy Edmonds (A Very Moody Christmas), Luke Cosgrove (Stephen King's The Mist) and Christopher Sommers (HARROW, The Bureau of Magical Things).

Statement: Every experience is relative. I was drawn to the challenge of playing twins who experience the same life events but interpret them in completely different ways, and how that drives their very different responses. Both believing they see the experience of their childhood as it truly happened as opposed to simply seeing it through their relative interpretation.

CURTIS HENDRICKX - Child Remus/Ron

Bio: Curtis Hendrickx is a young Brisbane actor on the rise. He has appeared in numerous short films and music videos, as well as adverts for Hallmark Homes and Vuly Trampolines. He was recently one of the featured artists in the RACQ Banks print and TV commercials and was also cast as a lead actor in a new coming of age feature film shot on the Gold Coast and due for release in November 2018. He is now excitedly preparing for the challenging role of twins in the upcoming short film Remus and Ron.

Statement: Curtis states that his goal is to show the diversity of his acting ability in being able to pull off being two characters that are identical in looks but have character traits that are miles apart.

“My inspiration for this role is from personal experience, observing friends, and the great script that I've read with the surprising twist in it. I want to portray the emotion that is so well written in the young characters, to justify the actions for the older characters behaviour.  I am looking forward to working with Branden and his professional team on this production and thank him for this amazing opportunity.”

MICHAEL CUCKSON - Constable Henry Belcalf 

Bio: Michael Cuckson is an Australian actor and voice over artist. For the past 10 years he has worked extensively as an actor for stage and screen, a voice over artist and presenter. His television credits include Sea Patrol, Secrets and Lies and the tele-movie Fatal Honeymoon. Last year he was involved in the shorts The Undoing of Kate Burchell and Freudenstein. He is excited to join Remus & Ron as Constable Henry Belcalf. 

MARIKA MAROSSZEKY - Mrs Wellington, Remus and Ron's Mother

Bio: Marika Marosszeky is a Canadian/Australian actress based in Queensland.  Since completing her acting program at the University of Toronto, she has performed both in various Canadian and Australian theatre/tv/film productions.  Notable performances include playing Juliet in Classical Theatre Project’s ‘Romeo and Juliet’ in Toronto, and playing Sheila in award winning Australian short film ‘The Bus Knight’.  She most recently performed in a staged reading of ‘Savage in Limbo’ by John Patrick Shanley (Linda Rotunda) in Brisbane’s ‘The Lucky Duck’, which will also be playing in early 2019.  She also plays Shaz in ‘Smoko’, a new television series currently featured online.  Marika is also thrilled to have recently joined the teaching team at The fACTORy Acting Studio in Brisbane’s West End.

Statement: Playing the role of Mrs. Wellington comes as a welcome challenge to Marika.  Although Mrs. Wellington’s behavior is abusive and abhorrent, Marika sees her as a lost soul who has never been able to recover from her deeply wounding childhood scars.  She aims to approach the role with compassion, to find the humanity of Mrs. Wellington.

CREW:

Branden Wittchen - Writer/director

Bio: Branden graduated from Griffith Film School in 2017 and his career since has mostly consisted of directing music videos for such clients as Tia Gostelow (Triple J Unearthed High and Qld Music Award Winner) and Ian 'Dicko' Dickson (Australian Idol). He is also a multi-award winning filmmaker who wrote and directed short films starring renowned Australian character actors Gyton Grantley (The Dressmaker, Underbelly, House Husbands) and Roy Billing (Jack Irish, The Dish, Underbelly). 

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8471561/

Matt Haslam – Producer

Bio: Matt is a Brisbane based producer and recent graduate of Griffith Film School, working on short form content including short films and music videos. His work includes Lost Tapes (2016), Ascension (2017), The Undoing of Kate Burchell (2017) and Little Dead Bird (2018) which are all currently screening around Australia and internationally. Having worked with Branden, Elliott, Sian and many other members of the crew on previous productions, Matt is keen to create something darker and more twisted with them.

Statement: After the larger scale production of Ascension, which included road closures, phone booths filled with water and stunt work on the side of a bridge, I'm very excited to work on something smaller, more intimate. Being a twin myself, this project really pulled me in, and the ability to explore the darker side of childhood really appealed to me. 
 

Elliott Deem – Director of Photography


Bio: Elliott’s career has consisted of crew roles in the camera department for Hollywood films shot in Australia such as Pacific Rim: Uprising, and local productions including Occupation and Swinging Safari. He has also served as cinematographer on a number of short films and music videos. In his final year at Griffith Film School in 2017, Elliott was nominated for best cinematography for The Undoing of Kate Burchell, which also received ‘Best Film’ at the GFS Awards in 2017.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8519293/

Luke Angelo-Roberts – Editor

Bio: Luke and (writer/director) Branden have had a close relationship since they met at film school and started a production company together. During that time Luke served as editor and co-director on a number of their short films and music videos as well as the majority of their videography gigs.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8471562/

Sian Laycock – Production Designer

Bio: Sian Laycock is a Brisbane based production and costume designer, most recently having worked on Screen Queensland funded short films, Ascension (2017) and Little Dead Bird (2018). While completing her Bachelor’s Degree in Film and Screen Media Production, Sian has been jumping from set to set around Brisbane and the Gold Coast, working with many different and renowned filmmakers to hone her craft.

Michael Angelo Monaco – Sound Designer / Recordist

Bio: Michael is an experienced Sound Designer with a demonstrated history of working in the film & audio industry. Skilled in Pro Tools, Audio Processing, Audio Post Production, Mix Engineering, and Field Recording, Michael is a great addition to our team. Michael has worked on numerous projects around Australia, most recently being Ascension (2017) and Pizza Deliverance (2018), which are both screening around the country and internationally. With a Bachelor of Audio Production from SAE Institute and a Bachelor of Film & Screen Media from Griffith Film School, Michael is keen to showcase his varied skill set on Remus & Ron.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4047506/

PREVIOUS WORK:

Below you can find some of the previous work by the director and crew:

 

The Remus and Ron official social media pages can be found at the links below:

https://www.facebook.com/RemusAndRonShortFilm

THANK YOU!!!
story_txt:
PLOT
Remus and Ron tells the story of how Remus a 35-year-old eccentric and awkward man ended up in the back of a police car arrested for murder. He looks back on his childhood and reminisces on how he turned out so different from his identical twin brother Ron, despite being inflicted the same bizarre and abusive upbringing.  Exploring themes of nurture vs nature and twisting the stereotypes of a conventional serial thriller, Remus and Ron is a dark and disturbing look at how one twin could be so evil and the other so caring.


STYLE
Remus and Ron is currently being pitched as a mix of Taxi Driver, Dead Ringers, and Mindhunter. The influence of David Fincher’s Mindhunter is not just evident in the story’s exploration of psychopaths but also in the cinematography and directing style. The dark contrasty look of Fincher’s TV and films, plus his smooth cinematic camera style, and precise performances are a massive influence on this film. 
Any filmmakers planning to make a twin film need to study David Cronenberg’s masterpiece Dead Ringers featuring the duel performance by Jeremy Irons. And the filmmakers of Remus and Ron have deeply studied it and it’s making of and will be using similar split screen techniques to bring our multiple duel-performances film to life.
There is no movie out there that has succeeded better than Martin Scorsese’s Taxi Driver at immersing the audience into the head of a character. Using similar voice-over, slow-paced editing, sound design, and scoring techniques as (one of the director’s favourite films) Taxi Driver that is exactly what we aim to achieve with Remus and Ron.


WHY MAKE THE FILM:
Not only is this a great opportunity for the cast to show off their acting skills by acting opposite themselves on screen, this short will also be a big step up in the crew’s future career as feature filmmakers. Despite having multiple award winning short film credits the crew are currently in a grey zone of too inexperienced to receive Government funding but without funding can’t gain that needed experience. This is also an opportunity for the crew to explore a darker side of their story telling skills, something the writer/director in particular has been itching to do. 


BUDGET BREAKDOWN:
BY DEPARTMENT:Production Design - $3,500Camera & Lighting - $5,000Locations - $2,600Management & Unit - $1,300Crew Fees - $600Total: $13,000
Print & Advertising budget: $2000
Complete budget - $15,000


CAST:
WILL KELLY - Adult Remus/Ron

Bio: Will has over 15 years’ experience in Theatre, Film and Television. He has won numerous awards for both acting and producing. Theatre credits include: RENT, Jesus Christ Superstar and Jekyll and Hyde: The Musical alongside Australian Musical legend Rob Guest. Film and television credits include Hoges: the Paul Hogan Story for Channel 7 as well as many award winning short films that have screened at film festivals around the world including The Insect & the Alien, SHAKES and SEASON. He has starred alongside Guy Edmonds (A Very Moody Christmas), Luke Cosgrove (Stephen King's The Mist) and Christopher Sommers (HARROW, The Bureau of Magical Things).
Statement: Every experience is relative. I was drawn to the challenge of playing twins who experience the same life events but interpret them in completely different ways, and how that drives their very different responses. Both believing they see the experience of their childhood as it truly happened as opposed to simply seeing it through their relative interpretation.
CURTIS HENDRICKX - Child Remus/Ron

Bio: Curtis Hendrickx is a young Brisbane actor on the rise. He has appeared in numerous short films and music videos, as well as adverts for Hallmark Homes and Vuly Trampolines. He was recently one of the featured artists in the RACQ Banks print and TV commercials and was also cast as a lead actor in a new coming of age feature film shot on the Gold Coast and due for release in November 2018. He is now excitedly preparing for the challenging role of twins in the upcoming short film Remus and Ron.
Statement: Curtis states that his goal is to show the diversity of his acting ability in being able to pull off being two characters that are identical in looks but have character traits that are miles apart.
“My inspiration for this role is from personal experience, observing friends, and the great script that I've read with the surprising twist in it. I want to portray the emotion that is so well written in the young characters, to justify the actions for the older characters behaviour.  I am looking forward to working with Branden and his professional team on this production and thank him for this amazing opportunity.”
MICHAEL CUCKSON - Constable Henry Belcalf 

Bio: Michael Cuckson is an Australian actor and voice over artist. For the past 10 years he has worked extensively as an actor for stage and screen, a voice over artist and presenter. His television credits include Sea Patrol, Secrets and Lies and the tele-movie Fatal Honeymoon. Last year he was involved in the shorts The Undoing of Kate Burchell and Freudenstein. He is excited to join Remus & Ron as Constable Henry Belcalf. 
MARIKA MAROSSZEKY - Mrs Wellington, Remus and Ron's Mother

Bio: Marika Marosszeky is a Canadian/Australian actress based in Queensland.  Since completing her acting program at the University of Toronto, she has performed both in various Canadian and Australian theatre/tv/film productions.  Notable performances include playing Juliet in Classical Theatre Project’s ‘Romeo and Juliet’ in Toronto, and playing Sheila in award winning Australian short film ‘The Bus Knight’.  She most recently performed in a staged reading of ‘Savage in Limbo’ by John Patrick Shanley (Linda Rotunda) in Brisbane’s ‘The Lucky Duck’, which will also be playing in early 2019.  She also plays Shaz in ‘Smoko’, a new television series currently featured online.  Marika is also thrilled to have recently joined the teaching team at The fACTORy Acting Studio in Brisbane’s West End.
Statement: Playing the role of Mrs. Wellington comes as a welcome challenge to Marika.  Although Mrs. Wellington’s behavior is abusive and abhorrent, Marika sees her as a lost soul who has never been able to recover from her deeply wounding childhood scars.  She aims to approach the role with compassion, to find the humanity of Mrs. Wellington.

Bio: Branden graduated from Griffith Film School in 2017 and his career since has mostly consisted of directing music videos for such clients as Tia Gostelow (Triple J Unearthed High and Qld Music Award Winner) and Ian 'Dicko' Dickson (Australian Idol). story:
A Splash UpStream

Hello and welcome, all!

The short you just watched, "Pasta Primavera", is the prelude to our upcoming short film in which Jim (the guy that yacked all over the place) goes to the doctor and has one hell of an experience when his routine physical exam goes off the rails.

Filmmaking aside for a moment as we would like to first introduce ourselves and further describe the purpose of our campaign. We are Roger Turner Jr and Dylan J. Murphy, the founders of UpStream Films, and we thank you for paying a visit and checking out our profile! This Summer on July 9-11th we are shooting our latest short film titled "Physical", which has gained esteem on the short film screenplay competition over the last six months. Not to mention, this will be our seventh short film production since 2016, and given the recent success of the script for "Physical", we can hardly wait to shoot it! 

This campaign for our production provides us with the unique opportunity to not only finance our film, which will be shot on-location in Brooklyn, New York, but also the chance to generate a viable following for our film via the Internet, social media, and even film festivals. Our ultimate goal is for this short film to be selected for major film festivals such as the Sundance Film Festival, Tribeca Film Festival, and many others of equal caliber. To achieve this goal, we have culminated a cast of trained actors and a crew with in-depth knowledge and experience in the indie filmmaking world. Over the last five years we have devoted ourselves to our passion for acting, directing, writing, and storytelling and the production of "Physical" is a product of our commitment to put our best work on display.

In February 2020, Dylan began writing "Physical" from an idea about a neurotic guy in a doctor's office. Eventually, he wrote the script and began entering the final draft into film festivals in mid to late 2020. Low and behold, Dylan (the actor) had a script that was ranked among the Top 20 comedy short scripts on coverfly.com for the months of October 2020 and currently ranked #18 in the month of April 2021. It has been incredible to see the surge of positive feedback the script has received from judges at competitions like the Atlanta Screenplay Competition and Screencraft Short Comedy Competiton to name a few, which has ultimately inspired us to pursue bringing this script to screen.

Based on the critical acclaim the script for "Physical" has received prior to production, we are confident bringing this story to life will provide the opportunity to produce our dark comedy feature screenplay, "That's My Time", which is an even darker concept based directly off of Jim's experience in "Physical". The two projects are complimentary of one another as the story advances to an even more shocking ending than what Jim experiences in "Pasta Primavera" and "Physical". All things considered, the goal of our campaign is to raise enough funds to cover all associated location, professional equipment, cast, crew, insurance, and post production fees. If independently producing short films over the last five years has taught us anything, it is that you cannot achieve your true potential on your own. Any and all support towards our campaign goal is greatly appreciated!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking any and all contributions toward our campaign to account for all expenses related to shooting in New York City this July as well as all post production fees once the film hits the festival circuit. With this in mind, any contributions of $100 or more will receive a pre-screening of "Physical" before its release. Finally, all contributions of $2,500 or more will receive an Executive Producer credit as well as a prioritized share of 10% of any potential streaming profit the film receives through distribution. 

Our expenses are as follows:

LOCATION

-Daily rate of $1,000

EQUIPMENT

-Camera & Camera Lenses (RED Komodo 8K RAW and Canon R5)

-Audio (Microphone, sound mixer, boom, ...)

-Lights (LED panels)

-Transportation/Storage

-Production Materials/Additional Hardware

CAST/CREW/OTHER SERVICES

We will be working with trained SAG-AFTRA actors and actresses in this film who require the SAG minimum daily rate for their time on set. The current minimum SAG daily rate for union members $125.

Cast and crew members will be provided a meal and snacks throughout the duration of production. Lunch will be catered and/or provided to all cast and crew each day on set, and any contributions provided will be used in part toward those expenses. 

While we don't plan on getting sued, we are taking precautionary measures to ensure ourselves by getting insured. Contributions received will also go towards any insurance premiums or fees accessed to us during the making of this film. 

*Additional expenses including transportation, union, and other miscellaneous fees are also accounted for in "Physical's" line budget as "Other Services".

POST PRODUCTION

Once production is complete, the film will be edited and submitted to film festivals. The submission fees associated with the film festivals we intend to enter range from $40-$100 depending on the submission timing and the quality of the film festival. All contributions received will also be directed toward film festival expenses, including submission fees and attending film festivals if selected.

 

Setting/Location

The production for "Physical" will take place the weekend of July 9-11th, 2021 in Bayridge, New York. The total cast and crew will total approximately 20 individuals with backgrounds in writing, acting, producing, and on-set experience. 

 

Any Questions?

If you want to know more about us, our past work, or have more questions about how you can get involved in the making of "Physical", please feel free to reach out to us via email 

upstreamfilmsco@gmail.com

You can also watch all of our past work on our website as well as listen to our podcast The List, a weekly podcast in which we discuss our favorite movies.

upstreamfilms.tv

 

Other Ways To Support

We understand if you are unable to contribute to our campaign financially and encourage you to still support UpStream by visiting our website upstreamfilms.tv and sharing our work among your social networks. Please also don't hesitate to reach out with any words of encouragement and follow us on social media. We thank you all for supporting the dream!

Twitter: @rogerturnerjr | @DylanJohnMurphy

Instagram: @rogerzworld | @dylan_john_murphy

Facebook: Roger Turner | Dylan Murphy

story:
What we're about

Hi, I'm Andrea Garcia! I'm a 4th year first-generation Latina student at Westmont College but I'm originally from Hawthorne, CA. I'm obtaining a B.A. in Business/Economics along with a minor in Film Studies. I have previously worked with nonprofits, such as Child Home International, on commission video editing work to help support their goals and projects. Just last year I assisted in documenting and editing together interviews with homeowners/renters, businessmen and women, and those personally experiencing homelessness in Santa Barbara for a reconciliation summit in order to bring together the community into common ground on why we should all care about a rise in the number of those experiencing homelessness in this city. During this process, I noticed that East Side Santa Barbara in particular was impacted a lot if not the most by this issue. And yet, nobody outside of the East Side really knows its history or struggles despite the fact it holds valuable resources such as Path (a homeless shelter), amazing family-owned restaurants as well, housing for Westmont College students and many remain in East Side Santa Barbara post-college or during the summers, markets and convenience stores, and is just as a whole is very essential in a lot of people's lives and has amazing people. Thus, it is important to educate ourselves, even just a little bit, on the history and current struggles and triumphs of the community we are living in. It is also very important to take the time to understand the needs, concerns, and wants of this community, which includes those experiencing homelessness. They all deserve the best and deserve a documentary that is professional and well put together. None of that can be possible without help from you though. That help can look like so many things: it can be a small donation or a larger donation, it can be sending out this link to others, and it can be continued support from you. 

 

What we need your help with

I want to keep this process as simple and comfortable as possible for everybody involved. That being said, the equipment you would be funding has been researched and carefully selected with that in mind. As larger, more high-tech cameras can be intimidating, I have opted to use Moment iPhone lenses. They're smaller so hopefully, they're less daunting, and despite their size, they offer a more professional, sleek feel to pictures and videos. Thus, none of the professionalism or quality is lost. At the moment only two lenses are going to be used (Wide 18mm and Anamorphic Lens-Blue Flare). Both come out to a total of $249.99 and with the case necessary to mount them it comes out to $274.98. The OM 5 Smartphone Gimbal is $159.99 and will be used to stabilize videos in recordings as well as act as a tripod for interviews. The last bit for the making of the documentary is Adobe Premiere Pro to edit everything together which works on a monthly basis so 4 months total for $83.96. I am also asking for $100 or more in order to buy food, water, hygiene products, pet supplies, and other things for those experiencing homelessness. As the target goal may not be met, I will cut out the Gimbal and a lense if necessary in order to keep a good portion of the proceeds for those necessities for those experiencing homelessness.  

 

The impact

Your help can bring a very important history and story to light and hopefully make a difference in this topic. As I understand that none of this would be possible without your help, I am providing my email (andgarcia@westmont.edu). Please reach out to me if you have any questions, as I am more than happy to answer them. I want to be as transparent as possible and bring you along for the journey. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't or don't want to donate that's ok! As mentioned before, your belief and support of this project are also very important. You can also share this campaign with others!

I want to keep this process as simple and comfortable as possible for everybody involved. That being said, the equipment you would be funding has been researched and carefully selected with that in mind. As larger, more high-tech cameras can be intimidating, I have opted to use Moment iPhone lenses. They're smaller so hopefully, they're less daunting, and despite their size, they offer a more professional, sleek feel to pictures and videos. Thus, none of the professionalism or quality is lost. At the moment only two lenses are going to be used (Wide 18mm and Anamorphic Lens-Blue Flare). Both come out to a total of $249.99 and with the case necessary to mount them it comes out to $274.98. The OM 5 Smartphone Gimbal is $159.99 and will be used to stabilize videos in recordings as well as act as a tripod for interviews. The last bit for the making of the documentary is Adobe Premiere Pro to edit everything together which works on a monthly basis so 4 months total for $83.96. I am also asking for $100 or more in order to buy food, water, hygiene products, pet supplies, and other things for those experiencing homelessness. As the target goal may not be met, I will cut out the Gimbal and a lense if necessary in order to keep a good portion of the proceeds for those necessities for those experiencing homelessness.  
 

The impact
Your help can bring a very important history and story to light and hopefully make a difference in this topic. As I understand that none of this would be possible without your help, I am providing my email (andgarcia@westmont.edu). Please reach out to me if you have any questions, as I am more than happy to answer them. I want to be as transparent as possible and bring you along for the journey. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't or don't want to donate that's ok! As mentioned before, your belief and support of this project are also very important. You can also share this campaign with others!

story:
Short Summary

The Elsewhere is a thriller horror story that will make you feel helpless, claustrophobic and anxious. We first meet Emma as she awakens after a night of celebrating and immediately see that something is not quite right. She is unable to speak or hear and makes a terrifying discovery that changes her life forever. 

This is a passion project that we strongly believe will garner a warm welcome and fast growing fan base. It's genre deals with the four quadrants of our human experience: The Physical, The Mental, The Emotional and The Spiritual.  

Our goal is to use this short film to pave the way for the full length feature film. With your help, we will make a great movie that you will enjoy and be proud to say you helped make it happen.  

We are excited you have decided to join us on this journey and Thank You from the depth of our hearts.

Meet The Team

Kerry Fleming - Director/Producer/Writer

Kerry Fleming co-wrote the horror thriller Rock Paper Scissors with three-time Emmy Award winning writer Victor Miller who created the Friday the 13th franchise. It was through Mr. Fleming’s tireless efforts the production acquired a domestic distribution agreement with Grindstone/Lionsgate for a domestic release and Vertical Entertainment for international sales.

Kerry has recently produced the drama, Rainbow Door, in which he also appears in a supporting actor role. He is producing the upcoming supernatural horror Something’s on the Roof, the horror musical Tribute, horror film Devilwood, and romantic comedy, Danny August.  

The Elsewhere will be Kerry's directorial debut. 

Outside of making movies, Kerry enjoys spending time with his family and sweet little dog, Cocoa Chanel.

You can check out his IMDB page for more of his work. 

Shanda Renee - Lead - Role of Emma)/Producer

Actress/Writer/Producer Shanda Renee, is a long time actress in both theatre and film. She has worked along side Helen Mirren in movies like Raising Helen starring Kate Hudson, The Princess Diaries 2 starring Anne Hathaway and was in the award winning thriller/horror Rock Paper Scissors. She and Kerry have been friends ever since and joined up to produce The Elsewhere. Shanda enjoys all things movie making, writing, and creative.

She just wrapped two feature films and is excited to come on board not only as the lead actor in our film, but also as one of the producers. 

In her spare time she enjoys travel, photography, humanitarian work and spending time with her Pomeranian Riley.

You can check out her IMDB page for more of her work. 

 Eva Hamilton - Role of Jasmine

Eva Hamilton was born as Eva Susan Hamilton. She is an actress and producer, known for Ruin Me (2017), Death Kiss (2018) and The Swing of Things (2020). We are thrilled to have her play the role of Jasmine! 

When Eva isn't on set, she loves to travel! 

You can check out her IMDB page for more of her work. 

Mathew Young (Maty J) - Director of Photography

Our cinematographer is Maty Young. 

Mathew Young is an actor and cinematographer, known for VeeBees (2019), WAR (2019) and Vulture (2020).

You can check out his IMDB page for more of his work. 

That's a Wrap! (On Principle Photography)

It started with two! Kerry Fleming and Shanda Renee. Nearly a year later, not without some hurdles and challenges, all to be expected, we completed several drafts of a script, we brought our characters to life with our brilliant cast, we hired an amazing team and crew, and we shot a movie! 

We are now in post production, bringing this gem together with editing, special effects, and music! 

We still need you! 

Because of those challenges, you can check the latest update to read about that, we are in the red zone and need just a bit more to get us over the finish line.

By getting involved with our campaign you will be the first to get the updates on the progress of our movie in it's post production stages, film festival submissions and acceptance, awards and of course, opportunities to see the movie before it ever goes public!

What We Need & What You Get

Making movies is not cheap. And although movies create magic, magic cannot create movies. It takes time, skill, dedication, a strong team and a lot of hard work.

Oh and it takes all this too:

  • Locations
  • Talent
  • Props
  • Transportation
  • Camera Equipment
  • Wardrobe, Hair, Makeup
  • Lighting 
  • Food to feed the Cast and Crew
  • Sound, Editing and Post Production
  • Film Festival Submissions 
  • and more...

That all costs money. 

Your contribution directly goes to paying for all of that, so we can produce and deliver to you, a great movie. 

Not only will you get the bragging rights to say you helped make a movie, we have also created a variety of fun perks we think you will love!

  • Things like having your name in the credits as a special thank you!
  • An invitation to our VIP lounge to mingle with our cast and crew.
  • A visit to set!
  • Even the opportunity to get your IMDB Credit as an Associate Producer or even, an Executive Producer!

There are many perks for any budget. Check them out now and pick the one that works for you.

The Impact

We are in the business of entertaining and story telling through the art of motion picture. 

  • The completion of this short film will allow us to submit to many film festivals to help us achieve our next goal of funding and producing the full feature length film. 
  • Our team members have written, produced and acted in many large scale productions that have garnered awards and made millions in the box office. 
  • Your contribution allows us to meet our goal and get our movie made. 

Risks & Challenges

Not every project goes as planned but our goal is to be sure that no matter what challenges we may face, that we will take them as opportunities to grow and learn. 

  • Our team has been in the film industry for many years and is ready to face any challenge head on. Knowing, when there is a will, there is a way.
  • We have skill, vision and professionalism in order to overcome any obstacle. 
  • Should we not meet our financial goal, we will decide to either return the money to our backers or move forward with a lesser budget. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone will be able to financially contribute to our project. There are other great ways you can help us reach our goal:

  • Please take a quick moment to copy and share our campaign link to your social media pages.
  • You can easily use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word. 
  • Follow us on our IG page www.instagram.com/theelsewheremovie 
  • Check out our website www.theelsewheremovie.com 
  • Our IMDB page https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13059238/?ref_=nm_...
  • Join our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/The-Elsewhere-Movie-10...

Thank you for being a part of The Elsewhere Movie!

story:
My name is Dedric Turner.  I am the founder and CEO of Turner Custom Films and Turner Custom Service.  I am a film producer, writer, director, editor, private contractor, home builder and construction and maintenance supervisor.  I have been in the entertainment industry for over 15 years.  I began producing films when my grandfather, Roosevelt Hendon, died.  Since then, I have produced a variety of short films, music videos and documentaries.

This campaign was created to help fund the feature film, Home Invasion, that was written and directed by me and inspired by EJ Maiden.  Home Invasion is a full feature action film about a young girl named Diamond who witnessed the tragic death of her family at the age of ten during a home invasion. 

This campaign is important because it will help defray the cost of production.  It will also help market Home Invasion so that it will be released in 2018.  Contributors will help us fund this film and give our audience a great action packed movie to enjoy.   I also have a vision to help at risk youth by offering film classes to help them acquire skills to obtain a career in the film or entertainment industry one day. 

This project is a powerful film that shows the real emotions of a child who experiences the loss of her parents at a young age who seeks revenge.  We offer 5 perks which are listed below to those who would like to support this campaign.  

$25 Silver Perk - Home Invasion/Diamond Dog Tag

$50 Gold Perk - Home Invasion T-Shirt

$100 Platinum Perk - Home Invasion/Diamond Dog Tag, Home Invasion T-Shirt (2), Regular Home Invasion Ticket (2)

$500 Emerald Perk - Home Invasion/Diamond Dog Tag (2), Home Invasion T-Shirt (4), VIP Home Invasion Ticket (2), Regular Home Invasion Ticket (2)

$1,000 Diamond Perk - Home Invasion/Diamond Dog Tag (2), Home Invasion T-Shirt (4), VIP Home Invasion Ticket (4)

story:
Due to the outstanding and generous support we received from the first campaign, we have decided to re-open crowdfunding to the public for just 3 more weeks!

 

About the film...

Women By The Sea is Ruby Rees' (Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries, Picnic At Hanging Rock) debut feature film. Set over one weekend at the picturesque Phillip Island, Victoria, the film explores the relationships between five women, friends since childhood as they embark on a weekend away together and attempt to reconnect after years apart. At it's heart this film is a story of female endurance, of the complex and powerful bonds that bind women to one another, oh and paintball...

What We Need 

We're asking for $10,000 which in the world of film making is actually nothing major, but it will make a huge difference to this production. These funds will go towards key production costs including; 

Development Workshops with Cast 

Travel Costs

Catering for the Cast and Crew 

Hot Water Bottles, Scarves and Warm Coats for Cold Actors 

Art Department Needs (So the final product looks the best it can for you guys!)

Scroll down on our campaign to check out the prizes you receive for supporting this project, and pledging. We'll keep adding to them, so keep checking back!

The Impact

We're hoping that the Impact of supporting a film employing females only will be monumental in the future of how we make Film and Television. In the last 12 months we have been witness to the beginning of the modern revolution, with females speaking out again inequality and sexism across all industries. Women are calling out harassment, abuse, unequal pay and employment opportunities. It is our time, and our time is long overdue. By making a film and employing women only to do it, we are shining a spotlight on an industry that for too long has been accepted as a "boys club". The world wants to hear from the minorities now, and while we are only one project, we hope that this film, and the story behind it will make enough of an impact that we start to see inclusion riders on every single Australian Screen Project in the future. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone is in a position to pledge, here are some other ways you can support Women By The Sea 

Tell people about us! Even if you can't help, maybe you know someone who can, tell them about us, or simply share our campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat. Hell! Share it on Tinder if you want to.

Follow us! In the film world the more people interested in a project the more likely we are to get in front of backers, buyers, audiences, so like our posts and follow the journey!

Ruby Rees: @rubes_rees Hayley Sorel: @haylz1er 

Talk about Women In Film. We are hoping that we are just the beginning of a new chapter for the Australian Arts Industry. Inclusion of minorities in stories, on sets, in writers rooms, on our screens, and in the zeitgeist is the big picture goal here, so support projects that include minorities and make it the new norm, not the exception!

story:
Short Summary

We hope you can support my associates and I in producing my second film but first short horror. My first film "What If?" has been accepted into the Gender Reel Film Festival in Minnesota.

  • I have always been passionate about the film industry ever since I was a kid. I realized late in life it is never too late to follow your dreams.  In 2017 I started principle acting earning, a few roles in various productions. Now I am focusing on film making. I produced my first film "What If?" a short film on suicide prevention and awareness. 
  • As a transgender film maker I am hoping to overcome the barriers and stigma transgender people face. Over coming challenges can be so rewarding.
  • I dare to be different! It is my dream and goal to produce a film. That is both entertaining, creatively stimulating and leaves the audience wanting more.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for contributions to cover our production costs, .

  • Approximately CAD $1,850 to cover the following:
  • location, transportation and props
  • Craft table 
  • Hair make up & wardrobe
  • Camera and sound equipment hire
  • Editing
  • Create an app which resembles the synopsis of the film 
  • Entree fees to major International Film Festivals
  • Our hope is to be able to pay cast and crew, additional $1,675
  • All contributors will be listed on the credits
  • Any contribution $200 or more will be credited as an Executive Producer.
  • All contributors will have a share in this film if any profit are made.  $1 = 1 share.

The Impact

  • Proudly be part of a film that will stand out creatively 
  • This is my second film.
  • I have a creative experienced D.O.P. and crew on board to produce this film. 

Risks & Challenges

  • One of our big costs is the location fees for some of our scenes. I believe the locations will bring great value to the film.
  • One of our challenges will be to create the very important Demon scene. With a experienced D.O.P. we are confident of the outcome.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • If you are unable to contribute please share this campaign. Your help will greatly be appreciated.  
  • Craft table is very important to feed the cast and crew during long days of filming. If you own a restaurant or catering service. Any contribution would be appreciated.
  • Please feel free to contact us if you feel you can contribute in any other way.

We hope you can come aboard  and help realize this exciting project.

story:
No Leg Birds 

Written, produced and directed by Sonja Berta. She is an artist, film-maker and photographer based in Zurich, Switzerland. Her mother is from Vaasa, Finland, and her father grew up in the Swiss mountains. If Sonja could become a bird, she would be a parrot. Colorful, curious and playful.

 

No Leg Birds is her third and biggest short film project so far. Trusted by two Swiss sponsors, Sonja produced and shot the film within 4 months in New York City. Having worked with incredibly talented people from all over the world, No Leg Birds is a raw diamond waiting for postproduction.

This is where it all comes together! And you can support us to get the best out of the

  • edit
  • cut
  • sound design
  • color grading
  • submitting for festivals
  • and getting screened!  

 

The Cast

Daughter: Ayna Ashley - Katya Pylova
Mother: Ulya Ashley-Striemina - Aleksandra Myrna
Father : Jim - August Ashley - Budd Wood
Brother: Ilya Ashley - Nicholas Sosin
The parrots (Rachel, Kili and Truman) by the Parrot Wizard. 

Photograph taken on the set of No Leg Birds by Sonja Berta.

 

The Crew

Director, producer, writer: Sonja Berta

Cinematography, DP: Nicolas Vallejo

Steady Cam and AD: Juan Diego Puentes

by Magenta Films

Set Design: Espen Gjertzen Oydvin

Wardrobe Styling: Brooke Goldberg

Hair Styling: Rostème Cherchali

Make-up: Clara Rae

Art Assistant: Mariano Rubin de Celis

 

Our Goals

We would love to raise $5000 for postproduction and distribution. More is cool, too, of course! Every donation (no matter how big or small) is welcome and sooooooooooo highly appreciated. 

Renting a good studio, working with absolute pros in the cutting room, color grading (I love colors) and most importantly having a high quality sound design.
Especially the opening scene with the feathers falling in slow motion needs a beautiful soundscape. And just FYI: Sound design will be kept natural, clean and fluffy like a feather.

Running for festivals always requires an entry fee and we want to send it to the best festivals and if we get lucky, you get lucky, too, and we will be screened on a BIG screen. Yay!! 

 

Structures and Hurdles

Finding the necessary funding as an artist can be quite a challenge. Grants and state funding always require a lot of academic talk, draining paperwork and there's often a good portion of nepotism involved. However, I believe in my vision and I'm starting to learn about different ways to support my ideas, expanding my network and I hope to inspire others to keep going.

I'm very devoted to what I do and I have a lot of energy which all goes into my work. So, you'll be supporting an emerging artist in these challenging yet defining times of finding her own voice and getting it out there.

 

Your support can make this vision take shape! 

BECOME PART OF OUR TEAM!!!!
 

DONATE!!! 

and/or

HELP US TO SPREAD THE WORD!!!

SHARE, LIKE, SHARE, SHARE!!!

story_txt:
No Leg Birds 
Written, produced and directed by Sonja Berta. She is an artist, film-maker and photographer based in Zurich, Switzerland. Her mother is from Vaasa, Finland, and her father grew up in the Swiss mountains. If Sonja could become a bird, she would be a parrot. Colorful, curious and playful.

 
No Leg Birds is her third and biggest short film project so far. Trusted by two Swiss sponsors, Sonja produced and shot the film within 4 months in New York City. Having worked with incredibly talented people from all over the world, No Leg Birds is a raw diamond waiting for postproduction.
This is where it all comes together! And you can support us to get the best out of the

edit
cut
sound design
color grading
submitting for festivals

and getting screened!  



 
The Cast

Daughter: Ayna Ashley - Katya PylovaMother: Ulya Ashley-Striemina - Aleksandra MyrnaFather : Jim - August Ashley - Budd WoodBrother: Ilya Ashley - Nicholas SosinThe parrots (Rachel, Kili and Truman) by the Parrot Wizard. 
Photograph taken on the set of No Leg Birds by Sonja Berta.

by Magenta Films

Hair Styling: Rostème Cherchali
Make-up: Clara Rae
Art Assistant: Mariano Rubin de Celis
 
Our Goals
We would love to raise $5000 for postproduction and distribution. More is cool, too, of course! Every donation (no matter how big or small) is welcome and sooooooooooo highly appreciated. 
Renting a good studio, working with absolute pros in the cutting room, color grading (I love colors) and most importantly having a high quality sound design.Especially the opening scene with the feathers falling in slow motion needs a beautiful soundscape. And just FYI: Sound design will be kept natural, clean and fluffy like a feather. 
Running for festivals always requires an entry fee and we want to send it to the best festivals and if we get lucky, you get lucky, too, and we will be screened on a BIG screen. Yay!! 

 

Structures and Hurdles
Finding the necessary funding as an artist can be quite a challenge. Grants and state funding always require a lot of academic talk, draining paperwork and there's often a good portion of nepotism involved. However, I believe in my vision and I'm starting to learn about different ways to support my ideas, expanding my network and I hope to inspire others to keep going.
I'm very devoted to what I do and I have a lot of energy which all goes into my work. So, you'll be supporting an emerging artist in these challenging yet defining times of finding her own voice and getting it out there.
 
Your support can make this vision take shape!
